loans.name: Chimen

texts.en:
Chimen is 42 years old and has a farming business since 2002. She lives in Salyan region Yenikand village, married, has 2 children.
In he beginning of her business she borrowed a loan of $500 and bought 0,08 hectare plot of land. 
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 0,1 hectare plot of land. She plans to create apple garden.

loans.use: To buy 0,1 hectare plot of land

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz was born in 1957. She lives with her family in Salyan region Khaladj village, has 3 children. 
For the first time she borrowed a loan of $400 and built a stall.
For the second time she borrowed a loan of $600 and bought 10 sheeps. 
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 3 cows.

loans.use: To buy 3 cows

loans.name: Siddaling

texts.en:
Mr.Siddaling P. is a handicapped 19 year old bachelor living with 5 family members.  He was illiterate but has been attending night school and is now able to read and write.  He lives in a small village called Marapur in the Mudhol taluka of Bagalkot district in Karnataka, India.  He now does tailoring work in the village for Rs.50/- day.  He would like to shift to the dairy business by purchase of one she-buffalo.  By rearing this buffalo he will be able to get about 12-15 liters milk per day and he'll be able to earn an amount of Rs.125/- to Rs.150/- per day with a net profit of Rs.75/- to Rs.100/- per day.  


To purchase the buffalo he requires a loan amount of Rs.15000/-. 





*Due to Indian Government Regulations, your loan will be used to guarantee a low interest risk free loan from a local Indian source of funds to Somaiya.  Your loan to Siddaling will be used as "catalytic" debt, and local banks in India will loan Somaiya up to 10 times the amount raised on Kiva, greatly increasing Somaiya's capacity to loan to other entrepreneurs.  If Siddaling does not fully repay your loan, the funds will be converted to a grant and sent to Somaiya to cover the loss.



*As of January 2007 the exchange rate is 44.25 rupees to the US Dollar

loans.use: Siddaling would like to purchase one she-buffalo for 15,000 rupees to start his dairy

loans.name: Mirtahir

texts.en:
You can see in the picture a very cheerful, polite, sociable and kind person. 
This young man was born in Salyan region Khaladj village in 1958.
He has a lot of plans in connecing with his business.
One day he decided  to begin  to be busy with trade. 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and built a store. 
For the second time he borrowed a loan of $800 and bought food-stuffs 2 package sugar, 2 package granulaed sugar, tea, flour.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 o expand the area of his store and to buy food-stuffs.

loans.use: To expand he area of his store and o buy the food-suffs: sugar, tea and etc.

loans.name: Sudaba

texts.en:
This 44-year-old young woman lives in Salyan region Khaladj village. She is married, has a child.
For the second time he borrowed a loan of $400 and built a clothing store. 
Now she needs a loan of $1000 o expand area of the clothing store.
She has been engaged in this business for 4 years.

loans.use: To expand he area her shop

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He and his family settled in Sumgait city. Nizami was born in 1959. He is married, has 2 child. He sells of fruits and vegetables in his own car. He has not a shop. This car is his own. His car did not not work good. He had a problem with his car. This problem disturbed to him to expand his business.
Having borrowed a loan amount of $300, he repaired his car and bought the fruits and vegetables.
The second loan $500 he spent to buy 4 wheels and 1 accumulator and increased the amount of the fruits and vegetables. 
Now he needs a loan amount of $800 to build a shop. He plans to be busy with sale agricultural products.

loans.use: To build a shop. He plans to be busy with sale agricultural products.

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar with family settled in Sumgait city. She is 47 year old, Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli.
Having borrowed the loan $300 she bought the sewing-machine. She has been engaged in this business at her own home for 14 years. Buying the sewing-machine she thought that it is time to start business, but she did not enough money started her business. The second time she borrowed the loan amount of $500 to sew on a machine the genuine leather jackets, genuine leather clothes for the women. She has not a tailor’s shop. She has a lot of clients and her home is not comfortable for her business. These problems disturb her to improve her business. 
Bahar needs the loan of $700 to open her own tailor’s shop.

loans.use: To open her own tailor’s shop.

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en:
Khanlar is married and has 2 children. Khanlar is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He started his busienss selling small loaf from her home. Since 2005 Khanlar has rented the bread oven and has been busy with production and sale of bread. Having borrowed first loan $200 he has bought 20 sacks of flour and expanded his business.
He applies for the loan $800 to increase the bread assortments.

loans.use: To increase the bread assortments and to expand his business.

loans.name: Mubarak

texts.en:
Mubarak is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region, settled in Sumgait city, has 4 children. This 59-year-old woman has been engaged in her business for 8 years. Mubarak sells women’s clothes. She supports her family with this business. 
Now she needs a loan amount of $250 to be busy with selling the street clothes and industrial goods.

loans.use: To be busy with selling the street clothes and industrial goods.

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra was born in Gubadli region of Azerbaijan. She is Internally Displaced Person (IDP). She settled with his family and 3 children in Sumgait. Difficulties of life forced them to start the business. She is the only breadwinner in the family. In the beginning she used to sell vegetables. By borrowing the loan amount of $300 she wants to buy refrigerator and improve condition of her family. 
Zohra applies for $300 to buy the refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy the refrigerator

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir has been engaged in the selling of food for the past six years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, relocated to Sumgait city. He is 54 years old and has three children. He owns a small shop where he sells various food products. He borrowed a loan of $400 from Normicro so he could buy new scales and to repair his shop. 
Now Tahir wants a loan for $600 to increase his assortment of fruits.

loans.use: To increase his assortment of fruits.

loans.name: Avelyne

texts.en: Evelyny lives in Vituka area in Dar es Salaam.After finishing a primary school she did not get a chance to go to secondary school.She was married to a primary school teacher.They had a hard time together as income generated by her husband job was not enough to support the family.Contribution from her husband helped her open a charcoal store near her residence.But since then her business has not grown due to limited capital.She usually faced with stockouts.She need to increase the size of the stock to smoothly run her charcoal business.She need a working capital boost of USD 400.

loans.use: Add stock of charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam.She is married and has three children.Two are in primary school,one in secondary school.Elizabeth runs a tailoring business in a rented premise near her residence.She has been in this business for three years now.Elizabeth is planning to increase the stock of sewing and tailoring materials.She recently get a lot of orders from nursery schools for uniforms for kids enrolled in these schools.The stock of sewing and tailoring materials she currently has cannot meet the orders.She is in need of USD 550 to have the right quantity of stock.

loans.use: Adding stock of sewing and tailoring materials

loans.name: Evodia

texts.en: Evodia is 29 years old,married with two children. Evodia had only primary education,her parents could not afford sending her to midlle school. After being married Evodia could not stand being a house wife only. She joined various ‘women empowering groups’ which in turn helped her build a network of friends who helped her start a business. Today Evodia runs two businesses successfully. She owns a charcoal store near her residence and a cloth shop in Tandika market. Evodia is enthuastic and optomistic about one day becoming a succesfull business-woman. Starting with her current businesses, she is planning to increase the size and stability of operations. She believes that operating in large scale helps in pushing costs down. She will use this loan to implement her plans.

loans.use: Add stock of cloths and charcoal

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija lives in Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with three children. Hadija owns a tailoring mart,where she produces cloths,bedsheets,bed covers,pillow cases and cushion covers. She emlpoyees three assistants to help her. She had training  in entrepreneurship and small business management from Youth Self Emloyment Foundation (YOSEFO). Hadija plans to improve her business by adding  raw materials to her stock. She has discovered a new source of very nice materials that none of her competitors knows about. She want to take advantage ofthis opportunity before it’s too late. She needs to add two sewing machines,employ one more assistant and increase her stock of sewing materials.This business expansion will help her increase income thus meet the needs of her family including school fees for her children.

loans.use: Purchasing sewing and Tailoring materials

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima lives in Vituka, Temeke District of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. Halima sells charcoal in a store located near her family house. She has been in this business for six years now. She realizes that depending on only one product as income generating business gives her no chance to improve her standard of living. She is planning to start selling charcoal cookers alongside the charcoal. She expects this new line of business will help her generate more income. She will also need to add more stock of charcoal, pay for rental fees and employ an assistant. The expansion plan will help Halima generate extra income as she has to pay school fees for her two sons who are in secondary school.

loans.use: ADD STOCK OF CHARCOAL

loans.name: Idd

texts.en: Idd lives in Lumo, Temeke District of Dar es Salaam. He is married with three children. Idd sells used clothes. He buys these clothes from wholesalers, mends them in his tailoring workshop in a rented premise near his home, and resells them in retail. Most used clothes need some modification before a resale. Some are undersized, oversized or torn. Idd owns one old sewing machine. He is planning to expand his business. He needs one more modern sewing machine. The new machine will increase the speed of repairing the clothes and hence efficiency. He is also planning to employ one assistant to facilitate his mission.

loans.use: ADD STOCK OF USED CLOTHES

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married with two children. He lives in the Kiwalani area in Dar es Salaam. He owns a shop near his residence where he sells sewing and tailoring materials.  The demand for these items has risen recently. This may be partly because of the start of a new academic year for the schools in  his area.  All of the primary and secondary students need new uniforms.  With his savings he managed to stock a few of these sewing materials. He cannot meet the demand for these items due to insufficient working capital.  He will use his loan to stock the necessary materials and expand his business.

loans.use: ADDING STOCK OF SEWING MATERIALS

loans.name: Katty

texts.en:
Katty has been making soy milk for four years. She learned this skill when she worked for a state-run day care center for children. One year ago she left and began to manufacture soy milk on her own. Currently she produces it in her own kitchen at home and she has a seller who places it. From Monday through Fiday she works on production beginning at 4:00 am, and at 7:00 she goes out to sell. This business has permitted her to have income and to buy her simple house made of cane.

She needs this loan to be able to buy a mill for grinding soybeans, and to buy a freezer with which she will be able to produce more soy milk and place it herself, since she already has clients.

Katty is 37 years old, she has 2 children in school and is a single mother. Since the beginning, she has been in charge of her children, she has her own house, bought through great sacrifice and hard work, and currently she is above water. Her aspiration is that her children study and aren't left without a profession, so she wants to strengthen the business since it is her only source of income. Katty is a very hardworking and responsible woman who struggles each day to improve her quality of life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Katty tiene 4 años en esta actividad, aprendió cuando trabajaba para una de las guarderías de niños del estado, salio hace un año y se puso a elaborar por su cuenta la leche de soya, actualmente ella las produce y tiene un vendedor que las coloca, en su propia cocina de su casa a acondicionado sus equipos, de lunes a viernes se dedica a producir, el movimiento de la producción es a partir de las 4:00 AM, a las 7:00 AM sale a vender. El negocio le ha permite tener ingresos y poder comprar su casa de caña.

Ella necesita el préstamo para poder comprar un molino para moler el grano de soya, y comprar una hielera, con esto ella puede producir más y colocar ya que sí tiene cliente.

Katty tiene 37 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos en la escuela, es madre soltera, desde el comienzo se a hecho cargo de sus hijos, tiene casa propia actualmente esta sobre el agua, es lo que ha podido comprar con mucho sacrificio del trabajo, su aspiración es que sus hijos estudien y no se queden sin profesión, fortalecer el negocio porque es su única fuente de ingresos, Katty es una mujer trabajadora y responsable lucha cada día por mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy a mill and freezer

payments.comment: Cancelación del crédito no se localiza al cliente.

loans.name: Bolívar

texts.en:
Bolívar has 5 years of experience manufacturing dressers for storing clothes. He left his native city and came to live near his uncle in Isla Trinitaira in Guayaquil, where he started to work, learned the profession, and slowly became independent. Two years ago her married, and his wife is in charge of buying the wood for the business, which is located in front of the place they live. They don't pay rent because they are caretakers for the place. They have steady clients who order products every week. They charge 50% in advance and the balance upon delivery. They work from Monday through Saturday. They are trying little by little to get ahead, because they are still paying on the used planing machine that they bought.

Bolívar needs this loan to buy another planing machine because he always has 2 employees working, and right now they need to take turns. This will permit production to increase.

Bolívar is 19 years old, with one child. His wife helps him in the business, especially buying the wood. They have been married just two years, and since they are very young they are trying to get ahead in their family life as well as their business. Their aspiration is to establish their business well and save to buy a home.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Bolívar tiene 5 años de experiencia en elaborar cómodas (cajoneras para guardar ropa), cuando salio de su ciudad natal vino donde su tío en Guayaquil en la Isla Trinitaria y comenzó a trabajar, aprendió el oficio y luego poco a poco se fue independizando hasta hace 2 años, se caso y su esposa es quien se encarga de comprar la madera para el negocio, el local esta al frente de donde viven y no pagan alquiler porque cuidan a su vez ese lugar, ellos tienen sus clientes fijos donde les piden los productos cada semana, cobran el 50% adelantado y el saldo contra entrega, trabajan de lunes a sábado, ellos poco a poco están tratando de salir adelante, porque todavía siguen pagando la máquina que sepilladora usada que compraron.

Él necesita el préstamo para comprar otra máquina sepilladora porque siempre tiene 2 empleados y tienen que turnarse, esto permitirá aumentar la producción.

Bolívar tiene 19 años, con un hijo, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio especialmente comprando la madera, ellos apenas tiene 2 años de casado, a pesar de ser muy joven tratan de salir adelante en la familia como en el negocio, su aspiración es establecer el negocio bien y ahorrar para su casa.

loans.use: To buy a planing machine

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria de Lourdes is mother of three little ones, is married and lives in the city of Monterrey in the state of Nuevo Leon. She is a very active and enterprising person, and this is how she started selling clothing, lingerie, and shoes among family and friends. She soon started to see an increase in her clients thanks to her great efforts and dedication. This business has been a great help for her family and it has allowed her to provide her family with a better quality of life. With only her husband's salary the family went without, especially because he is a labourer with only occassional contracts.

She now needs a loan in the amount of $275 to fill some of the outstanding orders that her clients have placed, and she will also use this loan to increase her inventory to increase her clients and her sales. Don't let Maria de Lourdes' efforts fall to the ground. You have the ability to help her and her family. They thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María de Lourdes es madre de tres pequeños, esta casada y vive en la localidad de Monterrey, en el estado de Nuevo León. Es una persona muy emprendedora y activa, es por ello que hace tres años comenzó a vender entre familiares y amigos ropa nueva, además de lencería y calzado por catálogo. Luego de un tiempo fue aumentando su cartera de clientes gracias a su gran esfuerzo y dedicación. Esta actividad ha sido de gran apoyo para su familia y gracias a esto ha podido brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, ya que sólo con el sueldo de su esposo enfrentaban muchas carencias, pues es albañil y su trabajo es eventual.

Ahora ella necesita un crédito por la cantidad de $ 275 DLLS para poder surtir algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes y que sus clientes le piden, además de poder surtir más mercancía para tener en existencia y aumentar su volumen de clientes y ventas. No dejes que se derrumbe lo que con tanto esfuerzo María de Lourdes ha construido, tu tiene la posibilidad de ayudarla, ella y sus familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alma Patricia

texts.en:
Alma lives in the city of Queretaro. Ten years ago she started selling cosmetics, as a very enterprising person, to contribute to the well being of her family and their quality of life. Given her great dedication and persistence in sales and the direction of her sales people, in a short time she was made manager. She has demonstrated that she is a very responsible and able person and she can conquer any goal becasue she is motivated by the love of her family.

Today she needs a loan of $475 that she will use toward the purchase of merchandise and to increase her sales and improve her income. You can contribute to Alma's development. Do not wait any longer and help her maintain what she has built with so much effort. She and her family thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma vive en la localidad de Querétaro, ella hace 10 años comenzó a dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos, pues es una persona muy emprendedora y ha luchado poder contribuir al bienestar y calidad de vida de su familia. Debido a su gran dedicación y empeño de las ventas y dirección de sus vendedoras, en un lapso corto de tiempo se convirtió en directora. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y capaz de llevar a cabo cualquier meta propuesta siempre impulsada por el amor a su familia.}

En este momento ella necesita de un crédito de $ 475 DLLS mismos que utilizará para la compra de mercancía, poder aumentar su nivel de ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de Alma, no lo dudes más y ayúdala a sostener lo que con tanto esfuerzo ha logrado construir. Ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purcahse mercahndise

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.en:
Her husband was left unemployed for some time so Maria de Jesus started selling various items (shoes, cosmetics, etc.) with the goal of giving her family a better quality of life and to cover some of the necessities of their home. She has demonstrated that she is a very responsible and dedicated person, always guided by the support and love of her family.

She now requires a loan in the amount of $1200 that she will use to purchase merchandise and this way increase her sales. Maria de Jesus plans to repay the full amount of the loan in a term of approximately 6 - 12 months. Do not wait any longer. Your generosity is of great help for her and her family. They thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Después de que su esposo queda desempleado durante un periodo, Maria de Jesús se dedica a la venta de varias marcas (zapatos, cosméticos, etc.) , con la finalidad de dar a su familia un mejor nivel de vida y cubrir algunas necesidades que surgieron en su hogar. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y dedicada con su labor, siempre guida por el apoyo y amor de su familia.

Ella ahora requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $1,200 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de mercancía y así poder incrementar sus ventas. María de Jesús planea cubrir el monto total del préstamo en un plazo de 6-12 meses aproximadamente. No dudes más tu generosidad puede ser de gran apoyo para ella y su familia, ellos te lo agardecederan sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Eladia

texts.en:
Mrs. Eladia L. is a very active and hard working woman. Some years ago she suffered the loss of her husband, and since then she has been made totally responsible for the upbriging of her children. Seeing that her husband's pension was not enough, six years ago she started selling juices and fruit in a small shop. Thanks to her business she has been able to pull her kids through despite the adversities that they have faced.

But in order for them to pass the health inspection they have to make upgrades and changes to their shop, and they need funds to make such changes. For this she needs a loan in the amount of $475 wich she plans to repay in full in a term of 6 - 12 months. You can help Eladia and her children. Don't wait any longer, it is up to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Eladia L. es una mujer muy trabajadora y activa, hace algunos años sufrió la perdida de esposo, entonces ella tuvo que hacerse totalmente responsable de la manutención de sus hijos. Al ver que el dinero de la pensión de su marido no era suficiente hace seis años comenzó a vender jugos en y frutas, en un local que adquirió por medio de un traspaso. Gracias a esta actividad ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos a pesar de las adversidades que han enfrentado.

Sin embargo para poder pasar la revisión de salubridad requería hacerle modificaciones y arreglos al local y necesitaba capital para dichas adecuaciones. Para ello necesita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475, mismo que planea cubrir en su totalidad en un plazo de 6-12 meses. Tu puedes ayudar a Eladia y a sus hijos, no lo dudes más, la decisión esta en tus manos.

loans.use: remodeling

loans.name: Erika Dinora

texts.en:
Erika is a young woman enthusiastic and active. She lives in the city of Queretaro. Some time ago she started working for a company but she soon realized that her salary was not enough to cover her expenses and her parents' expenses. This is when she decided to start her own business selling products by catalogue, that, with a great deal of effort and dedication, she has managed to develop and expand to date. This has granted her a better quality of life of herself and above all for her parents, they being senior citizens now.

She now requires a loan in the amount of 4475 that she plans to invest in fixing her car that she uses to visit her clients and fill the orders they place. This helps ease the work that she does and it decreases her costs, allowing her to add to her roster of clients. You can become part of Erika's successes. Help her continue developing. She will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Erika es una joven muy entusiasta y activa, ella vive en la localidad de Querétaro, empezó a trabajar hace tiempo en una empresa, sin embargo vio que con su sueldo no le alcanzaba para sus gastos y a la vez ayudar a sus padres. Entonces decidió iniciar el negocio de venta de productos por catálogo, que con esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado hacer crecer y mantener hasta la fecha. Esto le ha permitido una mejor calidad de vida para ella y sobre todo para sus padres, quienes ya son perronas grandes.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 DLLS, mismos que planea invertir en la reparación del coche que utiliza para poder visitar a sus clientes y surtir los pedidos de los mismos. Esto le facilita el trabajo, además que minimiza el tiempo que invierte en el traslado de la visita de un cliente a otro, esto disminuye los costos y hace que pueda aumentar su cartera de clientes. Tú puedes volverte parte de los logros de Erika, ayúdala a seguir creciendo y ella te lo va agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: car repair

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is a woman that has always succeeded at what she sets out to do, thanks to her virtures. She is singel and has one son, and lives in the city of Queretaro. She has always aimed to be a successful person but above all, she wants to provide her son with a promising future with an education, one that she can now provide him. This is why she started fixing and repairing shoes where she worked as an employee. Now she is the owner of the same shop, and every day she works to expand the business.

With the unconditional support of her son and her positive outlook, she has achieved great things. Today she requires a loan in the amount of $375 to expand her business and to purchase a compressor and fix a sewing machine. With your generosity you can help Graciela continue growing and continue providing an education for her son. Do not wait any longer. She thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela es una mujer que siempre ha logrado lo que se propone, gracias a sus virtudes, ella es soltera y tiene un hijo, vive en la localidad de Querétaro. Siempre ha luchado por ser una persona exitosa y sobre todo por brindarle a su hijo un futuro prometedor a través de la educación que ella le pueda ofrecer. Es por eso que hace tiempo comenzó a ahorrar y logro comprar el taller de reparación de calzado donde ella trabajaba como empleada, ahora es la propietaria, y cada día lucha más por hacerlo crecer.

Con el apoyo incondicional de su hijo y su buen ánimo ha logrado grandes cosas, en este momento ella requiere de un crédito por la cantidad de $375 DLLS para poder crecer, pues necesita comprar una compresora y arreglar una de las máquinas de coser con las que trabaja. Con tu generosidad tú puedes ayudar a Graciela a seguir creciendo y brindarle la educación a su hijo, no lo dudes más, ella te lo agradece.

loans.use: repair machine

loans.name: María Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is married and is mother to a little one of 8 years of age, lives in the city of Queretaro, where she has her business selling snacks. She dediced six years ago to start with this business following the economic problems faced by their household, given her husband's salary was so small. Thanks to this business she has been able to be of great help to her husband and she has been able to provide her children with a better quality of life. She has shown herself to be a very competent person, hard working, enterprising, and committed, for the love of her family.

Now she needs a loan of $750 to be able to remodel the shop where she makes her snacks. Thsi way she will be able to increase her sales and the place will look more attractive for her clients. Do not wiat, the decision is in your hands. She annd her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Soledad es casada y madre de un pequeño de 8 años de edad, vive en la localidad de Querétaro, lugar donde tiene un negocio de venta de antojitos. Ella decidió hace 6 años comenzar con esta actividad debido a los problemas económicos que enfrentaban en su hogar, pues el salario de su esposo es muy bajo. Gracias a esta actividad ha podido ser un gran apoyo para su esposo y ha logrado brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona sumamente capaz, trabajadora, emprendedora y comprometida por el amor a su familia.

Ahora ella necesita de un crédito de 750 DLLS para poder realizar una remodelación al el local donde elabora y vende sus productos alimenticios. De esta manera podrá incrementar sus ventas y ofrecer un lugar más agradable y atractivo para sus clientes. No lo dude más, la decisión esta en tus manos, y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: remodeling

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman and mother of 4 children of 7, 9, 10, and 12 years of age, and they all live in the city of Queretaro, Queretaro. In order to provide her family with a greater income, as her husband's job is casual and she was left unemployed, she started her own business selling and preparing seafood. She started with the support of her parents, who provided her with chairs and a table and an awning for her shop.

With a great deal of persistence she has been able to make this business the key to her family's wellbeing. Today she rquires a loan in the amount of $650 as she needs to pruchase her own chairs and tables to expand her business. She plans to repay the full sum of the loan in a term of 6 months. Conchita needs your support today. Do not wait any longer, and help her keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Conchita es una mujer casada y madre de 4 hijos de 7, 9,10 y 12 años de edad, vive en la localidad de Querétaro, Querétaro. Por la necesidad de aportar ingresos a su familia, ya que el empleo de su esposo es eventual y debido a que ella se quedó sin empleo y le fue imposible encontrar otro, comenzó su propio negocio, la venta y elaboración de mariscos. Ella inició con el apoyo de sus padres, quienes le proporcionaron las sillas, una mesa y un toldo para su puesto.

Ella ha puesto mucho empeño, pues de esta actividad depende el bienestar de su familia. En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 650 DLLS, pues quiere comprar sus propias sillas, más mesas y poder ampliar de esta forma su negocio. Ella planea cubrir el monto total del préstamo en un plazo de 6 meses. Conchita necesita de tu apoyo en este momento, no lo dudes más, ayúdala a seguir creciendo.

loans.use: purchase equipement

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
Lupita started her small business more than 5 years ago, a small grocery store run from her own home, while she still worked for her company. She realized that this double effort was needed because she is a single mother and has two little ones at home, 7 and 8 years old. Things have not been at all easy for Lupita, but the love for her children has motivated her to keep moving ahead. After she started her small business she was let go from her company job and now she dedicates herself full-time to her grocery store, the very same that she still manages today, with the active support of her children.

Now she needs fund to be able to stock her business with more merchandise and this way increase her sales to provide her children with the necessities, like an education. For this she requires a loan of $475. With your generosity you can help Lupita and her children. They need you and they thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Lupita comenzó hace más de 5 años con su pequeño negocio propio, una tiendita de abarrotes, en su propio domicilio, al mismo tiempo que se desempeñaba como emplead en una empresa. Ella tenía que realizar este doble esfuerzo debido a que es madre soltera, tiene dos pequeños de 7 y 8 años. Las cosas no han sido fáciles para Lupita, pero el amor a sus hijos la ha impulsado a seguir adelante. Tiempo después de iniciar su negocio, fue despedida y se dedicó por completo a la tienda de abarrotes, misma que hasta el momento mantiene, con el apoyo de activo de sus hijos.

Ahora ella necesita de capital para poder surtir su negocio con más mercancías y de esta forma poder incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario, como educación. Por ello requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS. Con tu generosidad puedes ayudar a Lupita y sus hijos, ellos te necesitan y te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
In the city of Escobedo lives Celia, she is married and is mother of 3 children of 19, 14, and 12 years of age. Her husband works as a driver for a company but his salary is small compared with the many expenses they have, such as schooling for the children and various monthly bills that they have. Given this situation Celia decided to help her husband to actively contribute to the financial well being of her family, which is why she started selling used clothing, with the objective of earning some extra income. With great effort and hard work Celia has realized her own success, now that she is able to provide her children with the education they need, giving them a more promising future.

Now she requires a loan of $275 that she will use to purchase more merchandise and increase her earnings and cover some of the costs she acquired when moving from place to place selling clothes. Do not wait any longer. Your generosity can bew of great help. Remember that she now needs you and that she thanks you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Escobedo vive Celia, es casada y es madre de 3 hijos, de 19, 14 y 12 años de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como chofer en una empresa, pero su sueldo es muy poco, comparado con los fuertes gastos que tienen que enfrentar, como en las colegiaturas de la escuela de sus hijos y los diversos pagos mensuales y semanales que hay que hacer de los servicios. Por esta situación Celia decidió ayudar a su esposo y contribuir activamente a l bienestar económico de su familia, por ello inició a vender ropa usada, con el objetivo de obtener algunos ingresos extras. El gran esfuerzo y trabajo que Celia ha realizado ha sido exitoso, pues ahora pude brindarle a todos sus hijos la educación que requieren y por ende un futuro más prometedor.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad $ 275 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en la compra de mercancía y poder de esta manera incrementar sus ganancia y solventar algunos de los gastos de traslado a los lugares de donde compra las pacas de ropa usada. No lo dudes más, tu generosidad puede ser gran ayuda, recuerda que ella te necesita ahora y te lo agrdece sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Norma

texts.en:
Miss Maria and her family, her husband and two children, whom are still minors, live in the city of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. Because their house is very small she started to help her family to improve their living conditions and be more financially stable. This is when, three years ago, she started making a selling foods from her own home. Her husband is a labourer and his employment is occassional which is why their income is so unsteady.

The commitment to her family and the will to pull them through has motivated Miss Maria to find a solution to their problems. But now she requires a loan in the amount of $375. Her primary goal is to ensure an education for her little ones, which is why she needs your help today. Become part of Miss Maria's and her family's successes.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña María y su familia, esposo y dos hijos, aun menores de edad, ellos viven en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León. Debido a que su casa en muy pequeña ella decidió ayudar a su familia a tener mejores condiciones de vida y una mayor estabilidad financiera, y entonces cuando, hace ya casi 3 años comenzó a elaborar y vender comida en su propio domicilio. Pues su marido es albañil y su trabajo es eventual, por lo que los ingresos no seguros.

El compromiso con su familia y las ganas de salir adelante impulsaron a Doña María a encontrar una solución a sus problemas, pero ahora ella requiere de un préstamo para continuar, por la cantidad de $375 DLLS. Su principal preocupación es asegurar el bienestar y educación de sus pequeños, es por ello que ahora necesita de tu ayuda, se parte de los logros Doña María y su familia.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe, who is married and is mother of two underage children, is a highly responsible person, strong and proactive. The household income has never been stable, as her husband has an occassional type of employment. Given the situation Guadalup started selling shoes by catalogue 4 years ago, for to help her family secure more income and this way be able to cover the tuition costs of her little ones.

Today she requires a loan in of $375 to be able to cover the strong demand for her products she is currently seeing and also to provide more variety for her clients. She plans to repay the loan in full in a term of approxiamtely 6 months. You can ensure the wellbeing of this family. They needs you and with your support they will manage to improve their living conditions and overcome their adversities.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe, quien es casada y madre de dos hijos aun menores de edad, es una persona altamente responsable, fuerte y proactiva. Los ingresos del hogar nunca son seguros en su hogar, pues su esposo posee un trabajo eventual. Es por esta situación por la que Guadalupe, hace ya 4 años comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, para de esta forma poder tener un poco más de ingresos y así logar hacer frente a los gastos de educación de sus pequeños.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de 375 DLLS para poder cubrir el fuerte pedido que tiene ahora y además de poder surtir más mercancía que ofrecer a sus clientes, mismos que planea regresar en su totalidad en un plazo de 6 meses aproximadamente. Tú puedes asegurar el bienestar de esta familia, ellos te necesitan, con tu apoyo lograran vivir mejor y vencer las adversidades.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Barbarita

texts.en:
In the city of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon, lives Maria Barbarita, who is mother of 2 little ones of 6 and 8 years of age. Three years ago, facing the lack of financial resources, so that the basic family necessities were not met, she looked for a way to help her husband to provide for their children a dignified quality of life. This is how she started selling cosmetics by catalogue. Now she has an important volume of clients thanks to her great effort and dedication, and of course, thanks to the moral support of her family.

She now requires a loan of $375 to improve the selection of the merchandise she offers and this way keep helping her family and give her children and education. She plans to repay the full amount of the loan in a term of 6 - 12 months. With your generosity you can help Maria Barbarita and her family. They need of your support. They will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, vive María Barbarita, quien es madre de 2 pequeños de 6 y 8 años de edad. Hace 3 años, ante la falta de recursos económicos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, ella buscó desde una actividad que le permitiera poder ayudar a su esposo y brindarles a sus hijos una calidad de vida digna. Es así como comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo. Ahora ya tiene una importante cantidad de clientes gracias a su gran esfuerzo y dedicación, y por supuesto al apoyo moral de su familia.

Ahora ella necesita de un crédito de 375 DLLS para surtir más mercancía y de esta forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia y darles educación a sus hijos. Ella planea cubrir el monto total del crédito en un plazo de 6-12 meses. Con tu generosidad puedes ayudar a María Barbarita y su familia, ellos ahora necesitan de tu apoyo y te lo van a agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is presently working with her husband to make bread, cakes, and pastries. Since she was a child, she had to work with her mother in the markets, selling vegetables, fruit, and clothes. When she got married, she didn't stop working because she had to support her husband in walking sales. Thanks to the effort of the two of them, they were able to save and bought a piece of land for their home in the Isla Trinitaria neighborhood. The business is located in their home, and they work there every day of the week from 5:00 am to 9:00 pm. In the bakery they also sell other products to go with bread such as: milk, cheese, butter, juice. Rosa also saw the opportunity to sell fast foods, so she goes out every afternoon with her cart and her stove to the corner and brings in more income for her household. Rosa wants this loan because she needs to increase her inventory to make bread. She needs certain utensils, and also wishes to renovate her display case for bread, which will certainly help them increase their income.

Rosa is 59 years old. She has one child who has already finished university. Her husband is her right hand in the business, and he has always supported her in everything. They are a family who come from the mountains, they are very humble, they were never able to go to school which is why they don't know how to read or write but they manage the accounts very well. Their charisma has helped them in dealing with people. Currently they have their house, which at first was made of cane, and bit by bit has been changed to cement. Their greatest satisfaction is to have given their daughter her education. Now she is a professional, who also helps with the business.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Rosa actualmente se dedica con su esposo hacer pan, pasteles y bocaditos, desde niña tuvo que trabajar con su madre en los mercados vendiendo legumbres, frutas, ropa; cuando se caso no dejó de trabajar porque tuvo que apoyar a su esposo en las ventas ambulantes, gracias al esfuerzo de ambos pudieron ahorrar y se compraron un terreno para su casa en la zona de la Isla Trinitaria. El negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio donde acondicionaron su local, lo atienden ambos todos los días de la semana de 5:00 AM hasta las 9:00 PM, en la panadería también venden otros productos para acompañar el pan como: leche, queso mantequilla, jugos. Rosa vio también la oportunidad de vender comida rápida, todas las tardes sale con su carreta y su fogón en la esquina de su casa, estos son otros ingresos para su hogar. Rosa desea el préstamo porque necesita incrementar su inventario para hacer el pan, y ciertos utensilios, a su vez desea renovar su vitrina exhibidora para el pan, esto les ayudara seguramente a incrementar sus ingresos.

Rosa tiene 59 años, tiene una hija que ya terminó su universidad, su esposo es su mano derecha en los negocios, siempre la ha apoyado en todo, son una familia que viene de la sierra ambos son muy humildes, nunca pudieron ir a la escuela y es así que ellos no saben leer ni escribir pero manejan muy bien las cuentas, su carisma les ha ayudado en el trato con las personas, actualmente tienen su casa que al principio fue de caña ahora poco a poco ya esta de cemento, su satisfacción más grande es haberle dado a su hija los estudios, ella ya es una profesional que también ayuda en el negocio.

loans.use: Flour and a display case

loans.name: Lider

texts.en:
Lider has a small pharmacy in his home. With 20 years of experience running this kind of business, his entire family is dedicated to this line of work, and he has worked with them and in other pharmaceutical businesses. 5 years ago he placed his business in his home so that his wife could work there, and he worked there on his days off. One year ago he left his other job and dedicated himself to his pharmacy. Their location is well placed where there is no competition and the service they offer is good because of his experience. They are open every day of the week, from 7:00 am until 10:00 pm.

He needs this loan in order to place orders for pharmaceuticals and take advantage of discounts, and to stock a display case with items related to babies and toddlers, for example diapers, bibs, milk, and gifts for children, since in that area there are many children.

Lider is 55 years old, with 3 children already in school. He is married, and his wife supports him in the business, especially when he isn't there. They are a very hardworking family. With mutual effort they have been able to buy their house and bit by bit they are remodeling it from cane to concrete block. They hope to grow in this business as it is the only source of income for the household.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Lider tiene una pequeña farmacia en su casa, con una experiencia de 20 años atendiendo estos tipos de locales, toda su familia se dedica a esta línea, él ha trabajado con ellos y en empresas farmacéuticas, hace 5 años puso su negocio en su casa para que su esposa lo lleve adelante y él lo hacia en sus días libres, hace un año lo despidieron de la empresa como no encuentra trabajo tomo la decisión de dedicarse a su farmacia, su local esta bien ubicado porque no hay competencia y el servicio que él brinda es bueno por su experiencia, ellos atienden todos los días de la semana, a partir de las 7:00AM hasta las 10:00 PM.

Él necesita el préstamo para poder realizar los pedidos a las farmacéuticas y aprovechar los descuentos, implementar en una de sus vitrinas lo que es todo lo relacionado para bebes y niños grandecitos, ya que en el sector lo que más hay son niños, es decir comprar: pañaleras, biberones, leche, regalos para niños.

Lider tiene 55 años de edad, con 3 hijos todavía están en el colegio, esta casado, su esposa le apoya en el negocio especialmente cuando él no se encuentra, son una familia muy trabajadora, con el esfuerzo mutuo han podido comprar su casa y remodelarla de caña a bloque, poco a poco la están cambiando, esperan crecer en el negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingreso para el hogar.

loans.use: to buy medicines and baby items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is a 37-year old entrepreneur.  She lives in Kisumu, Kenya, with her husband and three children.  She is known in her community as an expert in making such local favorites as chapattis (fried flat bread) and mandazzis (fried sweet dough).  However, the sale of these goods provides her an income of only Kshs 800 a day (approximately US$ 11.50).  The cost of raw materials and local competition has forced her to consider starting a different income-generating activity.  She will use the loan to invest in this small corner shop (pictured) adjacent to her home, where she will sell daily necessities like bread, flour, cooking oil and soap.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick O. is a 35-year old father of three school-aged children.  He lives in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya, and runs the longest- standing community pharmacy in his area.  He received his pharmacy certificate after finishing secondary school in 1993, and, for 13 years now, has been working in the same area (pictured).  As a result of the long years of his work, the community knows Patrick personally. The next closest dispensary in the area is far away; therefore, people prefer to go to him for advice and drugs.  Patrick has also been trained as a community health worker, and has been providing home-based care for people living with HIV/AIDS for the past three years. He sells drugs at lower prices than his competitors, and often gives free drugs to his clients or those in need. His best-selling products are painkillers, anti-malaria and family planning drugs, allergy medications, ulcer, worms and skin infection treatment, and various syrups for children suffering from malaria and upper respiratory infections. His vast knowledge and experience, as well as the positive attitude and kindness, have earned him a good reputation within his community.  His well-established business has been quite successful due to his loyal and numerous clients. Patrick has applied for a loan of Kshs 40,000 (approximately US$ 575), and intends to use it to further expand his community pharmacy.

loans.use: To expand and improve the pharmacy stock of his community

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet O. is a 44-year old dedicated community health worker (CHW). She lives in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya with her husband and eight children. Prior to 2002, she earned her income by selling second-hand clothes.  She was then trained by KMET in home-based HIV/AIDS care and was given a small stock of drugs as a start up kit.  Through her own initiative and hard work and supported by KMET Janet intends to use the loan to expand her business at the community pharmacy.  

As there is no chemist in her area, people come from quite a distance to buy drugs from her pharmacy. She moved her business to this more prominent and spacious location (pictured) two years ago in order to meet the growing demand.  Her friendly demeanor and approach to her clients and customers has earned her respect and a good reputation. The community likes her work and has grown accustomed to her, thus ensuring the successful continuity of her business.

loans.use: To improve the community pharmacy stock

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela A. is a 31-year old mother of four children and is expecting her fifth child.  Pamela and her husband live in Kisumu, Kenya.  Pamela has taken and successfully repaid two microfinance loans from KMET. She began selling clothing door-to-door in 1999 and has since expanded her business.  She currently rents the shop seen in this picture in which she sells clothes-making materials, shoes, purses, ties and other clothing items. She also employs a full-time tailor to meet her customers’ demands.  Pamela also volunteers her time as a community-health worker trained in home-based care.  She is thus well-known within her community. In addition, the central location of her shop and her many years of doing good business within the community have gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base.  Her business has done quite well due to the added advantage of access to loan funds; she intends to use the loan to increase her stock and materials and build a waiting bay for her clients.

loans.use: To increase her stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rebecca would like to increase the stock level.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Emily would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy beads materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Priscillah would like to buy beads for her beads work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ann would like to buy chickens for rearing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys wants to buy 3 steers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Phyllis would like to pay School fees for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to add electronics – battery charging machines, sockets, plugs adapters, heaters to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi  would like to buy chickens

loans.name: Lautaro

texts.en:
Lautaro owns a small store where he sells basic school and office supplies. He attained the capital for his business by borrowing $200 from local loan sharks who charge interest rates as high as 20% a month (120% a year). His business has gone well despite his difficulty in accessing capital. He has slowly been introducing new products to his store and has found success. He is requesting the loan because he wants to continue investing in products and he also wants to invest in a new glass display case. Lautaro and his wife have two young children. He completely depends on this business in order to support the family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products and buy a glass display

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry has a small shoe-making workshop. Henry started his business with the help of his wife and with $100 capital. Now he continues to sell sandals and shoes for all ages.

Henry will use this loan to invest in materials to make shoes and sandals for ladies and gentlemen. He also aspires to construct a location in his home for the workshop, and to be able to give work to those who need it. He has faith that with these new products, the business will grow.

Henry is the father of one son, he is married and is 29 years old. He has the hope that, with this loan, he will improve the quality of life for his family and give stability and growth to the business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) Henry tiene un pequeño taller de calzado. Henry empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposa y con un capital de 100 dólares. Se inicio vendiendo sandalias a sus amistades y familiares. Ahora el continua vendiendo sandalias y zapatos para todas las edades. Henry usara el préstamo para invertir en material y confeccionar el calzado y sandalias para damas y caballeros. El tiene la aspiración de construir un local en su vivienda para el taller y poder dar trabajo a personas que lo necesiten. El tiene la fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecerá. Henry es Padre de 1 hijo, esta unido, tiene 29 años. Henry tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le dará estabilidad y crecimiento al negocio.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in materials for his sandal making operation

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda has a small business where she sells CDs and also sells lunches. She started off working by selling as a street vendor. She saved enough money to set up a business in her home and she also decided to invest in the necessary utensils to be able to open a small restaurant. Most of her clients come from a nearby school and market. She is requesting the loan in order to invest in a new grill so she may sell barbecued foods. She has four children with her husband. She is optimistic about the loan and hopes she can use the extra profits to provide a better living for her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in a grill for her restaurant operation

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa sells food from local market in Guayaquil. Her spot in the market is quite large, which allows her to sell rice, sugar and other products at large and small quantities. She started the business with only $150 in capital. As time passes she introduces new items to her inventory such as cleaning products, fruits and vegetables. Rosa is hoping that she can use the loan to buy her products in larger quantities and also invest in meats to sell from her stand. She is a single mother with four children, 3 of which are in school. She is 32 and moved to Guayaquil after living further inland in Azuay. She completely depends on the business to provide a living for herself and her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new items such as vegetables and cleaning products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a small store where she sells a variety of items. Maria started her business with the help of her former husband and $100. At first she just sold pens, notebooks, ties, and hair accessories. Now she continues to offer those products, along with clothing, sandals, and gifts. She will use the loan to invest in a variety of merchandise at wholesale prices. Maria has faith that her business will grow with the variety of articles that she will offer to her clients.

Maria is 39 years old, and she is separated from her husband. She has 4 children, all in school. For Maria, life has not been easy, having to take sole charge of her family, giving them education, food, and clothing. She depends completely on her business to get ahead with her family. She has hope that this loan will help her to save for the construction of her home, and to give education to her children.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Maria tiene un pequeño bazar donde vende articulos varios. Maria empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su ex esposo quien la motivo para emprendiera el negocio con 100 dólares. Al principio solo vendían plumas, cuadernos, bolos y colas. Ahora continúan ofreciendo este producto junto con ropa, sandalias y regalos. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar variedad de mercadería a precio de mayorista. Maria tiene fe que su negocio crecerá con la variedad de articulos que ofrecerá a sus clientes. Maria tiene 39 años es separada, tiene cuatro hijos todos estudian. Para Maria la vida no ha sido fácil teniendo que llevar sola la carga de su familia dándoles estudios alimentación y vestimenta. Ella depende totalmente de su negocio para salir adelante con su familia. Maria tiene la esperanza de que este préstamo le ayudara ahorrar para construir su vivienda y darle educación a sus hijos.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase products at wholesale quantities and prices

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.en:
Miss Maria lives in the city of Escobedo, in the state of Nuevo Leon, is mother of 3 children aged 16, 12 and 6 years of age. Five years ago she started selling shoes by catalogue given the lack of funds to cover the cost of the education for her children. Her husband's salary is not enough to cover all of the household expenses. An entrepreneurial spirit and responsibility are the characteristics that define Miss Maria and thanks to these she has been able to come out on top, and struggle for the future well being of her family, especially her children.

Tloday she requires a loan in the amount of $375 to purchase more merchandise and incrase the volunter of her inventory, thereby increasing her income. Help her achieve her goal of seeing the completion of the education of her children. Do not wait any longer, the decision is in your hands. With your generosity you can become and important part of the success of Miss Maria and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña María vive en la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León, y es madre de 3 hijos, quienes tienen 16, 12 y 6 años de edad. Ella hace 5 años comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, ante la falta de recursos para costera la educación de sus hijos, pues con el salario de su esposo no se alcanzan a cubrir todos los gastos del hogar. Espíritu emprendedor y responsabilidad son características que definen a Doña María y que gracias a ellas ha podido salir adelante y luchar por el bienestar y futuro de su familia, esencialmente de sus hijos.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $375 DLLS para poder comprar una mayor cantidad de mercancía, aumentar su volumen de inventarios y así incrementar sus ingresos. Ayúdala a poder ver culminados los estudios de sus hijos. No lo dudes más la decisión esta en tus manos, con tu generosidad puedes volverte parte importante de los logros de Doña María y su familia.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
In the city of Escobedo, in the state of Nuevo Leon, lives Benita, mother of 4 children, all still under age, and is married. They all live in a small house. Given that their necessities have increased a great deal and that her husband's salary is not enough to cover them comfortably, five years ago she started making ladies' shoes. With this business she has managed to come out on top with her fmaily, by helping her husband.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $375 for the purchase of materials she uses to make her products, and this way she can increase her sales and her income. Benita plans to repay the full sum of the loan in a term of 6 months. You can help her and contribute in an important way to the stability and development of her business. Do not wait any longer. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León vive Benita, madre de 4 hijos, todos aún menores de edad, es casada y viven en una pequeña casita. Dado que las necesidades han aumentado mucho con y con el salario de su esposo no se alcanzan a cubrir satisfactoriamente. Hace 5 años ella comenzó a fabricar zapatos para dama, con esta actividad ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y ayudar a su esposo.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 375 DLLS, pues necesita comprar materiales que utiliza para la fabricación de sus productos, y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Benita planea cubrir el monto total de dicho préstamo en un plazo de 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudarla y contribuir de manera importante a la estabilidad y crecimiento de su negocio, no lo dude más, ella y su familia te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase material

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is mother of 3 children, all stil underage, of 7, 14, and 16 years, and all of whom are currently studying. They live in the city of Escobedo in the state of Nuevo Leon. Her husband works as a labourer but his contracts are occassional and this is why they never have a steady income. Given this situation Genoveva dediced to start selling cosmetics by catalogue in her spare itme and this way help her bring home some extra income that they badly needed. Her only goal is to be able to secure the present and future wellbeing of her children, through an education.

She has fought hard for her family and she has worked hard day after day for the great love she has for her children. Now she needs a loan in the amount o f$375. You can be an important part of the success of Genoveva and her family. Don't wait.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Genoveva es madre de 3 hijos, todos aún menores de edad, de 7, 14 y 16 años, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Viven en la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León. Su esposo se desempeña como albañil, pero sus trabajos son temporales, por lo que nunca tiene ingresos seguros. Dada esta situación Genoveva decidió dedicarse en sus ratos libres a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo y de esta manera llevar ingresos extras a la casa, que tanta falta hacen. Su único objetivo es poder asegurar el bienestar presente y futuro de sus hijos, por medio de la educación.

Ella ha luchado mucho por su familia y ha trabajado arduamente día a día por el gran amor que les tiene a sus hijos, ahora ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de 375 DLLS. Tú puedes ser parte importante de los logros de Genoveva y su familia, no lo dude más.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Laura Esther

texts.en:
To conquer the difficulties that have crossed their path, this is why she started her own business 4 years ago, selling tacos, hamburgers and other food, with the sole ofjective of providing her children with a professional education, one that would give them the opportunity for a better future and wellbeing. Thanks to the active support of her brother, her nieces and her aunt, she has been able to expand and maintain her business during this span of time. But above all thanks to the hard work and her sense of responsibility.

In this moment she requires a loan in the amount of $650 that she will use to purchase merchandise, such as ingredients to make her products. Thsi way sshe can satisfy the demand that she now faces.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

logrado vencer las dificultades que se le han presentado, es por ello que hace 4 años ella comenzó con un negocio propio, la venta de tacos, hamburguesas y comida, con el único objetivo de poder brindarles a sus hijos una educación profesional, misma que le permitiera la posibilidad de un mejor futuro y bienestar. Gracias al el apoyo activo de su hermano, su sobrina y su tía ella ha podido hacer crecer y mantener esta actividad durante todo este tiempo, pero sobre todo gracias a su trabajo y sentido de responsabilidad.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de mercancía que requiere como insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, y de esta forma satisfacer la creciente demanda que ahora mismo enfrenta.

loans.use: púrchase merchandise

loans.name: Araceli Margarita

texts.en:
Eight years ago Araceli started selling shoes by catalogue, given the necessity to support her husband, a painter working for a company, although the employment does not yield much profit. She is mother of two children that are still underage. They live in the city of Escobedo in the state of Nuevo Leon. Thanks to Araceli's business, her children have been able to have what they need and this is why she works hard day after day, to maintain and expand what she has built with such great effort.

Today she needs a loan in the amount of $275 to purchase merchandise in greater volumes and this way increase her roster of clients, and her income. You can be an important part of Araceli and her family's success. They will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 8 años Araceli inició con la venta de zapatos por catálogo, por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo, ya que se desempeña como pintor en una empresa constructora y esta actividad no le genera muchos recursos. Ella es madre de dos hijos, quienes aún son menores de edad y vive en la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León. Gracias al proyecto de Araceli, sus hijos han podido tener lo necesario, es por ello que día a día lucha para mantener y hacer crecer lo que con tanto esfuerzo ha logrado construir.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $275 DLLS, para poder comprar una mayor cantidad de mercancía y de esta manera incrementar su cartera de clientes y por ende sus ingresos. Tú puedes se parte importante de los logros de Araceli y su familia ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is mother of three children, is married and lives in the city of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. She is known as a very hard working and enterprising person. Three years ago, with the goal of helping her husband with the household costs, she started to make and sell tamales and chorizo from her own home. Thanks to this business she has been able to provide her family with a better quality of life, and this is why day after day she struggles to expand her business and increase her clients. Things have not been easy but she knows that with dedication anything is possible.

Today she needs a loan in the amount of $550 that she will put towards the purchase of ingredients she needs to make her products. The help you can provide her is very important because this is the only way that she will be able to expand her business and reach her goals. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Esperanza es madre de tres hijos, es casada y vive en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, se caracteriza por ser una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Hace tres años, con el objetivo de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella comenzó a elaborar y vender tamales y chorizo, en su propio domicilio. Gracias a esta actividad ella puede brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, es por ello que día a día lucha por hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar su número de clientes. Las cosas no ha sido fáciles pero ella sabe que con dedicación todo es posible.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 550 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de insumos que utiliza para la elaboración de sus productos. Es muy importante la ayuda que tú puedas brindarle, pues sólo así podrá crecer y lograr los objetivos trazados. Ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a very active and responsible woman. She needed to support her husband, whose salary is small. Four years ago she decided to start a small business, a small grocery store. This business has allowed her family to have a better income and as such, a better quality of life, which is why she struggles to make her business grow.

Now she requires a loan in the amount of$550, that she will use for the purchase of more merchandise to offer her clients, and in this way increase her income. You, with your generosity, can be a great support to Juana. Do not wait. She and her family will forever thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es una mujer muy activa y responsable, por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo, puesto que el salario que recibe es muy poco, hace 4 años ella decidió iniciar con pequeño negocio propio, una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Esta actividad ha servido para que su familia pueda tener una mejor nivel de ingresos y por ende una mayor calidad de vida, por ello lucha por hacer crecer su proyecto

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $550 DLLS , mismos que destinará en la compra de más mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta forma aumentar sus ingresos. Tú, con tu generosidad, puedes ser un gran apoyo para Juana, no lo dudes, ella y su familia te lo agradecederan por siempre.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.en:
Olga is married and is mother of 4 children, and they live in a small house in the city of Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. Two years ago she dediced to start selling chemical products from the garage of her own home, with the objective of providing her children with a quality education and a better quality of life. This would not be possible with the income earned by her husband, working for a company as a construction worker. This is why Olga struggles more every day, motivated for the great love she has for her children and the loyal commitment she feels for her husband.

Now she requires a loan in the amount of $375 that she will put towards increasing the variety of her merchandise that she now sees need. She plans to repay the loan in a term of 3 months. Do not wait and help Olga and her family. They sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es casada y madre de 4 hijos, ellos viven en una pequeña casita en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León. Hace 2 años ella decidió comenzar a vender productos químicos en la cochera de su propio domicilio, con el objetivo de poder brindarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad y una mejor calidad de vida. Pues esto sería imposible con el sueldo que gana su esposo desempeñándose como empleado en una empresa constructora. Es por ello que Olga lucha cada día más, impulsada por el gran amor que le tiene a sus hijos y el fiel compromiso con su esposo.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 DLLS, que destinará para surtir mercancía que le hace falta en este momento. Mismo que planea regresar en un plazo de 3 meses. No lo dudes y apoya a Olga y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nosifn

texts.en: joiegrgjw

loans.use: nvoierwgs

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena lives in the community of Santo Domingo in the state of Nuevo Leon. Ten years ago she started her small business selling clothes, as her husband abandoned her, and back then her three kids were still under age. She found herself in need and looked for a business that would generate the necessary income to raise her children, as an aside from her other job working in a company. Years later, Maria Elena's children have professional careers and they help her purchase merchandise. She has managed this with a base of great effort, integrity and the love of her family.

The daily struggles have not been easy in any way, but nonetheless she managed to reach her goal with the moral support of her children. Now she requires a loan in the amount of $1025 that she will use to purchase merchandise in greater quantities and keep her business growing. Do not wait. Support Maria Elena. She will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Elena vive en la comunidad de Santo Domingo, en el estado de Nuevo León , ella hace 10 años comenzó con un negocio pequeño de venta de ropa, pues su esposo la abandono, en ese entonces sus tres hijos aún eran menores de edad y ella se vio en la necesidad de buscar un actividad que le pudiera generar los ingresos necesarios para poder mantener a sus hijos, además del salario que ganaba en su trabajo de planta, pues con éste no era necesario. Después de muchos años transcurridos, los hijos de María Elena son profesionistas y le ayudan a surtir la mercancía para le venta de la ropa, y esto lo ha logrado a base de esfuerzo , enteraza y amor a sus familia.

La lucha diaria no ha sido fácil en ningún sentido, sin embargo ella ha sabido lograr sus objetivo con el apoyo moral de sus hijos, ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por una cantidad de $ 1025 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para comprar una mayor cantidad de mercancía y continuar creciendo con su negocio. No lo dudes más y apoya a María Elena, ella te lo va a agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.en:
Entrepreneurial and hard working are the two qualities that Maria Elizabeth naturally possesses. She is married and has three children, and they all ive in the city of Apocada in Nuevo Leon. Seven years ago when her husband found himself unemployed she started selling herbal products, as she needed to help her husband and above all her children, to provide them with the necessities such as an education. Maria Elizabeht has been able to maintain what she built with such effort, thanks to arduous work day after day. Her only goal is to provide her fmaily with a better quality of life.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $925 that she will put towards the purchase of more merchandise to increase her sales. She is currently paying the tuition for a professional education for the eldest of her children. Her dearm is to see her edlest child finish his education with success. With your support and generosity, her dream will become a reality. The decision is in your hands. Maria Elizabeth will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Emprendedora y trabajadora son dos cualidades que María Elizabeth posee con naturalidad, ella es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la localidad de Apocada, Nuevo León. Hace 7 años, cuando su esposo se quedó sin empleo, inició la venta de productos forever y hierbería, pues ella necesitaba ayudar a su esposo y sobre todo salir adelante con sus hijos y poder brindarles lo necesario, como educación. María Elizabeth ha podido sostener lo que con tanto esfuerzo a construido gracias al arduo trabajo que día a día realiza, con el único fin de poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para poder compara más mercancía y así incrementar sus ventas, pues está pagando las colegiaturas de la educación profesional del mayor de sus hijos. Su principal sueño es ver a su hijo culminar con éxito sus estudios. Con tu apoyo y generosidad su sueño se hará realidad, la decisión esta en tus manos, María Elizabeth te lo agrdecederá.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Miss Lupita, that is how she is known in the community where she lives, Apodaca in Nuevo Leon. She is married and she is a very entrepreneurial woman. Eight years ago she started selling Forever products, as her husband's salary was not enough to cover all of their necessities, which is why she started this business to generate an extra income. This has helped ease the financial situation of the family, and it has allowed her children to continue with their studies and she can also purchase the medications she needs, a lifelong illness she is battling.

She now needs a loan of $925 that she will use towards the purchase of more products to offer her clients, to increase the volume of her sales, and her income. You have the ability to support Miss Lupita and become an important part of her successes. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Lupita, así es como la conocen en la comunidad donde vive, Apodaca, Nuevo León, ella es casada, además de ser una mujer muy trabajadora. Hace 8 años inició con venta de productos forever, pues con lo que ganaba su esposo son les alcanzaba para hacer frente a todas las necesidades, es por ello que busco una actividad que le generará ingresos extras. Esto ha ayudado mucho a sanar un poco la economía familiar, además permitir la posibilidad del estudio de sus hijos y sobre todo el poder comprar a tiempo los medicamentos que ella necesita, pues se encuentra enferma y el tratamiento es de por vida.
