Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en un la compra de más productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes y así poder aumentar su volumen de ventas y por ende su nivel de ingresos. Tú tienes la posibilidad de ayudar a Doña Lupita, vuélvete parte importante de sus logros, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.en:
Sandra is a very active woman, but above all she is an excellent mother and wife. Four years ago she started selling school supplies to high school students, and later she started selling office supplies once she realized the income she was earning was significant. She then occupied herself with the business full time. Thanks to the active support of her husband and her children, she still today manages her business and has been able to contribute to the maintenance of the household and has been able to provide her children with a professional education - these things would not have been possible with only her husband's salary.

Today she requires a loan in the amount o f$925 to increase the variety of products in her store, and increase her sales. You can help Sandra to continue to develop her small business and to contribute to the well bieng of her family. Do not wait, and support her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra es una mujer muy activa, pero sobre todo es una excelente madre y esposa. Hace cuatro años ella comenzó a impartir asesorías para alumnos de preparatoria, tiempo de empezó a vender artículos de papelería y al ver que le generaba importantes ingresos comenzó a dedicarse enteramente a éste negocio. Gracias al apoyo activo de su esposo y sus hijos ella continúa con su proyecto hasta la fecha y ha podido contribuir a los manutención de la casa y la educación profesional de sus hijos, hechos que no hubieran sido posibles únicamente con el salario de su esposo.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 DLLS para poder tener un mayor surtido e incrementar sus ventas. Tú puedes ayudar a continuar y hacer crecer el pequeño negocio de Sandra y contribuir al bienestar de su familia, no lo dudes más y ayúdala.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Six years ago Miss Alicia only needed to tend to her home, as her children were providing the financial support of the household, as she and her husband are now seniors and impossible to acquire employment with a company, given their age. But one day their children were all married and they started their own families. This is how Miss Alicia and her life partner were left alone, and she found herself in need to start a business that would provide them with a living. This is how she started selling crafts. Thanks to her efforts and the help of her husband, who helps her in moving merchandise, she has been able to make it through despite the marked absence of her children.

Today Miss Alicia needs funds to invest in order to generate more earnings. This is why she needs a loan in the amount of $200 that she plans to repay in 3 months. Your generosity will be of great help. Do not wait and support her. She and her husband sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Alicia, hace 6 años, sólo tenía que preocuparse por tener todo en orden en casa, pues sus hijos eran quienes proveían los medios económicos de subsistencia, ya que ella y su esposo ya son personas grandes y no ha logrado emplearse en alguna empresa, a causa de su edad. Pero un día sus hijos se casaron y formaron sus propias familias, así que Doña Alicia y su compañero de vida, se quedaron de pronto solos y ella se vio en la necesidad de empezar con una actividad que les diera los medios para vivir, es así como comenzó con su propio negocio de venta de artesanías. Gracias a su esfuerzo y ayuda de su esposo, quien colabora en el traslado de las mercancías, ella ha podido salir adelante a pesar de la ausencia de sus hijos.

Ahora Doña Alicia necesita capital para invertir y poder generar más ganancias, por ello necesita de un crédito de $ 200 DLLS, mismo que planea cubrir en un plazo de 3 meses aproximadamente. Tu generosidad será de gran ayuda, no lo dudes más y apóyala, ella y su esposo te lo agradecen sinceramente

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCANDISE

loans.name: Maribel Salinas

texts.en:
Maribel is an admirable woman, because despite teh difficult moments she went through she has been able to pull through for the love of her children and of course, for herself. Ten years ago her husband abandoned them, leaving her alone with three children, still very little. Given this very complicated situation she started her own business from her home, a beauty shop. This way she is able to care of her little ones and still generate the income that she needs to support them. Thanks to this business she has been able to pull through with her children, and more importantly, sha has been able to provide them with the education they need.

Don't leave Maribel and her children alone. They need you. Today she requires a lona in the amount of $200 to purchase equipment and to attend training. She plans to repay the lona in 3 months. The decision is in your hands. She gives you her thanks.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Maribel es una mujer admirable, pues a pesar de los momentos difíciles por los que ha atravesado ha logrado salir adelante por el amor a sus hijos y claro a ella misma. Hace 10 años su esposo la abandono, dejándola sola con sus tres hijos muy pequeñitos aún, ante esta situación sumamente complicada, ella inició su propio negocio en su domicilio, una estética. De esta forma podía estar al pendiente de sus pequeños y generar los ingresos necesarios para la manutención adecuada de sus hijos. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido salir adelante con sus hijos y más importante aún ha podido darles la educación que necesitan.

No dejes sola a Maribel y a sus hijos, ellos te necesitan, pues ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $200 DLLS para poder comprar equipo y tomar cursos de actualización, planeando cubrir el monto total de éste en un periodo de 3 meses. La decisión esta en tus manos, ella te lo agradece.

loans.use: purchase equipement

loans.name: Alva Gloria

texts.en:
Alba lives in the community of San Nicolas de los Garza in Nuevo Leon. She is single. Some time ago she started to sell products by catalogue with the goal of covering her expenses, as she has to fend for herself and no one else is there to help her. She works very hard every day as she needs to secure the income to purchase her medications she needs to treat her illness. Despite the difficulties she has faced, she continues to fight without ever letting herself be conquered thanks to her great integrity.

She now requires a loan in the amount of $200 that she will use to purchase merchandise and increase her sales. Do not wait and support her. She thanks you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Alba vive en la comunidad de San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León, es una persona sola, y hace tiempo que inició a dedicarse a la venta de productos por catálogo, con la finalidad de poder cubrir todos sus gastos, pues ella depende únicamente de si misma, no hay nadie que la apoye. Ella trabaja muy duro todos los días, pues necesita asegurar ingresos para comprar los medicamentos mensuales que requiere para el tratamiento de su enfermedad. A pesar de las dificultades que ha tenido que enfrentar, ella continúa luchando y no ha dejado vencer gracias a la gran entereza que la caracteriza.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 DLLS mismo que utilizará para la compra de mercancía y así lograr incrementar sus ventas. No lo dudes más y ayúdala, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCAHSE MERCHANDISE

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo has 10 years experience repairing all kinds of shoes, sewing suitcases, bags and anything made of leather. He learned this trade with a friend when he was 17 years old. He worked for him for 3 years, then he switched to work for a company for 5 years. Later on, Eduardo couldn’t find a job so he ventured back to his old activity as a shoe repairer with a friend, and little by little he became more independent, got married and his shoe repairing skills is what he has been using to support his household.

Eduardo rents a place and his business is open 7 days a week, from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM. His children help him when he has to run some errands. With the income from his business, he has been able to support his family and have a house – his most precious possession.

He would like to take a loan because his clients are asking him for new shoes and he doesn’t have the capital needed to buy the material for the shoes nor to exhibit his products. He has a demand for what he could offer and believes that he will do very well.

Eduardo is 37 years old, has 5 kids and has been separated from his wife for a couple of years now; they intend to get back together, but at the moment he is in charge of their children. Presently, they are helping each other; they have their own house and they are remodeling it.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Eduardo tiene 10 años de experiencia reparando todo tipo de calzado; también cose maletas, bolsos todo lo que es de cuero. Aprendió esta actividad con un amigo cuando tenía 17 años y trabajó para él 3 años. Luego se cambió de línea de trabajo y estuvo 5 años en una empresa. Como después no pudo encontrar trabajo, volvió a su oficio anterior (zapatero) con un amigo y poco a poco se fue independizando, se casó y eso le ha servido para sostener su hogar.

El alquila un local y atiende todos los días de la semana de 8:00 AM hasta 8:00 PM y sus hijos le ayudan cuando él tiene que salir. Con los ingresos generados del negocio él ha podido sostener la familia y tener su casa, que es su bien más preciado.

Eduardo desea el préstamo porque los clientes le piden zapatillas nuevas y él no tiene un capital para poder comprar el material y exhibir sus productos, tiene demanda y siente que le va a ir muy bien.

Eduardo tiene 37 años, tiene 5 hijos, con su esposa están separados ya un par de años; esperan volver, pero por el momento él está a cargo de sus hijos. Actualmente ellos se ayudan mutuamente, tienen casa propia y la están remodelando.

loans.use: Compra de cuero y adornos

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel has a store that sells all kinds of decorations for childen’s parties (invitations, trinkets, piñatas, balloons) as well as diapers and little gifts for kids. Her business is 1 year old and it was her husband who encouraged her to have her own store; he helped her with $200 so she could start the business. She rents a place and opens from 8:00 AM to 9:00 PM. Her business has been well received in the area because of the good prices she offers, and since her husband works at a printing shop, he brings her all sorts of party invitations.

She is requesting a loan to diversify the decorations for children’s parties she offers and to buy a small display cabinet.

Mabel is 25 years old and has 2 girls. Her husband has been working at the printing shop for 10 years and has always supported her. They are a close-knit family; together they have been able to acquire their posessions, especially the house that they have remodeled into a cement based structure. She hopes for her business to grow stronger and for it to bring in more income, and above all, she wishes for her little girls to be able to continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Mabel tiene un bazar donde vende todo tipo de decoración para fiestas infantiles (invitaciones, sorpresas, piñatas, globos) y también pañales y regalitos para niños. Su negocio tiene 1 año y fue su esposo quien la motivó para que trabajara en algo y la apoyó con $200 dólares, para que iniciara su negocio. Ella alquila un local y atiende de 8:00AM a 9:00 PM. Tiene mucha acogida en su sector por los precios que ofrece, y como su esposo trabaja en una imprenta, le trae todo tipo de invitaciones para fiestas.

Ella está solicitando el préstamo para variar sus adornos para fiestas infantiles y adquirir una pequeña vitrina.

Mabel tiene 25 años y tiene 2 hijas. Su esposo ha trabajado en una imprenta por 10 años y siempre la ha apoyado. Son una familia muy unida; juntos han podido obtener sus bienes, especialmente la casa que han remodelado a una estructura de cemento. Su aspiración es que su negocio se fortalezca y genere más ingresos, y sobre todo que sus niñas pequeñas todavía puedan asistir a la escuela.

loans.use: Comprar adornos para fiestas infantiles y abonar para una vitrina

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Since he was 15 years old, Luís had always liked animals. He raised chickens, ducks and pigeons in his house. His neighbors already knew him and began to buy these animals from him. When Luís got married, he continued to work on his business and also specialized in raising exotic animals such as doves, hens and peacocks. He already has a steady stream of clients and places to exhibit his animals, where he also delivers them.

The pens are in the backyard of his house and he checks and attends to the animals daily. Every weekend, Luís goes to the market and stores to offer his products. Besides this activity, Luís cooks at the community kitchens starting from 5:00 PM. These are his only sources of income.

Luís needs the loan to improve the structure of his pens and to implement a cleaning out system.

He is 37 years old, married with 3 children. His wife works at a company and supports him with the household expenses. Together they have been able to acquire their posessions—especially the house which they have changed from a house made of cane to a cement one. Theirs is a hard-working and humble family; his wishes are for his children to be able to finish school and so to have their incomes from work to help the family.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Luís desde la edad de 15 años le gustaron los animales. Así en su casa criaba pollos, patos y palomas. Los vecinos ya lo conocían y comenzaron a comprarle. Cuando se casó, siguió con su negocio y se especializó en criar también animales exóticos como palomas, gallinas, pavos reales. Ya tiene sus clientes y lugares de exhibición donde él entrega.

Su criadero lo tiene en el patio de su casa y su atención y chequeo es diaria con los animales. Todos los fines de semana sale al mercado y a las tiendas a ofrecer sus animales. A parte de esta actividad Don Luís se dedica a cocinar en los comedores a partir de las 5:00PM. Estos son otros ingresos que él tiene.

Don Luís necesita el préstamo para adecuar la estructura de su criadero e implementar un sistema de limpieza.

Don Luís tiene 37 años, con 3 hijos y está casado. Su esposa trabaja en una empresa y le apoya en las necesidades de la casa. Juntos han podido obtener sus bienes-- especialmente su casa la cual cambiaron de caña a cemento. Son una familia humilde y trabajadora. Su aspiración es que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios y así tener los ingresos de sus trabajos para ayudar a la familia.

loans.use: Mejorar la infraestructura física

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana has a small workshop where she makes clothes for women and children. She also buys clothes to sell in her store. She learned this activity from her mother when she was 10. Every week, she would accompany her mother to sell the clothes they had made, going to different areas around their village; Mariana still keeps the sewing machine her mother left her.

Her workshop is in her house and it is open from Monday to Sunday. She has a granddaughter that keeps her company and helps her when she needs to run some errands. She also has other sources of income because she had a first aid in nursing training, so she offers her services to the community.

Mariana needs a loan to buy fabrics, threads, laces and all the necessary materials needed to make clothes. She also would like to put a down payment for a new sewing machine.

She is 58 years old and has 3 sons, all of which are independent. She does not have a husband because he left her and the kids when they were still very young. She has had to take care of the family; with her income she was able to buy a property and build a house made of cane, which she later improved using cement. At the same time, she has another source of income from a property she is renting out. She wishes to keep on with her work and business since these are her only sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Mariana tiene un pequeño taller de confección de ropa de mujer y niños. A su vez compra ropa para vender en su local. Ella aprendió esta actividad a la edad de 10 años ya que su madre lo hacía también. Cada semana acompañaba a su madre para vender la ropa que habían confeccionado recorriendo las diferentes zonas y los campos cercanos a su pueblo; ella todavía conserva la máquina de coser que le dejó su madre.

Su taller lo tiene en su casa y lo atiende de lunes a domingo. Tiene una nieta que la acompaña y le ayuda atender cuando ella sale de su casa. También ella tiene otros ingresos porque aprendió primeros auxilios de enfermería y ofrece sus servicios a la comunidad.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar: telas, hilos, encajes todo lo que sea necesario para confeccionar la ropa, a su vez desea dar de entrada para comprar una nueva máquina.

Mariana tiene 58 años, tiene 3 hijos y todos ellos son independientes. No tiene esposo porque la abandonó con sus 3 hijos cuando éstos eran pequeños. Ella ha tenido que sacar adelante su hogar; con los ingresos generados pudo comprar su terreno y hacer primero su casa de caña y luego poco a poco llevarla de cemento. A su vez tiene 1 alquiler que le significan otros ingresos. Su aspiración es seguir con su negocio y trabajo ya que son sus únicas fuentes de ingreso.

loans.use: Comprar telas, hilos y encajes

loans.name: Namo

texts.en:
Having more than five children in Samoan family is not a good result in some parents, especially in rural area but Namo M. from the village of Solosolo has tried her best for her five kids, she joined SPBD Programme in 2004. She had training with Tourism Authority for only two weeks based on small businesses and since then has used her loans from SPBD for her taro plantation, vegetable garden and donut business. 
Namo is pictured in front of her beach fales which are in the background. She wishes to use her Kiva loan to build another fale.

loans.use: Purchase timber and roofing for beach fale

loans.name: Alisahib

texts.en:
Alisahib was born in Salyan region Yenikand village, he is 48, married, has 3 children. He has been in this business for 10 years.
For the first time he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought 8 sheeps and 5 goats.
For the second time he borrowed a loan of $600 and bought 15 pedigreed ewes and 8 goats.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 20 pedigreed ewes and 10 goats.

loans.use: To buy 20 pedigreed ewes and 10 goats

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is married with 4 children who all go to school. 

She has two businesses. In the rural area she has a plantation which grows cabbages, pumpkins, peas and egg plants. Usually these are sold from her house or sometimes the market.

She also prints material for lava lava (Samoan Sarong)which she sells in the market and to stores in town. She gets her designs from a wood carver.

loans.use: Purchase material for clothes printing

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en:
Bayram is 57, married, has 2 children, lives in Salyan region Khaladj village.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought 0,08 hectare plot of land . He create apple garden. 
Now he needs a loan of $600 to start being busy with cattle breeding .
He has been in this business for 15 years.

loans.use: To start being busy with cattle breeding

loans.name: Sunbul

texts.en:
Sunbul has been engaged in poultry-breeder for 8 years. She is hard worker, likes animals.
These animals recognize her in the far distance. As soon as these animals see her, they run to her, they follow her. 
You can see in the picture turkey cock, which looks to her as if understand , what she says. 
In the beginning of her business she borrowed a loan of $300 and bought 100 chickens.
Now she needs a loan of $600 o buy 10 lambs.
She plans to start being busy with cattle breeding.

loans.use: To buy 10 lubs

loans.name: Valeh

texts.en:
Valeh has been engaged in this busines for 8 years. 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $200 and repairs a store. 
For the second time he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought refrigerator.
The third borrowed loan amount of $600 he spent for buying this store.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to expand the area of his store and to buy food-stuffs.
This 47-year- old man lives in Salyan region Khaladj village with his family, married, has 3 children.

loans.use: To expand he area of his store and to buy the food-stuffs

loans.name: Yakhshikhanim

texts.en:
Yakhshikhanim has been engaged in this business since 2003.She likes animals, enjoys looking after  cattles.
This 49-year-old woman lives in Salyan region Khaladj village , married, has 4 children.
Having borrowed a loan of $400 , she built a stable . 
The second time she borrowed a loan of $800 and bought 2 pedigree cows.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 4 pedigree cows.

loans.use: To buy 4 pedigree cows

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar is 29, single, lives in Salyan region Khaladj village.
Having borrowed a loan of $300 and built a store. 
The second loan amount of $600 he spent to buy food stuffs: flour, sugar, tea, granulated sugar.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 o expand he area of his business.

loans.use: To expand he area of his business

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda has a shop where she sells all kinds of presents for parties, costume jewelry and school supplies. She started her business a year ago, making a space for it in her house. She used some of her savings and some money her sister lent her as her initial capital. Linda’s 15 year old daughter and her take turns attending the shop. They open everyday from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM.

Her shop is in a great location. She set up the business because she needed to generate more income for her family. Linda wishes to take a loan to supply her shop with more novelty items and thus attract more clients.

Linda is 30 years old and has one daughter. She had to assume the responsibility of her household, so she worked whenever she could. Despite being alone, she was able to buy a house with the support of her family. Her dream is that her daughter can finish her studies and get a job. And when it comes to her shop, she hopes to be able to expand it and to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Linda tiene un bazar donde vende todo tipo de regalos para fiestas, bisutería y útiles escolares. Comenzó hace 1 año en su casa adecuando un espacio. El capital con que se inició fue con unos ahorros y un dinero que le prestó una hermana. El negocio lo atiende con su hija de 15 años y se turnan. El horario de atención es de 7:00 AM hasta 10:00 PM todos los días.

El lugar donde se encuentra el negocio tiene mucho movimiento. Ella puso el negocio porque necesitaba generar ingresos para su familia. Linda desea el préstamo para surtir más su bazar con artículos novedosos y de esta manera atraer a más clientela.

Linda tiene 30 años, con una hija, es madre soltera. Ella tuvo que asumir toda la responsabilidad en su hogar, por esta razón tuvo que trabajar en lo que ella podía. A pesar de estar sola pudo adquirir su casa con el apoyo de su familia. Su sueño es que su hija termine sus estudios y trabaje. Con respecto a su negocio, ella desea incrementarlo y generar mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Comprar regalos para fiestas, útiles  escolares

loans.name: José

texts.en:
José has 5 years of experience selling this product. Since he was a kid, he had to earn a living so he sold all sorts of things. At age 15, he left his hometown and came to Guayaquil to live. He got married and kept working as a merchant with his wife. Five years ago, he worked for a company selling “morocho” (rice pudding) from a push cart on the streets. A year ago, José became independent and with his savings he made a few changes to his push cart and now he and his wife hit the streets to sell morocho. His wife starts cooking the morocho at 10:00 AM at home and at 4:00 PM they go to the streets, covering especific routes until 8:00 PM. By then, the product has already been sold out.

He’s applying for a loan because he wishes to build a push cart for his wife, so she can cover another route, thus increasing their production and income.

José is 37 and has 4 children. His wife has always been his right hand in every business venture they have tried. Both come from humble homes where they have had to work since they were kids. The couple remembers the many sacrificies they had to make to have their cane house, and that up until a year ago, the house was still above water. Now the house is on firm land, where they had to invest $500 for the filling. His goal is to get his business ahead, since it is the household’s sole source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

José tiene una experiencia de 5 años vendiendo este producto. Él desde pequeño tuvo que ganarse el pan diario así que vendía de todo. A los 15 años salió de su ciudad natal y vino a Guayaquil a vivir, aquí se casó y siguió trabajando en el comercio junto a su esposa. Hace 5 años trabajó para una empresa que vendía morocho (arroz con leche) en la calle con una carreta. Hace 1 año se independizó y con unos ahorros que tenía adaptó su carreta y junto a su esposa salen a vender el morocho. Su esposa es quien hace el morocho en casa. El morocho lo ponen a cocinar desde las 10:00AM y a las 4:00 PM salen a recorrer las calles en formas zonificadas hasta las 8:00 PM donde todo el producto se ha vendido.

Él esta aplicando el préstamo porque desea hacer una carreta para su esposa para que ella salga también hacer otro recorrido. Esto permitiría que aumente la producción y los ingresos.

José tiene 37 años, con 4 hijos, su esposa ha sido siempre su mano derecha en todo lo que han vendido. Ambos vienen de hogares muy pobres que han tenido que trabajar desde pequeño. Recuerdan muchos sacrificios que les ha costado tener su casa de caña, y que hace un año estaba sobre el agua. Ahora su casa está sobre tierra firme donde tuvieron que invertir $500 para el relleno. Su aspiración es sacar adelante el negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para el hogar.

loans.use: Comprar material para hacer una nueva carreta para su esposa

loans.name: José

texts.en:
José offers wholesale and retail sales of seafood (shrimps, fish, crabs) for a living. He has 30 years of experience in this trade. His father was a fisherman and as a child, José and his brothers had to learn this occupation so they could put bread on the table. When he got married, he came to Guayaquil-Isla Trinitaria to live with his parents and kept on with his business. He goes out fishing with a group of 5 people in his own motorized canoe, in deep waters around different spots in Guayaquil. He comes home every 2 days. When he comes back with the catch of the day, he sells it straight to the wholesale market. On Saturdays and Sundays, he retails his seafood close to his house because sales are good. The only day they don’t go fishing is on Wednesdays because they take a rest. His wife also has a small business where she sells, in the countryside, whatever people request for. Both husband and wife generate income.

José needs a loan because he would like to change his fishing nets and his wife needs to buy some of the products her clients have ordered.

He and his wife were born in Naranjito. He is 40 eyars old with 4 small children. Jose’s wife is his partner and personal support in his work. She also generates income by selling merchandise in the village they were born in. They are a humble, hard-working family that wishes to get ahead for the children. They have been able to get their most precious possession, the house, which used to made out of cane and now it’s completely made of cement. Their dream is to open a store.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

José se dedica a vender mariscos (camarón, pescado, cangrejos) al por mayor y menor. Tiene una experiencia de 30 años en esta actividad. Su padre fue pescador y desde niño junto a sus hermanos, tuvieron que aprender el oficio para poder llevar el pan diario a la casa. Cuando se casó, se vino a vivir a Guayaquil-Isla Trinitaria junto a sus padres y continuó con su negocio. Él sale a pescar en grupo de 5 personas en su propia canoa a motor en aguas profundas por diferentes puntos de Guayaquil. Regresa cada 2 días a la casa. Cuando viene con la pesca la vende en el mercado mayorista directamente. Los sábados y domingos también vende cerca de su casa al menudeo porque la venta es buena. Sólo los miércoles no salen a pescar porque descansan. Su esposa también tiene su pequeño negocio vendiendo en los campos lo que le pidan. Ambos generan ingresos.

Él necesita el préstamo porque desea cambiar las redes de pescar y su esposa necesita comprar algunos artículos que le han solicitado.

José y su esposa nacieron en Naranjito, tiene 40 años, con 4 hijos todavía pequeños.Su esposa es su compañero y su apoyo en el trabajo. Su esposa también genera ingresos vendiendo mercadería en el pueblo donde ellos nacieron. Son una familia humilde, trabajadora, con el deseo de seguir adelante por sus hijos. Ellos han podido obtener su bien más preciado que es su casa, era de caña y ahora es de cemento totalmente. Su sueño es tener un negocio

loans.use: Comprar redes de pescar y ciertos artículos

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita buys green bananas and lets them rippen in a storage room. She sells the bananas in her house and also goes around in her tricycle selling to the general stores or to passer-bys. She’s been working on this activity for 1 year. Juanita’s whole family works in the business. At home, their business is open everyday and she goes out so sell 4 days a week. Her and her husband used to sell roast chicken –and had 8 years of experience doing so– but they had to close down because another roast chicken place opened at the mall. This is why they switched activities.

She needs a loan to improve the space she has made for the business and to better showcase her product.

Juanita is 36 and has 2 sons that help her with the business. Her husband works half time at a company and also helps with the sales. With their work, they have been able to save money and buy their house, which used to be made out of cane and now it’s made of cement. They have also been able to make ends meet. Juanita’s family has an enterprising spirit and is very active. Their wish is to give the business a more stable financial base, since it is their only source of steady income.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Juanita se dedica a comprar banano verde y los madura en su bodega. Ella vende en su propia casa para el público y a su vez sale a recorrer en un triciclo colocando en las tiendas o al usuario que pasa. Lleva 1 año en esta actividad. Toda la familia de Juanita se dedican a éste negocio. Ella atiende el negocio todos los días en su casa y sale a recorrer 4 días a la semana. Ella tenía otra actividad y experiencia de 8 años en vender pollos asados junto a su esposo. Desde hace 2 años tuvieron que cerrar porque cerca pusieron uno en el Mall. Por esta razón cambiaron de actividad.

Ella necesita el préstamo para adecuar un espacio de su casa para el negocio y exhibir su producto.

Juanita tiene 36 años, con 2 hijos que le ayudan en el negocio. Su esposo trabaja actualmente en una empresa por medio tiempo y también le ayuda en el negocio. Con los trabajos que han realizado han podido ahorrar y adquirir su casa que antes era de caña y ahora de cemento. También han podido solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Ellos son una familia emprendedora, muy activa. Su aspiración es establecer bien el negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingreso más segura.

loans.use: Adecuar un espacio físico para su negocio

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida has a business of soda and beer sales. She also sells items for the house and for woman, men and children. She has 35 years of experience in this business. When she was younger, Adelaida used to travel to the local markets to sell her goods. She is no longer able to go to the markets due to health problems with her legs. She now works out of her house every day from early morning to 11 at night. She sells her products on credit, with 30% paid up front and the remainder in weekly payments thereafter.

She needs the loan to stock up on beverages and buy the additional items she sells. She has pending orders but lacks the additional capital to fill them.

Adelaida is 50 years old. One of her 7 childen lives with her. He works for and supports himself. Adelaida is a single mother. She had to take on full responsibility for supporting and raising her family because her husband abandoned her. Her children worked to support themselves from the time they were very young. With a lot of effort and hard work, the family was able to buy the house where Adelaida now lives. Adelaida's dream is to maintain her business and continue to sell, because it is her business that entertains and sustains her.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Adelaida tiene un negocio de venta de colas y cervezas. Ella también se dedica a vender artículos para: el hogar, damas, caballeros y niños. Tiene 35 años de experiencia en esto. Cuando era más joven salía a vender en los mercados pero se enfermo de las piernas y tuvo que dejarlo. Ahora atiende en su casa todo el día desde tempranas horas hasta las 11:00PM. Los artículos los vende a crédito 30% de entrada y el saldo en partes que cobra cada semana.

Ella necesita el préstamo para abastecerse en gaseosas y además comprar los artículos que ella coloca, tiene pedidos pero le hace falta un capital adicional.

Adelaida tiene 57 años, 7 hijos de los cuales sólo 1 vive con ella. Él trabaja y mantiene por sí solo. Ella es madre soltera. Ella tuvo que sacar adelante la familia porque su esposo la abandonó. Sus hijos trabajaron desde muy joven para mantenerse. Con mucho esfuerzo entre toda la familia pudieron comprar la casa donde ahora vive Adelaida. Su ilusión es que su negocio se mantenga y seguir vendiendo porque eso la entretiene y se sostiene.

loans.use: Buy more beverages and plastic houseware items to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa has 4 years of experience selling clothing. From a very young age she helped wash clothing; later she became ill. She had saved some money and so she bought merchandise to launch her current business. She sells all sorts of merchandise, depending on the day, and works 2 hours in the morning and again at 5 pm every day. She records her sales and earnings in a notebook. With her savings and the help of her husband she was able to have the house she lives in.

Rosa needs the loan to buy the clothing, shoes and home decorations that her clients ask for. She aspires to be able to increase her sales and earnings with the loan.

Rosa was born in the city of Esmerelda; when she was 15 she moved to Guayaquil. She is 42 years old with 3 children. Her children are not currently studying. Her husband abandoned her 10 years ago. Despite carrying sole responsibility for her home and family, Rosa has moved her family ahead. Her business has helped her make improvements to her house, which is now made of cement, and made it possible for her children to finish school. Her business is all she has. She aspires to continue to grow her business, in order to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa tiene 4 años de experiencia vendiendo ropa. Ella desde muy joven se ayudaba lavando ropa a domicilio, luego se enfermo. Ella había ahorrado y compro algo de mercadería para arrancar con el negocio. Ella recorre con la mercadería sectores dependiendo del día, lo hace todos los días 2 horas en la mañana y a las 5:00 PM. En un cuaderno registra sus ventas y los abonos. Con los ahorros que ha tenido y la ayuda de su esposo pudo tener su casa.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa, zapatos, adornos que le piden sus clientes, aspira poder incrementar sus ventas e ingresos con el préstamo.

Rosa nació en la ciudad de Esmeralda y a los 15 años se traslado a Guayaquil. Tiene 42 años, con 3 hijos actualmente sus hijos no estudian. Su esposo la abandono hace 10 años. Rosa a pesar de tener sola la responsabilidad de su hogar ha podido sacar adelante su hogar. Su negocio le ha ayudado hacer mejoras en su casa que ahora es de cemento y que sus hijos hayan podido terminar su escuela. Su negocio es lo único que tiene y aspira crecer más para mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Buy clothes, shoes, and home decoration items to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has run a cabinetry workshop together with her husband for 10 years. In the workshop they make furniture for the home: beds, chests of drawers, wardrobes, shelves - whatever the client desires. Before marrying her husband, Maria sold clothing in the street. She met her husband while selling clothing; he was selling shoes. Later they sold food on a very busy corner. Her husband had learned to make furniture when he was very young, from his father. On his day off on Sundays he would make the doors and chairs for their house. The neighbors noticed him and began to place orders. Maria and her husband bought carpentry tools and started their cabinetry workshop in the hall that leads into their house. Now they have a large workshop. They deliver to commercial centers and have a showroom of their own, where they exhibit their products. They have 3 employees, who work with them from Monday through Saturday. The workshop has good machines, which allows them to do work of high quality.

Maria needs the loan to buy wood, since during the rainy season (which we are in right now), the price of wood rises excessively. Maria is 43 years old, with 3 children. She is married. Her husband manages all of the production; she handles the distribution of the products and administration. They are a very hardworking couple that has been able to unite their efforts and as a result of their work, they have their house and workshop. Their aspiration is to continue with the business, since it is their sole source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria desde hace 10 años tiene junto a su esposo un taller de ebanistería. Aquí ellos hacen muebles para el hogar: camas, cómodas, ropero, anaqueles todo lo que el cliente desee. Antes de que ella se casara ella vendía ropa en la calle esta fue la forma como se conoció con su actual esposo que también vendía zapatos. Luego se dedicaron a vender comida en una esquina muy transitada. Su esposo había aprendido hacer los muebles de muy joven por su padre. Cuando en su día de descanso el domingo hizo las puertas y sillas para su casa y los vecinos observaban y comenzaron hacer los pedidos. Compraron una sepilladora y se iniciaron en el zaguán de su casa con el taller. Actualmente tiene un taller grande entregan a almacenes y ellos mismos tiene un lugar para exhibir sus productos. Cuentan con 3 trabajadores que están de lunes a sábados. El taller cuenta con máquinas buenas ya que les permite hacer un trabajo de calidad.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar madera ya que en la época de lluvia como ahora hace que la madera suba excesivamente de precio. María tiene 43 años. Con 3 hijos. Esta casada. Su esposo es quien esta a cargo de la producción y Maria la parte de la colocación del producto y administración. Ellos son una pareja muy trabajadora, han podido unir sus esfuerzos y, gracias a sus trabajos tiene su casa y su taller. Su aspiración es seguir en el negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingreso.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia has been selling various types of products for 18 years; she has been selling cosmetics for 5 years. Her husband has always supported her so that she would be able to work and earn income. She goes out to sell and collect payments from Thursday through Sunday. She carries a register of her sales; each client must pay at least 50% of the purchase up front. This income has been helpful for the household. Sonia needs the loan to be able to buy her products, since she has to pay for them in cash.

Sonia was born in Cañar. She came to Guayaquil with parents and siblings when she was 10 years old. She and her siblings had to work from a very young age. Her first job was to take of children. She now has 3 children of her own. Her husband works in a furniture factory. They are a very close family and work hard to combine their efforts for the wellbeing of the whole family. Sonia owns her own home; little by little she is reinforcing it with cement. Her dream is to have a store in her house someday.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia tiene 18 años vendiendo todo tipo de artículos, con la venta de cosméticos 5 años, su esposo siempre la ha apoyado para que trabaje y tenga sus ingresos. Ella sale a vender y a cobrar a partir del jueves hasta el domingo. Lleva un registro en sus ventas, todo cliente debe de dar una entrada del 50% del producto. Estos ingresos han sido de ayuda para el hogar. Ella necesita el préstamo para poder comprar sus productos ya que debe sacarlos al contado y no admiten crédito. Sonia nació en Cañar. Vino a Guayaquil con sus padres y hermanos a la edad de 10 años, desde muy pequeña junto a sus hermanos tuvo que trabajar. Su primer trabajo fue para cuidar niños. Tiene 3 hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de elaboración de muebles. Ellos son una familia muy unida tratan en lo posible de unir los esfuerzos para bienestar de toda la familia. Ellos tienen casa propia y poco a poco la están levantando de cemento. Su sueño es poner un local en su casa más adelante.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor sells clothes and accessories. He stared the business with the help of a brother who provided some merchandise for him to get off the ground. At first he only sold cloths and plastics door-to-door and now he has opened a store where he sells all types of clothing and accessories. Victor is planning to break into the household appliances market with this loan. He will use the capital to invest in microwaves and small kitchen appliances that are very popular in the sector. He believes that there is high demand for these products in his area and that his investment will be successful. Victor is very confident that things will go well and he will be able to provide a better future for his three kids.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He will use the capital to invest in microwaves and small kitchen appliances that are very popular in the sector.

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.en:
My name is Sandra M. and I run a billiards room where I also sell food, primarily to my billiards customers. I sell food such as enchiladas, tortillas with quesillo, baleadas(traditional Honduran taco), bread with beans, burritos with meats, sodas, etc. I have had my business for five years and it produces enough income to maintain my family. My goal is to increase sales and with the additional earnings, I will remodel the store (which doubles as my home)and to continue to maintain my family and to give a good education to my children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi nombre es Sandra M. me dedico a administrar mi billar tambien vendo comida en el mismo local para mis clientes del billar como ser enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, baleadas, pan con frijoles, burritas de carne, refrescos etc. tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi famila y mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi necogio (casa de habitacion) mantener a mi familia y darles estudio a mis hijos.

loans.use: To purchase: powders, chalk, plaster, brushes, wood polisher, sodas, chicken, beans, butter, oil, salt, tortillas, cheese, quesillo (traditional South American cheese),vegetables, water, ice.

loans.name: Rosa Yadira

texts.en:
My name is Rosa P. and I sell daily consumer products. I have had my business for 5 years and I have the help of my son to attend to customers. My business produces enough income to support my family and I have a good clientel because I am located near a private school. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to have more variety and higher quality goods. With the additional income I will remodel my home and continue to support my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi nombre es Rosa P. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la atencion de mis clientes, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi clientela es muy buena ya que estoy ubicada cerca de una escuela privada, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mejor variedad y calidad en mis productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y mantener a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase:sodas, beans, sugar, bread, tortillas, cheese, juices, milk, butter, margarine, oil, sweets, thread, needles, eggs, soups, sweet bread, sanitary napkins, tomatoe sauce, powdered drinks.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Jose Adalid

texts.en:
My name is Jose C. and I sell daily consumer products. I have had my business for 3 years and I have a good clientel because I offer high quality products and above all, at a low price. My business produces enough income to support my family and my goal is to increase my inventory in order to have more variety. With the additional earnings, I will remodel my business, which is also my family home, which will alow my to care better for my customers, and also to give a better education to my children who are now of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi nombre es Jose C. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les ofrezco buena calidad en mi productos y sobre todo a un bajo precio, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi invetario para tener una mayor variedad en productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio asi mismo mi hogar esto para dar una mejor antencion a mis clientes y darles un buen estudio a mis hijos que estan en la edad de ingrear al colegio.

loans.use: To purchase: sodas, juices, white bread, sweet bread, butter, oil, beans, butter, cheese, quesillo(traditional South American cheese), jam, bologna, churros, sweets, soups, suaces, toilet paper.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.en:
My name is Fredy G. and I sell all types of second hand clothing for men, women, boys and girls. I have had my business for 5 years and I have a good clientel because we sell our items at low and affordable prices for our community. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to offer a wider variety of products and with the additional earnings, I will feed my family and give a good education to my son, who is ready to begin University.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi nombre es Fredy G. me dedico a la venta de todo tipo de ropa usada para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que vendemos nuestro producto a un bajo precio y que es accesible para nuestra comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para poder ofrecer una mejor variedad de productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar a mi familia y darle un buen estudio a mi hijo que esta por ingresar a la universidad.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Matias

texts.en:
My name is Matias G. and I sell all types of fruits, sodas, churros and water. I have had my business for 4 years and I have my daughter's help in caring for the store and clients. I have a good clientel because many people in our community really like fruits and my business produces enough income to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to have higher fruit sales and with the additional earnings, I will buy a motorcycle so that I can make home deliveries to my customers, as well as feed my family and to give a good education to my daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Matias G. me dedico a la venta de todo tipo de frutas, refrescos, churros y agua, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hija para la atencion de mis clientes, mi clientela es muy buena ya que a mucha gente de nuestra comunidad le gustan las frutas, mi necogio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es ingrementar mi inventario para poder tener una mayor venta de frutas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprarme una moto ya que mis clientes me hacen pedidos a domicilio asi mismo alimentar a mi familia y darle un buen estudio a mi hija.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits, churros, sodas, water and sweets.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.en:
My name is Oswaldo R. and I sell home articles such as mirrors, pictures for decor, vases, glasses, tableclothes, porcelain figures. I have had my business for 2 years and I have an excellent clientel because I sell my products in various public and private places throughout the city. My business allow me to support my family and my goal is to have a higher quantity and variety of products in order to increase sales. With the additional earnings, I will be able to feed my three children and to give them the good education they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Oswaldo Ramirezme dedico a la venta de articulos para el hogar como ser espejos, cuadros, vasos, tasas, manteles, adornos de porcelana, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que mi producto lo vendo en varias oficinas publicas y privadas de mi ciudad, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es poder tener una mayor cantidad y variedad de productos para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar a mis 3 hijos y darles el estudio que se merecen.

loans.use: To purchase mirrors, pictures for decor and other home articles.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en:
My name is Clemente C. and I am a traveling salesperson of socks, underwear, towels for the kitchen, and handkercheifs. I have had my business for 2 years and because of my business I am able to support my family. I have a good clientel because I sell my items around the government offices. My goal is to have a wider variety of products because, these types of goods often sell quickly and with the additional earnings, I will be able to feed my family and to send my only daughter to a private university to study.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Clemente C. me dedico a la venta ambulante de calcetines, pantaletas, toallas para cocina, pañuelos, tengo mi negocio hace dos años, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto lo vendo en oficinas gubernamentales, mi meta es tener una mayor variedad de productos ya que este tipo de productos se vende rapido y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar a mi familia y darle un estudio privado de universidad a mi unica hija.

loans.use: To purchase: socks for men, women and children, towels, underwear and handkercheifs.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Gustavo started his own small business 8 years ago, a grocery store, because he was left unemployed and his daughters were completing their studies. When he did not find employment he decided to start this business. Thanks to this project he has been able to meet, not only the tuition expenses of his daughters, but also some of the household expenses, such as utilities among other things. Currently his wife works as a seamstress to help him and one of his daughters helps him in his store. His two other daughters work as well.

His responsibility to his family has motivated him to come out ahead and not give up against adversities. Gustavo now requires a loan of $1200, that he will use to purchase more merchandise and increase his sales volume and earn more income. You have the chance to help Gustavo and his family. The decision is yours, don't wait. He will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Gustavo hace 8 años comenzó con un pequeño negocio propio, una tienda de abarrotes, debido a que se quedó sin empleo y sus hijas se encontraban realizando sus estudios, por lo que al no encontrar otro trabajo se decidió a iniciar con esta actividad. Gracias a este proyecto ha podido hacer frente no sólo a los gastos de la educación de sus hijas, si no también a los gastos del hogar, como recibos de servicios entre otras cosas. Actualmente su esposa cose ropa ajena para ayudarlo y una de sus hijas le ayuda en la tienda, pues sus otras dos hijas se encuentran trabajando.

La responsabilidad con su familia lo han llevado a poder salir adelante y no vencerse ante las adversidades. Ahora Gustavo requiere de un préstamo de $ 1,200 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para surtir más mercancía e incrementar el volumen de sus ventas y por ende percibir mayores ingresos. Tú tienes la oportunidad de ayudar a Gustavo y su familia, la decisión esta en tus manos, no lo dudes más, el te lo va a agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli started a new project 6 years ago, fun fair game rentals and hot dog cart rentals, because her husband's salary was not enough to cover all of the family expenses, and much less the tuition expenses of their daughter. Today their daughter helps them with their business, and she has always received unconditional support from her husband. Eventhough the fight for a better quality of life and to provide her daughter with a better future has not been at all easy, she, with her hard work and arduous efforts has reached her goals.

She now requires a loan in the amount of $375, that she plans to repay in a term of 3 months. Araceli needs you support. With your generosity you can become an important part of her dreams. She and her family thank you.

Araceli hace 6 años inició con un nuevo proyecto, la renta de inflables y carritos de hot-dogs, debido a que con el sueldo de su esposo no se completaba a cubrir todos los gastos familiares y mucho menos se alcanzaba a cubrir los costos de la educación superior de sus hija. En la actualidad su hija le ayuda con el negocio, además siempre ha recibido el apoyo incondicional de su esposo. Aunque la lucha por tener un mejor calidad de vida y por otorgarle a su hija una mejor futuro no ha sido fácil, ella con su trabajo y arduo esfuerzo ha logrado sus objetivos.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 DLS, mismos que planea regresar en un periodo de 3 meses. Araceli necesita de tu apoyo, con tu generosidad puedes volverte parte importante de sus mayores logros, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: PURCAHSE EQUIPEMENT

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is a very optimistic and entrepreneurial woman. Some years ago she suffered a difficult divorce, which is when she tarted working for a company. But she started to have problems and her salary was not enough to cover all her payments, and she also needed to pay for her daughter's daycare. This is why she started selling clothes. This way she earns a little more money and she can still care for her daughter herself. She has managed to pull through, motivated by the love for her daughter.

Today she requires a loan of $925, that she will put towards the purchase of more merchandise to offer her clients and this way increase the volume of her sales and her roster of clients. Don't wait and help Maria Magdalena. She and her daughter need you and thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Magdalena es una mujer muy optimista y emprendedora, hace varios años sufrió un difícil divorcio, quedándose sola con su pequeña de 2 años, por lo que comenzó a trabajar como empleada en una empresa, pero empezó a tener problemas, ya que con su sueldo no alcanzaba a hacer todo los pagos necesarios, además que tenía que pagar la guardería de su hija. Por todo esto hace tiempo que decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa, de esta manera obtiene un poco de más ganancias, además que puede cuidar a su hija ella misma. Ella ha logrado salir adelante impulsada por el amor a su hija.

En este momento ella necesita de un préstamo de 925 DDLS, mismos que destinará en la compra de más mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar el volumen de ventas y su cartera de clientes. No lo dudes más y apoya a María Magdalena, ella y su hija te necesitan y te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
My name is Maria C. and I sell items for women and girls, such as shoes, blouses, perfumes, talcum powders, deodorants, and small towels. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientel because my products are of high quality and I sell them at very reasonable prices. My goal is to expand my inventory and with the additional earnings, I will be able to feed my family and to give a good education to my grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Maria C. me dedico a la venta de productos para damas y niñas como ser zapatos, blusas, perfumes, talcos, desodorantes, toallitas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que mi producto es de buena calidad y lo vendo a un precio muy bueno, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar a mi familia y darle un buen estudio a mi nieto.

loans.use: To purchase: women's shoes, blouses, perfumes, and girl's shoes and shirts.

loans.name: Monica Alejandra

texts.en:
Monica has three children and it is she that supports them financially with the income that she gains from the business she manages, the sale of seasonal items. She lived through very difficult times. She started her business because her husand abandoned her and he never returned. Today she and her children live with some family members, as she cannot afford to rent their own home. This is why she works arduously every day, with the dream of being able to save enough money to purchase a small plot of land and build a home for her children.

To realize her dreams, Monica needs to purchase more merechandise to increase her sales and her income. But she does not have enough funds to do so, which is why she needs a loan of $250. You can make her Monica's dream a reality. Do not leave her, she needs you and she thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Mónica tiene 3 hijos y es ella quien lo sostiene económicamente con los ingresos que obtiene de la actividad comercial que realiza, la venta de artículos de temporada. Ella ha vivo momentos muy complicados, pues ella comenzó con esta actividad debido a que su esposo la abandonó y no volvió jamás. Actualmente ella y sus hijos viven en casa de uno de sus familiares, ya que no puede pagar una renta para vivir en una casa aparte. Por esta situación ella trabaja cada día arduamente con la ilusión de poder ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un pequeño terreno y construirles una casa a sus hijos.

Para poder lograr sus sueños, Mónica requiere comprar más mercancía para poder aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos, pero ahora no cuenta con el capital necesario, es por ello que necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 DLLS. Tú puedes hacer realidad lo que Mónica tanto desea, no la abandones, ella te necesita y te lo agradece.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
My name is Gladys D. and I sell items for girls, I have had my business for 3 years. I have a good clientel because in most of the government and public offices, the majority of the employees have daughters. My goal is have a wider variety and higher quality goods in order to have higher sales and with the additional earnings I will be able to feed my family and to send my daughter to a private school to study, as she is now of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Gladys D. me dedico a la venta de productos para niñas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que en las oficinas publicas y gubernamentales la mayoria de los empleados tienen hijas niñas, mi meta es incrementar mis variedad y calidad en mi producto asi tener una mejor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar a mi familia y darle un estudio privado a mi hija que esta en la edad de ingresar a la escuela.

loans.use: To purchase: children's clothes, stuffed animals, lotions, deodorants, socks, dress socks, blouses and skirts.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Beatriz' husband was left unemployed because of his age and it was impossible for him to find another job. This is why they decided to invest pension in a small business, a grocery store. They didn't want to depend on their son, who was already married then, and they needed a steady income to help their daughter, afflicted with Down's Syndrome, needing special and expensive medications. For all of this Beatriz has struggled to pull through, with daily work and the unconditional support of her husband, she has made it.

To be able to continue with the business and to keep expanding it, she needs funds to invest in mroe merchandise, which is why she needs a loan of $250. She plans to repay it in a term of 3 to 6 months. Do not hesitate, she and her family need you. You have the chance to help.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 15 años, el esposo de Beatriz se quedó sin empleo y debido a su edad le fue imposible encontrar otro trabajo, es por ello que decidieron invertir su retiro en un micro negocio, una tienda de abarrotes, pues no querían depender de su hijo, quien ya era casado para ese entonces, además que necesitaban ingresos seguros, pues también tiene una hija con síndrome de dawn, quien requiere de medicamentos especiales y costosos. Es por todo ello que Beatriz ha luchado mucho para poder salir adelante y con el trabajo diario y apoyo incondicional de su esposo lo ha logrado.

Para poder continuar con el negocio y seguir creciendo, ella necesita de capital para invertir en más mercancía, por lo que necesita un crédito de 250 DLLS, mismos que planea cubrir en un plazo de 3-6 meses. No lo dudes más ella y su familia te necesitan, tú tienes la posibilidad de ayudar.

loans.use: PURCAHSE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a very active woman. Some years ago they started to have financial difficulties in their home, as her husband's salary was not enough to cover all the necessities of the home. This is when her parents left the city and she was left with their business to run, a grocery store. Luisa saw the opportunity and she, herself managed the business to solve their financial problems and this way help her husband. It has already been 3 years since all this happened and she still sees success in her business, that is now her property. She has managed to overcome many of their difficulties.

Luisa now needs a loan of $250 that will will put towards expanding the business, by purchasing greater quantities of merchandise, thereby reducing her costs. You can help her keep her business growing, and helping her husband. Do not hesitate, remember that Luisa and her family need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Luisa es una mujer muy activa, hace algunos años comenzaron a tener problemas económicos en su casa, pues el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba a cubrir todas las necesidades de hogar. Es entonces cuando sus papas se fueron da la ciudad y dejaron el negocio propio que ellos tenían, una tienda de abarrotes, Luisa vio la oportunidad de continuar ella misma con el negocio y poder resolver así su problemas y ayudar a su esposo. Ya son 3 años de que esto sucedió y ella continua satisfactoriamente con el negocio, que ahora es de su propiedad y gracias a este ha logrado superar muchas de sus dificultades.

Ahora Luisa necesita de un crédito de $ 250 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para hacer crecer su negocio, comprando una mayor cantidad de mercancía, reduciendo así el costo. Tu puedes ayudarla a poder seguir creciendo y ayudar a su esposo, no lo dude más, recuerda que Luisa y su familia te necesitan.

loans.use: PURCAHSE MERCAHNDISE

loans.name: Yessy

texts.en:
My name is Yessy A. and I sell chains, earrings, rings, bracelets, ceramic and gold bangles, for women. I have had my business for 3 years and I have a good clientel as they appreciate the good quality of my products, as ceramic is very durable. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to have a wider variety of products and with the additional earnings, I will be able to feed my family and to give a dignified education to my two children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Yessy A. me dedico a la venta de cadenas, aritos, anillos, pulseras, esclavas de enchape de oro para damas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusto mucho la calidad de mi producto ya que el enchape es muy duradero, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor varidad de productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y darles estudios dignos a mis dos hijos.

loans.use: To purchase: necklace chains, earrings, rings, bracelets, bangles, and nail polishes.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.en:
Norma Alicia is a very hard working and entrepreneurial woman. She is married and has 2 children, who are 11 and 18 years of age. They live in the city of Monterry in Nuevo Leon. One year ago Norma started to sell products by catalogue, with the goal of assisting her husband with the household expenses, as he works as a labourer for a company and earns minimum wage. She has always struggled to provide her children with a better quality of life and most importantly give them a quality education to grant them a promising future.

Norma now requires a loan of $200. She is currently collecting money from her clients and she needs the funds to keep investing in the orders she still has outstanding. Do not hesitate and help Norma reach her goals. She and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma Alicia es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, quienes tienen 11 y 18 años de edad, ellos viven en la localidad de Monterrey Nuevo León. Hace un año Norma comenzó a vender productos por catálogo, con el objetivo de poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pues el es obrero en una fabrica y recibe le salario mínimo. Ella siempre ha luchado por brindarles una mejor calidad de vida sus hijos y sobre todo por darles una educación de calidad que el permita un futuro más prometedor.

En este momento Norma requiere de un préstamo de $ 200 DLLS, pues actualmente esta en la etapa de recuperación de dinero por parte de sus clientes y necesita de capital para seguir invirtiendo en los pedidos que tiene pendientes. No lo dudes más y ayuda a Norma a lograr sus objetivos, ella y sus familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCAHSE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
My name is Azucena G. and I sell new men's and women's clothing such as shirts, jeans, socks, blouses, and dress shirts. I have had my business for 2 years and I have a good clientel because I sell high quality products at reasonable prices, fit for our community. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to have a wider variety of products and with the additional earnings I will be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Azucena G. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para caballero y dama como ser camisas, jeans, calsonetas, blusas, camisas de vestir, tengo mi negocio hcae 2 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto es de muy buena calidad y lo vendo a un precio justo para nuestra comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor variedad de productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: N0Rma

texts.en:
Responsible and hard working, these are two of the major qualities that define Norma L.. She is a married woman and a mother of 6 children, all still under age. Her husband is a driver and earns a very meager salary that is not enough to cover the household expenses, much less the education of their 6 children. Given this situation, some time ago Norma started to sell silver jewellery with her aunt, and she received financial support. But last year she decided to go off on her own and earn her own roster of clients. Currently she enjoys a long roster, and thanks to her business her children has been able to get the education they need.

She now requires a loan in the amount of $200 to increase the inventory of her products and therefore be able to offer a greater variety and increase her sales. Do not hesitate. She and her family need you. Become a fundamental par of their success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Responsable y trabajadora, son dos de la principales cualidades que definen a Norma L., quien es una mujer casad y madre de 6 hijos, todos aún menores de edad. Su marido es chofer y gana un sueldo muy bajo, con el cual no se alcanza a cubrir los gastos del hogar, y mucho menos los gastos d e la educación de sus 6 hijos. Ante esta situación hace tiempo que Norma comenzó a ayudar a su tía a vender joyería de plata, mientras que recibía un apoyo económico, pero hace un año decidido independizarse y buscar sus propios clientes. Actualmente ella cuanta con una amplia cartera y gracias a esta actividad sus hijos han podido recibir la educación que necesitan.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 DLLS, pues requiere de un mayor existencia de sus productos y de esta manera ofrecer una mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas. No lo dudes más. Ella y sus familia te necesitan , vuélvete parte fundamental de sus logros.

loans.use: PURCAHSE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is mother of 5 kids; they are currently 16, 18, 10, 21, 22, and 24 years old. Several years ago, she went through a divorce and become the only provider of the house. This is why she started selling fried food at her house, and later started to sell tamales. With this activity, she has been able to proviD. for her home and give to their kids what they need. In spite of the difficult times she’s had to go through, she’s been able to get ahead thanks to her love for her kids and her great sense of responsibility.

At this time, she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$200 to buy supplies needed to make her products, so she can increase her sales. Don’t hesitate any longer, Gloria needs support and generosity. She and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [GabrieL. Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es madre D. 5 hijos, quienes tienen actualmente 16, 18, 10, 21, 22 y 24 años D. edad. Hace muchos años que elL. sufrió un divorcio, quedando soL. al frente del hogar, por ello decidió comenzar a vender frituras en su domicilio y tiempo después inició con L. venta D. tamales. Con esta actividad ha logrado llevar el sustento a su casa y brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario. A pesar D. los difíciles momentos que ha tenido que enfrentar, por el amor a sus hijos y su amplio sentido D. L. responsabilidad ha logrado salir adelante.

En este momento elL. requiere D. un préstamo por L. cantidad D. $ 200 DLLS, para poder comprar insumos que requiere para L. elaboración D. sus productos y D. esta manera incrementar sus ventas. No lo dudes más, Gloria necesita D. apoyo y generosidad, elL. y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia has a newspaper and magazine stand, located in the town where she lives, Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro. She started the business in 1987 with her ex-husband, and they were able to grow a lot, and have six more stands. However, some time ago they got a divorce and she kept only one stand, while her ex-husband kept all the others. Thanks to her eagerness to get ahead and her love for her kids, she worked very hard and achieved her goals. Currently, one of her kids has his own newspaper stand, and all the kids have received professional education.

The struggle has not been easy, since she’s had to make her workday go from 4 a.m. to 9 p.m. She is currently requesting a loan of US$750 to buy larger quantities for delivery to other stores, and increase her sales that way. Don’t hesitate any longer, help Silvia. She sincerely thanks you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia tiene un puesto de periódico y venta de revistas, ubicado en la localidad donde vive, Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro. Ella inició el negocio en 1987, junto con su ex esposo, logrando crecer mucho, pues llegaron a tener 6 puestos más, sin embargo hace tiempo se divorciaron y ella se quedó sólo con uno de los puestos, mientras que su entonces esposo se quedo con todos los demás. Pero gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante y al amor a sus hijos, trabajó arduamente y logro sus objetivos. Hoy en día uno de sus hijos tiene su propio puesto de periódico y todos recibieron educación profesional.

La lucha no ha sido fácil, dado que ella ha tenido que hincar su jornada de trabajo desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 750 DLLS para la compra de un mayor volumen para entrega a otros negocios y así incrementar sus ventas. No lo dude más, ayuda a Silvia, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
In 1996, Don Alejandro had the need to look for an activity that would allow him to support his family, when the clock repair shop where he worked for as an assistant closed. Given his situation, he decided to start his own repair shop with the little savings he had and the support of vendors. With his daily effort and hard work, he continues to have his shop to this day.

He now needs a loan of US$925 to buy parts he needs for his activity. Help him grow and achieve his goals, don’t hesitate any longer, remember that Alejandro and his family need you and thank you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

En 1996, Don Alejandro, se vio en la necesidad de buscar una actividad que le permitiera mantener a su familia, una vez que el taller de reparación de relojes en el que laboraba como ayudante fue cerrado y viéndose en esta situación decidió iniciar su propio taller con los pocos ahorros que tenía y el apoyo de proveedores. Con el esfuerzo cotidiano y arduo trabajo hasta el momento continua satisfactoriamente con su negocio.

Ahora necesita de un crédito de $ 925 DLLS para comprar refacciones que requiere para la actividad que realiza. Ayúdalo acrecer y lograr sus metas, no lo dude más, recuerda que Alejandro y su familia te necesitan y te lo agradecen.

loans.use: PURCHASE SPARE PARTS

loans.name: Sara Edelmira

texts.en:
Sara lives in the town of Mérida, Yucatán, with her husband and their 3 kids, who are still minors. When her husband lost his job, she decided to start selling stationery at schools, with the support of a well-known stationery distributor and the help of some of her relatives. By saving money from her sales, she was able to open a store, which is now very popular in her town. Continuous work has allowed Sara to achieve her goals, with the support of her husband.

She needs funds to buy more products for her clients, and this is why she needs a loan of US$925, which she plans to pay-off in approximately 6-12 months. You can support Sara, don’t hesitate any longer. She and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán, vive Sara, con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes son aún menores de edad. Al quedar sin trabajo su esposo, ella decidió iniciar, con el apoyo de un conocido distribuidor de papelería, la venta de mercancía de papelería en las escuelas, con la ayuda de algunos familiares. Ahorrando las ganancias de sus ventas logró establecer su negocio, mismo que hora es muy conocido en la localidad. El continuo trabajo han permitido que Sara logré todas sus metas, con el apoyo de su esposo.

Ella requiere de capital para invertir en más mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes, por ello necesita de un crédito de $ 925 DLLS, mismo que planea cubrir en un plazo de 6-12 meses aproximadamente. Tú puedes apoyar a Sara, no lo dudes más, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Ligia María

texts.en:
Ligia is the mother of 3 kids (17, 19, and 14 years old), and she lives in Mérida, Yucatán. She started out fixing her neighbors’ clothes in order to have an income, since she had to support her kids when she became a widow, and did not receive a pension from her husband’s job. Ligia learned the trade of making up clothes when she was very young, since that’s what her mother did for a living, and taught Ligia. It has not been easy to get ahead on her own with her kids, but she has done it thanks to her integrity and courage.

She is requesting support to be able to get supplies to make up clothes. She needs to invest US$150, which she plans to pay back in 3 months. You have the chance to help Ligia, don’t hesitate any longer. She and her kids need you and thank you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Ligia es madre de 3 hijos de 17, 19 y 14 años de edad y vive en la localidad de Mérida Yucatán. Ella empezó arreglando ropa de sus vecinos para poder tener ingresos, ya que ella tuvo que ocuparse del gasto de sus hijos porque ella enviudó y en el trabajó de sus esposo no la pensionaron. Ligia aprendió el oficio de la confección desde muy pequeña, pues su madre, quien se dedicaba a esto, la enseñó.
