No ha sido fácil salir adelante sola con sus hijos, pero lo ha logrado gracias a su entereza y fortaleza.

Ella pide apoyo para poder tener material para confección. Por lo cual necesita invertir por la cantidad de $ 150 DLLS, misma que planea regresar en un plazo de 3 meses. Tu tienes la posibilidad de ayudar a Ligia, no lo dudes más, ella y sus hijos te necesitan y te lo agradecen.

loans.use: PURCHASE EQUIPMENT

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Doña Dolores, with the help of her husband, decided to open a small store, a grocery store. It has become a stable business through the constant work from her and her husband; they put 100% of themselves in this activity. They’ve seen their group of clients grow as a result of their dedication and effort, since it is the only way to support their kids. Thanks to this project, they have been able to provide their kids with what they need, and have overcome a lot of difficulties. This would not have been possible with her husband’s old job because the salary would vary and would not be constant.

In order to increase the variety of products, and therefore her sales, Doña Dolores is requesting a loan in the amount of US$150, which she plans to pay back in 3 months. Don’t hesitate any longer, your generosity can mean a lot of help.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Dolores, hace 10 años, con ayuda de su esposo, decidió abrir un pequeño negocio, una tienda de abarrotes, mismo que se ha consolidado por a constancia que hay en él, ya que su esposo y ella se dedican al 100% a esta actividad. Ellos han visto crecer su cartera de clientes, resultado de su dedicación esfuerzo y entrega total, pues es el único medio de subsistencia para sus hijos. Gracias a este proyecto han podido brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario y han vencido muchas dificultades, que no hubiera sido posible con el antiguo empleo de esposo, pues el sueldo era variable y eventual.

Para aumentar la variedad de sus productos y por ende sus ventas, Doña Dolores requiere de un préstamo por a cantidad de $ 150 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un plazo de 3 meses. No lo dude más, tu generosidad pude ser de mucha ayuda.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Ruby Guadalupe

texts.en:
Ruby is married and mother of 3 little kids that are 5, 3, and 2 years old. She lives in Mérida, Yucatán. Four years ago, she started out helping her mother-in-law sell dairy products and sausage. Later on, with some money and her husband’s support, she decided to start her own business doing the same type of activity. As a result of her work and dedication, she currently has several stands in different markets. Her main goal has always been to help her husband with the family’s expenses, and to be able to offer her kids a better quality of life.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$200 to buy more products in bulk, and therefore to be able to offer better prices to her clients. That way, her sales and income will increase. The time has come to support Ruby and her family, they need you. Become an essential part of their achievements.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Ruby es casada y madre de 3 pequeños de 5, 3 y 2 años de edad y vive en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán. Hace 4 años se inició en la venta de lácteos y embutidos ayudando a su suegra y después con un poco de capital y el apoyo de su marido se decidió a emprender su negocio propio en la misma actividad. Hoy en día cuanta con varios puestos en diversos tianguis, fruto de su trabajo y dedicación. Su principal objetivo siempre ah sido poder ayudar en el gasto familiar a su esposo y poder brindarles a sus pequeños una mejor calidad de vida.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 DLLS para poder comprar más producto al mayoreo y de esta forma estar en condiciones de ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes, incrementando así sus ventas e ingresos. Es momento de que te decidas a apoyar a Ruby y su familia, ellos te necesitan, vuélvete parte fundamental de sus logros.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: José Baltazar

texts.en:
When one of his kids got ill, 11 years ago, José got to know the products and how they helped improve his child’s health. It was then when he was invited to sell the products, and he started to distribute them amongst his family and friends. He continued to recommend them to other people, and his group of clients increased. It is currently his main activity, allowing him to provide for his family. This is why everyday he makes an effort to grow his business.

In order to buy products in bulk, to offer better prices, and to have enough products for his clients, José needs a loan in the amount of US$250. You have a chance to help him grow and continue with his project. Don't hesitate any longer.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Al enfermarse uno de sus hijos, hace 11 años, José conoció los productos y vio que gracias a ello mejoró su salud, fue entonces cuando le invitaron a vender el producto y de esta forma empezó a distribuirlo entre familiares y amigos. Al poco tiempo comenzó a recomendarlo a más persona y fue creciendo su cartera de clientes. Ahora es la principal actividad que le permite brindarle a su familia lo necesario, es por ello que día a día se esfuerza más por hacer crecer su negocio.

Para comprar los productos por mayoreo, ofrecer un mejor precio y tener suficiente mercancía para sus clientes, José necesita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 DLLS. Tu tienes la posibilidad e ayudarlo a crecer y continuar con su proyecto, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Susana Beatriz

texts.en:
Susana used to work for a screenprinting workshop and it was there where she learned the trade. Six years ago, she decided to work independently, starting with a bit of money and tools. The reason for the change was that her salary was not enough when she separated from her husband and become the only provider for her 5 kids, all minors. In spite of the difficulties she faced, she didn’t give up, and struggled to get ahead with her children.

Susana is currently requesting a loan in the amount of US$925, which she will use to buy supplies for screenprinting. Don’t hesitate any longer, remember that your generosity can mean a great help for Susana and her little ones. She sincerely thanks you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Susana trabajaba en un taller de serigrafía y fue allí donde aprendió este oficio, pero hace 6 años decidió independizarse con un poco de capital y herramientas, pues con el sueldo que estaba percibiendo no le alcanzaba, ya que se separó de esposo y ella se quedó sola al frente de la manutención de sus 5 hijos, aun menores de edad. A pesar de las dificultades que enfrentó no se dejó vencer y lucho por salir adelante con sus pequeños.

Ahora Susana requiere de préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS, mismo que destinará en la compra de insumos para serigrafía. No lo dude más, recuerda que tu generosidad puede ser de gran ayuda para Susana y sus pequeños, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Amalia Del Socorro

texts.en:
Amalia has been selling shoes for the last 7 years, thanks to the support of her brother, who has two shoe stores. He first gave her a certain amount of shoes on consignment for her to sell at work. Little by little, her sales and orders increased, so she decided to make this her full-time job. This is how she has been able to help her husband with the family expenses, and to get ahead with her kids.

She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of US$475 to continue buying shoes that her clients order, and mostly to be able to pay for her 4 daughters’ education. You can help her achieve her goals, don’t hesitate any longer, offer her your support. She and her family will thank you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 7 años que Amalia se dedica a la venta de zapatos, gracias al apoyo de su hermano, quien tiene dos zapaterías, quien le dio a consignación cierta cantidad de zapatos para que los vendiera en su trabajo. Poco a poco fueron creciendo sus ventas y sus pedidos, pro lo que decidió dedicarse a esta actividad de tiempo completo. Es así como ella ha logrado ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar y salir adelante con sus hijos.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 para seguir invirtiendo en los zapatos que sus clientes le piden, pero sobre todo para poder pagarle la educación a sus 4 hijas. Tú puedes hacer posible el logro de sus objetivos, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla, ella y su familia te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bessy Suyapa

texts.en:
My name is VessyI. and I sell sodas, a business I have had for 2 years. I have my son's helps in attending to customers, who are numerous because I am located near a private company and almost all the employees buy my product for lunch. My business has produced enough income to support my family and my goal is to increase sales and with the additional earnings, I will be able to buy a large refridgerator in which to store my cold/frozen items, as well as be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Bessy I. me dedico a la venta de refrescos de cola, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la atencion de mis clientes los cuales son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicada cerca de una empresa privada y caso todos los empleados compran mi producto para el almuerzo, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprarme una refrigeradora grande para tener mas producto helado y tambien alimentar a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase sodas.

loans.name: Francisca Orfilia

texts.en:
My name is Francisca A. and I make and sell corn tortillas. I have had my business for 4 years and I have my daughters' help packing and distributing my product. I have loyal customers because my product is sold in different grocery stores and markets in our neighborhood. My goal is to increase production and with the additional earnings, I will be able to build another furnace and hire a woman to work it, and I will have a higher production rate, as well as be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Francisca A. me dedico a la venta y produccion de tortillas de maiz, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mis hijas para el empacado y reparticion de mi producto, mis clientes son fijos ya que mi producto lo repartimos en diferentes pulperias y mercaditos de nuestra localidad, mi meta es incrementar mi produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder hacer otra estufa de adoquin para poder darle empleo a una muchacha y tener mayor produccion asi mismo alimentar a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase: cornflour, lime, salt, water, firewood, matches and coal.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Elisa Marina

texts.en:
My name is Elsa O. and I make and sell pork and chicken tamales. I have had my business for 5 years and I have a good clientel as my products are purchased for parties, reunions, and special get-togethers. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to increase sales. With the additional earnings, I will be able to remodel the store and to hire a woman to help me in the production of the tamales, I will also be able to continue to support my family and to give a dignified education to my children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Elsa O. me dedico a la produccion y venta de nacatamales ded cerdo y pollo, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que mi producto lo vendo para fiestas, reuniones y encargos especiales, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi lugar de trabajo y contratar una muchacha para que me ayude con la produccion de los nacatamales asi mismo mantener a mi familia y darles un estudio digno a mis hijos.

loans.use: To purchase platain leaves, pork, chicken, flour, rice, olives, raisins, water, salt, spices, butter, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Yeni Rosibel

texts.en:
My name is Yeni P. and I make and sell cotton candy. I have had my business for 3 years and as I am a single mother, I have my son's help making and selling my product. I have a good clientel because I am located in the central park where there are many children who come to play every afternoon. My business generates enough income to support my family. My goal is to increase sales and with the additional earnings I will be able to give a university education to my son and be able to feed my family as well.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Yeni P. me dedico a la produccion y venta de algodones de azucar, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la produccion y venta de mi producto ya que soy madre soltera, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicada en un parque central en donde muchos niños vienen a jugar todas las tardes, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder darle un buen estudio de universidad a mi hijo asi mismo alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, artificial flavorings, bags and wooden spoons.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Edis Ermelinda

texts.en:
My name is Edis V. and I make and sell pork and beef burritos. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientel as I am located near a bus terminal and many people buy my burritos. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to increase production in order to have higher sales. With the additional earnings I will be able to hire someone to help me cook and I will also be able to feed my family and give them a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Edis V. me dedico a la produccion y venta de burritas de carne de cerdo y res, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicada cerca de una estacion de buses y mucha gente compra mis burritas, mi negociome genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi produccion para tener una mejor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder contratar una persona que me ayude a cocinar asi mismo alimentar a mi familia y darles un buen estudio.

loans.use: To purchase tortillas, cheese, pork, chicken, salt, water, spices, bread, plates, cups, napkins, rice, beans, oil and butter.

loans.name: Miguel Orlando

texts.en:
My name is Miguel A. and I am a taxi driver. I have had my taxi for 5 years and I have many customers as I am located at a taxi stop near the university and on the weekends I am stationed near the city's market. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to repair my taxi in order to provide a better service to my customers. With the additional earnings I will be able to continue to support my family and to save in order to buy another vehicle to make another taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Miguel A. me dedico a transportar gente dentro de mi ciudad, tengo mi taxi hace unos 5 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicado en un punto de taxi cerca de la universidad y los fines de semana mi punto de taxis es en el mercado de la ciudad, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de familia, mi meta es arreglar bien mi taxi para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga mantener mi familia y ahorrar para comprarme otro automovil para ponerlo de taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare car parts.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Rosa Abel

texts.en:
My name is Rosa Abel A. and I sell firewood from my car. I have had my business for 3 years and I have many customers as I live in a town where the majority of home use firewood to cook. My business generate enough income to support my family. My goal is to increase sales and with the additional earnings I will be able to feed my family and to give a good education to my children, who are ready to enroll in school.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Rosa Abel A. me dedico a la venta de leña en coche, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que en mi pueblo la mayoria de las casas consume leña para cocinar, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y darles un buen estudio a mis dos hijos que estan por ingresar a la escuela.

loans.use: To buy tires, wood, and ball bearins.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
My name is Virgilio E. and I sell soda drinks. I have had my business for 3 years and I have a good clientel as I live in an area that is very hot and the residents drink iced sodas. My business generates enough income to feed my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to have higher sales. With the additional earnings, I will buy another, larger refridgerator in order to hold many more well-chilled drinks, as well as feed my family and give a dignified education to my grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Virgilio E. me dedico a la venta de refrescos de cola, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que en el lugar en donde vivimos hace mucha calor y la gente toma mucho refresco helado, mi negocio me genera ingresos para alimentar mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta de refrescos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprarme otro refrigerador mas grande para tener muchos refrescos bien helados asi mismo poder alimentar mi familia y darle un estudio digno a mi nieto.

loans.use: To purchase drinks, ice and bags.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Victor Mamerto

texts.en:
My name is Victor M. and I sell ground-corn. I have had my business for 5 years and I have a good clientel as the majority of our community grinds corn to daily make tortillas. My business generates enough income to support my family. My goal is to hire someone else to help me grind the corn and also to have higher earnings and with these earnings I will be able to buy another grinder, to feed my family and to remodel my workspace (which doubles as my home).

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Victor M. me dedico a moler maiz, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que la mayoria de nuestra comunidad muele maiz para hacer tortillas para comer a diario, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es contratar un muchacho para que me ayude a moler y asi tener mayores ganancias y con las mismas poder comprarme otro molino, alimentar mi familia y remodelar mi lugar de trabajo (casa de habitacion)

loans.use: To purchase oil, lima beans, water, spoons.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio has been living in the town of Querétaro, Querétaro, for the last 16 years. He originally got there looking for a job. He worked for a company for many years, and 10 years ago he started his own business of clothing sales when they offered him some merchandise for US$50. Through the years, he has been able to grow his business, and it is currently one of the most frequently visited in the Tepetate market. This has allowed him to have a better quality of life and some savings.

His entrepreneur spirit and eagerness to get ahead have made possible what Sergio has achieved through his work and effort. However, Sergio wants to continue growing and that’s why he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$925, to be able to increase the amount of merchandise he offers. You can help Sergio with your generosity, and become an important part of his achievements. He will sincerely thank you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Sergio radica en la localidad de Querétaro, Querétaro, desde hace 16 años, cuando llegó en busca de trabajo. En un principio laboro durante muchos años como empleado en una empresa, pero hace 10 años inició con su propio negocio de venta de ropa, cuando le ofrecieron una mercancía por 50 DLLS. Con lo años ha logrado capitalizar su negocio, mismo que en la actualidad es uno de los más visitados en el mercado del Tepetate, esto le ha permitido tener un mejor nivel de vida y ciertos ahorros.

El espíritu emprendedor y las ganas de superarse han hecho posible lo que hasta el momento Sergio, con su trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado, sin embargo Sergio aun quiere seguir creciendo y por ello ahora requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de 925 DLLS para poder incrementar la mercancía que ofrece. Con tu generosidad puedes ayudar a Sergio y convertirte en parte importante de su realización, el te lo va a agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: José Isaías

texts.en:
Isaías has been selling barbecue for the last 20 years. His is a two-generations business, since his parents and grandparents also worked in this type of activity. At first, he used to sell his product to other businesses, and later he decided to open his own store, which is frequently visited and very respected up to this day. He has struggled a lot to grow, and to provide his 3 children with a better quality of life and quality education.

Currently, Isaías needs a loan in the amount of US$475, because he needs to buy advertisement material and a counter for his business. Don’t hesitate any longer, your generosity can mean a great help for him and his family.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Isaías tiene ya 20 años de dedicarse a la venta de barbacoa, siendo este un negocio de dos generaciones, pues sus padres y abuelos también se dedicaron a esta actividad en su momento. Inicialmente vendía su producto a otros negocios y establecimientos, pero tiempo después decidió poner su propio negocio establecido y hasta la fecha es un negocio muy visitado y ampliamente acreditado. El ha luchado mucho por crecer y por brindarles a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de calidad.

En este momento Isaías necesita de un crédito de 475 DLLS, pues requiere comprar material publicitario y un mostrador para su negocio. No lo dudes más, tu generosidad puede ser de gran ayuda para el y su familia.

loans.use: purchase equipment

loans.name: Elsira

texts.en:
My name is Elsira I. and I sell daily consumer products. I have had my business for 5 years and I have excellent customers as my neighborhood is a little far from the city and there are not many grocery stores. My goal is to expand my inventory and to have more products of higher quality to offer to my customers. With the additional earnings I will remodel my business and feed my family and give an education to my two grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Elsira I. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que mi comunidad es un poco retirada de la ciudad y no existen muchas pulperias, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor cantidad de producto y asi ofrecer calidad a mis clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio, alimentar mi familia y darles estudios a mis dos nietos.

loans.use: To purchase drinks, churros, salt, rice, tortillas, cheese, quesillo(traditional Latin American cheese), white and sweet bread, sweets, juices, sweets, spices, butter, oil, margarine, beans, toilet paper, water, ham,   eggs, milk.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha started her own business 7 years ago; she sells jewelry. She needed to help her husband, who was going through a difficult financial moment because his salary was very low and not enough to cover their children’s needs. With her family’s love and her great sense of responsibility, Bertha continues to this day with the project, and has been able to provide her kids with what they need, and help her husband that way.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$1000, which she plans to pay off in 6-12 months. With this money, she will buy more supplies, so she will increase her sales, and therefore her family’s well-being. Help Bertha, she and her family need your generosity. Don’t hesitate any longer, go ahead and support her.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha hace 7 años comenzó con su propio negocio, la venta de joyería, por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo, quien estaba atravesando por momentos difíciles económicamente, puesto que su sueldo es muy bajo y no con ello no se alcanzaba para hacer frente a todas las necesidades de sus hijos. Gracias al apoyo moral de su familia y a su gran sentido de responsabilidad, Bertha aún continúa con su proyecto y ha logrado darles a sus hijos lo necesario, ayudando así a su esposo.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 1000 DLLS, mismo que planea cubrir en un periodo de 6-12 meses. Con dicha cantidad comprará más mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta forma poder incrementar sus ganancias y por ende el bienestar de su familia. Ayuda a Bertha, ella y su familia necesitando e tu generosidad, no lo dudes más y apóyala.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a very hard-working and driven person. She is married, and lives in the town of Santa Catarina, Nuevo León. Four years ago, she started to sell clothes and shoes amongst her neighbors, and after realizing that sales were going up and that she was getting the income that she needed, she decided to sell her products at the street vendor markets. She started this activity because they were not able to cover all the house expenses and children’s needs, since her husband earns the minimum wage. Her main goal is to provide her children with the education that they need, that’s why she works hard every day.

She currently needs a loan in the amount of US$425, which she will use to buy more merchandise in order to increase her income, and therefore the possibility that her kids will finish school successfully. Don’t hesitate any longer, you have the chance to help Francisca. She will sincerely thank you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, es casada y vive en la localidad de Santa Catarina, Nuevo León. Hace 4 años comenzó a vender ropa y calzado entre sus vecinos, pero luego de ver que las ventas aumentaban y le generaban los ingresos que tanto necesitaba decidió comenzar a vender sus productos en los mercados rodantes. Esta actividad la inició a causa de la falta de recursos para hacer frente a todas las necesidades del hogar y de sus hijos, pues su esposo gana el salario mínimo. Sin embargo su principal objetivo es brindarles a sus hijos la educación que requieren, es por ello que trabaja de manera ardua cada día.

Ella ahora necesita de un crédito de $ 425 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la comprar de más mercancía, permitiendo así aumentar sus ingresos y por ende la posibilidad de que sus hijos culminen sus estudios satisfactoriamente. No lo dudes más, tú tienes la posibilidad de ayudar a Francisca, ella te lo va a agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.en:
My name is Carmen E. and I sell daily consumer products. I have had my business for 5 years and I have my son's help to attend to my customers. I have a good clientel because I am located near a bus terminal in the center of the city. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory to have higher sales. With the additional earnings, I will be able to remodel my home, support my family and to give a private education to my son who is ready to enroll in University.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Carmen E. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años y tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la atencion de mis clientes, mi clientela es muy buena porque estoy ubicada a la par de una central de buses en el centro de nuestra ciudad, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion, mantener a mi familia y darle un estudio privado a mi hijo que esta ingresando a la universidad.

loans.use: To purchase churros, drinks, bateries, candles, matches, juices, butter, cheese, tortillas, shampoos, cookies, white and sweet bread, soup, tomatoe sauce, toothpaste, thread, needles, notebooks, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, beans, rice, sugar,butter,oil,and margarine.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Five years ago, Pedro lost his job, so he looked for an alternative to earn the necessary income to provide his wife and children with what they needed. This is how he became a taxi driver, an activity he does everyday. He’s had to face difficult times. However, thanks to the huge love he has for his family, and to his great sense of responsibility, he has been able to stand up and continue, always with courage and integrity.

Pedro needs to buy parts for his taxi, which he uses to work. To be able to do this, he needs a loan in the amount of US$475, which he plans to pay back in approximately 5-10 months. Help Pedro and his family, they need your support. Don’t hesitate any longer, they will thank you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 5 años Pedro se quedó sin empleo y ante la necesidad de llevar lo necesario a su esposa e hijos, buscó una alternativa que le generara los ingresos necesarios. Es así como comenzó con la actividad que hoy lleva a cabo día a día, taxista. El ha tendido que enfrentar momentos difíciles, pero gracias la enorme amor que le tiene a su familia y al gran sentido de responsabilidad que posee ha podido levantarse y continuar, siempre con la fuerza y entereza necesaria.

Pedro necesita comprar refacciones para el taxi, que es su instrumento de trabajo, pero para poder hacerlo necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un periodo de 5-10 meses aproximadamente. Ayuda a Pedro y su familia, ellos necesitan de tu apoyo, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo va a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase refactions

loans.name: Test Name

texts.en: T. DESCRIPTION

loans.use: TEST USE

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda began with a small home business exactly one year ago. She is married and lives with her family in Santa Catarina, Nuevo Leon. Her husband is a day laborer and earns just minimum wage, which does not meet their expenses. She started her business to help cover the household expenses for her husband and their children. With her strength and dedication, and above all with her good humor and love, Rosalinda has been able improve the life of her children and help her husband. Now she needs a loan of $USD925 to purchase merchandise which will increase her sales having a greater variety of products for her customers. You can help Rosalinda and her family with your generosity; you just need to decide. She will be sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Rosalinda comenzó con un pequeño negocio de abarrotes en su propio domicilio, hace exactamente un año. Ella es casada y vive con su familia en la localidad de Santa Catarina, en el estado de Nuevo León. Su esposo es obrero y gana el salario mínimo, con esto no les alcanzaba, antes de iniciar con el negocio, para cubrir todos lo gastos y necesidades del hogar y de sus hijos. Pero con esfuerzo y dedicación, pero sobre todo con buen ánimo y amor, Rosalinda ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y sobre todo ayudar a su esposo.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de mercancía, lo que hará que aumenten sus ventas al tener más surtido para sus clientes. Tu puedes ayudar con tu generosidad a Rosalinda y su familia, únicamente hace falta que te decidas, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella has a laundry where she provides washing and drying services. Bella started her business by borrowing 200 dollars from the loan sharks to buy a washing machine. In the beginning she only provided her services to friends and neighbors. Now she offers washing, drying and renting of washing machines for her clients' homes. She would use this loan to buy the clothes dryer she needs to keep up with demand for her services. She is confident that with this new tool her business will grow.

Bella is 44 years old. She has 3 children; one of her children is currently in school. She depends on the business to support her family. Bella is confident that this loan will give her family economic security and allow her to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Bella tiene una lavandería donde presta servicios de lavado y secado de ropa. Bella empezó su negocio prestando un dinero a los chulqueros (loan sharks) de 200 dólares para la compra de una lavadora. Al principio solo prestaba servicio de lavado a amigos y vecinos. Ahora ella ofrece servicio de lavado, secado y alquiler de lavadoras a domicilio. Bella usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar una secadora que necesita para atender muy bien a la demanda. Ella tiene la seguridad que con esta nueva herramienta de trabajo su negocio va ha tener un crecimiento. Bella tiene 44 años, esta unida tiene tres hijos uno de ellos estudia. Ella depende del negocio para apoyar a su familia. Bella tiene la confianza que este préstamo le dará seguridad económica a su familia y permitirle adecuar su vivienda.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a new washer

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a potato and onion wholesale distributor at a local market. He learned the trade from his parents who practice the same business in a different province of Ecuador named Chimborazo. He started off small, but now he is a wholesaler and distributes to many store owners and people who have stands in local markets. He will use the loan in order to invest in new products such as limes, sugar and oil. Jose is from Chimborazo and has two children. He and his wife are very positive about their future.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new products such as limes, sugar and oil

loans.name: Harefa

texts.en:
Harefa is 33 years old and lives with her 3 children in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

She has passed her 1st loan cycle and is continuing with a 2nd loan cycle. Before she had a problem with income for her family and fees for her children's school, but then she decided to take a loan to increase her business and get a good income for her family.

She has a stove in her yard to bake bread in. By taking a loan she can buy wood, flour and any other things she needs so that her business can grow.

loans.use: To buy wood and flour

loans.name: Anis Gul

texts.en:
Anis Gul was born in 1957 and lives with her 5 children in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

She is a widow who lost her husband about 3 years ago. She had a problem generating income for her children but then she came to AFSG and took a 1st loan cycle. Right now she is through her 1st loan cycle.

She hopes to receive a 2nd loan cycle through AFSG so that she can buy wood, flour and any other important parts for her business.

loans.use: To buy wood and flour

loans.name: Gulalai

texts.en:
Gulalai is 49 years old  and lives with her 4 children in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

She has a shared business with her husband and wants to take a loan for him. She cleans and feeds the sheeps and cows and her husband sells  their meat in the bazaar.

Gulalai's husband has a butcher shop near her home area. They are happy to be able to take a loan from AFSG - through this process their business can grow and they can get a good income.

loans.use: To buy sheep and cows

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
Nafisa is 54 years old and lives with her 5 children in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

She shares a business with her husband with whom she took a 2nd loan cycle. Like a good partner, Nafisa cleans and packages the goods and then her husband sells them at the bazaar. With this process they can make a good income.

They believe that by taking a loan through AFSG they can buy more goods and increase their business.

loans.use: To buy goods .

loans.name: Maki

texts.en:
Maki is 41 years old and lives with her 4 children in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Maki took a 2nd loan cycle for her husband who has a fresh fruits and vegetable shop in a small town. She shares the business with her husband -she washes, cleans and packages the fruits and vegetables and then her husband sells them at a good prize at the bazaar.
 
Through taking another loan with AFSG they can buy more vegetables and fresh fruits and through this get a higher income.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Elsevar

texts.en:
Elsevar was born in 1980 in the Lachin region of Azerbaijan. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). After completing his military service, he had to support his family instead of continuing his education. Two years ago Elsevar rented a very small shop to do phone repair. He has been busy with repairing mobile phones as well as with the selling phone accessories. Unfortunately he lacks enough funds to develop his business more. 

He has applied for a loan of $1000 to expand his shop and to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: To expand his shop and to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Kifayat

texts.en: Kefayat is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region. She  settled with her family in Sumgait city. She is 52. She widow and has 3 children. Kefayat has lost the husband. Not looking all difficulties in current of 9 years this mother has grown up hers children herself. Five years ago she rented the small shop and has bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc.

loans.use: To construct her own food market and to buy the new refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rampei would like to buy packs of beverages, flour, and cereals for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sintoyia wants to buy different varieties of beads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peris would like to buy 2 steers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Kuresoi wants to buy different varieties of beads for beadwork.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rhoda would like to buy 3 young steers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Judy would like to buy a bale of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jacinta would like to buy cereal, laundry detergent, beverages, and snacks for her shop

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy was born in 1965 in Tinganga, Kiambu. She is married with five children. Two are out of school and in college while the other three are still in primary and secondary school. Lucy is an active member of Kaspat Catholic Church. Her colleagues formed a group in 2002 and registered with WEEC the same year. 
She has been the group discipline mistress since its formation. Lucy has been a farmer since her youth. She is a role model to many young women. 
When she was young, she used to look after her fathers cow after school. Today Lucy keeps dairy cattle. She is also a poultry farmer. Currently she has 300 chicks. At her farm, she also grows maize and beans for home consumption. Last season, she harvested enough for her family and sold five bags of maize and and three bags of beans to local residents. She also practices pig farming. Currently she has three pigs.
Given a loan of USD 450, Lucy intends to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: Lucy wants to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy more women trousers and baby wear.  She also wants to move her business to a rental shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mercy would like to open a beauty shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would like to buy shares in the stock market.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widow, 60 years old and disabled. She runs a fruit and vegetable stall near her residence. She has been in this business for twelve years now. Since her husband passed away it has been very difficult for her to raise the family. The business she runs is the sole income generating unit for the family. She is helped by her young son to operate the business - due to her disability condition she cannot operate the business fully.

Asha is planning to buy a cart and large baskets which will facilitate her carrying fruits and vegetables from the market to her business premises. Having this equipment can help her run her business with more ease. To implement this plan she is in need of USD 400.

loans.use: Purchase a cart, baskets and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy would like to venture into the shares business.

loans.name: Segolena

texts.en:
Segolina is 30 years old, not married, and has one son. She lives in the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam. She owns a retail pharmacy selling human medicines. Her business is licenced with the local authorities. She is usually faced with stockouts in her business. Drugs for malaria and waterborne diseases have a high turnover in her pharmacy because the area where she lives is prone to malaria and waterborne diseases like cholera and amoebic dysentery. 

Segolina is planning to add a stock of medicines, especially for malaria and waterborne diseases. In the future she plans to open another pharmacy in the next street. She currently want to stabilize the existing shop. Segolena is in need of USD 550 to add the required stock.

loans.use: Add Stock of medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy shares in the stock market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy shares from stock exchange market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Salivia would like to buy shares in the stock market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to buy shares from the Nairobi Stock Exchange Market.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married. She has a grown son who is 26 and is fostering a 10-year-old orphan boy from a disfunctional family of alcoholics. She also takes care of an elderly lady who doesn’t have a family. Irina’s business selling office supplies and providing copying services is the main source of income for her family. Irina is very sociable. Her friendliness and respectful attitude have given her a good reputation at the market. Irina has also proven to be a good manager of her finances. She has received and promptly repaid 12 loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Loans have enabled a gradual expansion of Irina’s business. Originally she had only one portable table with office supplies. Lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped her purchase inventory in bulk and rent a storage room. Recently she bought two copier machines and now provides copying services. Irina is requesting a loan of $1,200 for several purposes. She is planning to purchase a range of office supplies, toner and copier paper. Financial assistance will help Irina secure good maintenance for her copy machines so that she can provide a high quality copying service. It will also help her cover some necessities at home to improve the quality of life for her family. Increased sales and services will generate more profits allowing Irina to save money and eventually buy a facility for her business which has always been her dream.

Ірина – одружена. В неї дорослий син, йому 26 років. Вона доглядає 10-річного хлопчика-сироту з родини алкоголіків. До того ж Ірина ще дбає про хвору жінку похилого віку, в якої не має рідних. Бізнес з продажу канцтоварів та надання послуг копіювання, яким займається Ірина, - єдине джерело доходів для родини. Ірина – дуже комунікабельна. Її ввічливість та дружелюбність забезпечили їй гарну репутацію на ринку. Ірина вміє розпоряджатися власними фінансами. Вона отримала та без жодних проблем виплатила 12 позик в „Надії України”. Позики сприяли поступовому росту бізнесу Ірини. Вона починала з торгівлі канцтоварами за маленьким столиком. Кредитні послуги „Надії України” допомогли їй придбати товари оптом та винайняти склад для зберігання інвентарю. Нещодавно вона придбала два ксерокси та зараз надає копіювальні послуги. Ірина просить про позику в 1 200 доларів через декілька причин. Вона планує придбати різні канцтовари, картриджі та папір для копіювання. Фінансова підтримка допоможе Ірині забезпечити якісну роботу копіювальних машин. До того ж позика допоможе їй придбати необхідні речі для дому, які покращать рівень життя її рідних. Зростання обсягів продажу та розширення сфери надання копіювальних послуг допоможуть Ірині отримати додатковий прибуток, заощадити гроші та врешті решт придбати власну будівлю для свого бізнесу, про яку вона завжди мріяла.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Blanca Petra

texts.en:
Blanca is married and lives in Santa Catarina, Nuevo Leon. About 10 years ago she began a small general store solely to improve her family's quality of life, because her husband's salary just wasn't enough. With the support of her family, and with a lot of effort and dedication, she has been able to continue with her project and successfully reach her goal.

Now Blanca needs a loan for $USD925 to puchase merchandise and increase her income. Without a doubt, your generosity can help Blanca. She needs and would appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Blanca es casada y vive en la comunidad de Santa Catarina, en el estado de Nuevo León. Hace aproximadamente 10 años ella comenzó con un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, con el único objetivo de poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo esto no era posible. Con el apoyo de su familia, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ella ha logrado continuar con su proyecto, pero más importante aún, ha podido lograr su objetivo.

En éste momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares, mismos que destinará en la compra de mercancía y con esto podrá lograr un incremento en sus ganancias. Tú puedes ayudar con tu generosidad a Blanca y su familia, no lo dudes más, ella necesita de tu apoyo y te lo agradece.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Alma Mireya

texts.en:
Alma began her business selling shoes through a catalog about two years ago because she needed to help support her family. Her husband is a day laborer and doesn't earn enough to cover the household expenses. Alma is working very hard to improve the standard of living for her family and to support her husband through this time of financial difficulty. She knows that with effort and strength she can overcome adversity which she has demonstrated through the success of her project.

Now Alma needs a loan for $USD1,200 to purchase additional merchandise and to fulfill orders from her customers. Alma needs you and hopes to receive this loan. You can make it happen with your support. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Alma inició su negocio de venta de zapatos por catálogo desde hace casi dos años, debido a la gran necesidad de sostener a su familia, pues su esposo, quien es obrero, no gana lo suficiente para solventar los gastos presentes. Es por esta situación que Alma trabaja muy duro para poder sacra adelante a su familia y apoyar a su esposo en estos momento de crisis económica por la que atraviesan actualmente. Ella sabe que con esfuerzo y fortaleza las adversidades pueden superarse y lo ha demostrado son el éxito se su proyecto.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 1200 DLLS para poder comprar más mercancía y hacer frente a os pedidos de sus clientes. Alma te necesita y tiene la esperanza de poder recibir dicho crédito, tu puedes hacerlo posible con tu colaboración, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.en:
Alma Rosa began her business selling cosmetics via catalog two years ago because she needed to earn additional income to cover increased household expenses which could not be covered by her husband's earnings. She is a mother of three children who are 14, 10 and 2 years old, and is facing a lot of school expenses. A friend helped her start this business and to overcome many adversities. Her work and her responsibilities are constantly in Alma Rosa's thoughts.

She hopes to recive a loan for $USD1,200 to increase the variety of her merchandise and thereby grow her customer base. You can help make possible the growth and continuation of Alma's business. It is very important because only this way can she help her husband and give her children the education they have the right to receive. Only with your help can this be possible. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Alma Rosa comenzó su negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo hace 2 años, debido a la necesidad que tenía de generar ingresos extras, pues se presentaban en ese momento muchos gastos en su hogar, mismos que eran imposibles de solventar con sólo el sueldo de su esposo, pues ella es madre de 3 hijos, de 14, 10 y 2 años de edad, por lo que los gastos de la escuela son muy grandes. Gracias a una amiga comenzó con esta actividad, misma que le ha dado ha su familia lo necesario y ayudado a vencer muchas adversidades. El trabajo y la responsabilidad están cada día en el pensamiento de Alma Rosa. Ella tiene la esperanza de recibir un crédito de $1200 DLLS para poder surtir más mercancía e incrementar de esta manera su cartera de clientes. Tu puedes hacer posible la continuación y crecimiento del negocio de Alma, es muy importante, pues sólo así ella podrá seguir ayudando a su esposo y dar a sus hijos la educación a la que tienen derecho. Sólo con tu ayuda esto será posible, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is married and lives in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon with her husband and 6 children. She has always enjoyed and been good at sales. Therefore, seeing the needs of her household (and with the help of a friend) she began selling cosmetics and jewelry via catalog. At first it wasn't easy because she had few sales and customers. Nevertheless, with daily work and arduous effort little by little to she successfully increased her customer base and grew her sales volume.

She is an example of strength and perseverance. She didn't give up the battle and 9 years after beginning her business she continues the fight to increase it every day. Therefore, she needs a loan for $USD1,200 to invest in additional merchandise and increase her sales volume. You can become an important and fundamental part of Flavia's success. This business is sustaining her children. Don't doubt any more, she needs you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Flavia es casada y vive en la localidad de Monterrey, Nuevo León, con su esposo y sus 6 hijos. Ella siempre ha tenido gusto y facilidad por las ventas, por lo que al ver las necesidades que tenían en su hogar y con la ayuda de una amiga, comenzó a vender cosméticos y joyería por catálogo. Al principio no fue nada fácil, pues sus ventas eran bajas y no tenía muchos clientes, sin embargo con su trabajo diario y esfuerzo arduo logro poco a poco incrementar su cartera de clientes y aumentar por mucho el volumen de sus ventas.

Ella es un ejemplo de constancia y perseverancia, pues no desistió en la batalla y después de ya 9 años de iniciar con su negocio aún continúa y lucha por seguir creciendo cada día más. Es por ello que ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 1200 DLLS para invertirlos en la compra de más mercancía e incrementar sus ventas. Tú puedes volverte parte importante y fundamental de los logros de Flavia, pues un negocio es la actividad que mantiene a sus hijos. Non lo dudes más, ella te necesita.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Juana

texts.en:
Juany is an active woman with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. Throughout her life she has faced many obstacles, but love for her children has pushed her to keep on fighting. Separated from her husband, with 7 children to care for and no stable work or income, 13 years ago she began selling shoes and also baked goods. A short time later she purchased her own supplies and began to accumulate a little capital to set up her own business, which was the only means to sustain her family. This helped her a lot and enabled her to survive the destruction of her home caused by a series of hurricanes in her region.

Undoubtably, Juany's life has not been simple, but there is also no doubt that she is an admirable woman. Now she needs your help to continue. She needs a loan for $USD1,200. Don't doubt any more, she and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Juany es una mujer muy activa y con un fuerte espíritu emprendedor, pues a lo largo de su vida ha tenido que enfrentas muchos obstáculos, pero el amor a sus hijos ha sido el motor que la ha impulsado a seguir luchando. Separada de su marido, con 7 hijos que mantener y al no contar con un trabajo estable, ni ingresos seguros, hace trece años comenzó a vender zapatos por medio de una proveedora y también la venat de repostería. Al poco tiempo de esto compró un lote completo y de ahí comenzó a juntar un poco de capital para establecer su negocio, mismo que sería la única fuente de subsistencia para su familia. Esta actividad le ha ayudado mucho, pues también gracias a esta pudo sobrellevar la destrucción de su casa por el paso de unos de huracanes más fuertes que ha azotado en la región.

No hay duda de que la vida de Juany no ha sido sencilla, pero también no hay duda que es una mujer admirable, ahora ella requiere de tu apoyo para continuar, necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de 1,200 DLLS. No lo dudes más, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purcahse mercandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is married and has 6 children. In 1996 he started a small buisness: a general store which she started with just a small variety of products. With dedication and support from her daughter little-by-little it grew into one of the most popular stores in her area. Martha is an example of the daily fight and strength. She is an admirable woman who despite the adversities she's had to overcome continues in the battle.

Now Martha needs a loan for $USD750 to grow her business and purchase a wider variety of goods. Only with your collaboration will this be possible. Don't doubt anymore, remember she needs you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Martha es casada y tiene 6 hijos, ella en 1996 inició un pequeño negocio, una tienda de abarrotes, comenzando con muy poco surtido, pero con la dedicación y apoyo su hija poco apoco logró ir creciendo y ahora es de las tiendas con mayor popularidad de su localidad. Martha es un ejemplo de lucha y esfuerzo diario, es una mujer admirable, que a pesar de las adversidades que ha tenido que vencer sigue en la batalla.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 750 DLLS pues quiere hacer crecer aun más su negocio, comprando un mayor volumen de mercancía. Sólo con tu colaboración esto será posible, no lo dudes más, recuerda que ella te necesita.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jesús Martín

texts.en:
Jesus Martin D. Leon Lopez is single and has no children. He has a snack shop where two people work. This business started as a result of a business transfer. For a long time he had searched for financial independence since he had always been working for someone else's company. His effort, dedication and enthusiasm have led him to achieve what he has today, and each day he works harder to grow.

Now Jesus needs a loan for $USD925 to invest in products for his establishment. All Jesus needs to move forward is your support. Don't think about it anymore. Today for him, tomorrow for you. Make it happen.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Jesús Martín D. L. L. es soltero, no tiene hijos. El tiene un snack como negocio, en el cual laboran dos personas. Este negocio lo inicio por medio D. un traspaso, pues durante mucho tiempo había buscado la autonomía económica, ya que siempre había laborado para alguna empresa. Su esfuerzo, dedicación y entusiasmo lo han llevado a lograr lo que hasta ahora tiene, y cada día trabaja mas para crecer.

Ahora el señor Jesús necesita un préstamo D. 925 DLLs, éstos los invertirá en la compra D. productos para su establecimiento. Para que Jesús siga adelante sólo basta con que lo apoyes, no lo pienses tanto. Hoy por el, mañana por ti. Hazlo posible.

loans.use: purchase mercandise

loans.name: Blanca Hilda

texts.en:
Blanca Hilda Garcia L. is married with four adult children who are 39, 36, 35, and 32 years old. Blanca sells shoes and beauty products because her financial needs forced her to seek additional income. Her oldest daughter participates in the business and has been helping her mother for over 10 years to grow the business.

Blanca needs a loan for $USD375 to purchase a supply of American tennis shoes. She wants to grow her small business and therefore needs your help. Without it, she cannot make her business or her dream a reality. She only needs your generosity. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Blanca Hilda G. L. es casada, tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, los cuales tienen 39, 36, 35, 32 años. La señora Blanca vende calzado y productos de belleza, puesto que las necesidades económicas la orillaron a buscar una entrada de dinero En esté negocio participa su hija menor, ella ayuda a su madre hace 10 años y gracias a su colaboración el negocio ha ido avanzando.

La señora Blanca necesita un préstamo que consta de 375 DLLs, los cuales utilizará para la compra de un lote de tenis americanos, ya que ella quiere crecer como microempresaria y para esto necesita de tu ayuda, sin ella no logrará que su negocio y sueño se realicen. Sólo basta con que tu generosidad te conduzca a ayudar. Gracias.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Díaz Moctezuma

texts.en:
J. lives in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon. She is divorced which left her to support her three children. At that time in the 70's she started a small business, a restaurant, but she was forced to stop to care for her children. Four years ago she decided to reopen her business, remodeling the interior. Today her business is generating a good income and therefore she wants it to continue to grow.

She needs a loan for $USD475 to purchase supplies which she uses to prepare her food. She only needs your help, without it she cannot develop her business. We look forward to your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora J. vive en la localidad de Monterrey Nuevo León. Ella es divorciada, por lo que se quedó al frente de la manutención de sus tres hijos, fue entonces que en los años 70 ella inició un pequeño negocio, un restaurant, pero interrumpió su actividad para atender a sus hijos. Sin embargo hace cuatro años decidió volver a abrir su negocio, remodelando las instalaciones de la anterior. Hasta ahora ésta actividad le ha generado buenos ingresos, por lo que desea continuar creciendo.

Ella necesita de 475 DLLs para comprar mercancía, misma que utiliza como insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos. Sólo basta con que la apoyes, pues sin tu ayuda no podrá desarrollar su negocio. Esperamos tu generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Velia

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of 4 children. She lives with her family in the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León. Her husband is a welder; however, his income is too low to cover all the household expenses. Due to this situation, she decided to begin selling pumpkin seeds to her neighbors from her own home. She later began to sell and make tamales. This activity has allowed her and her family to achieve a better quality of life than before and be able to handle most of their expenses.

For this reason she continues to struggle day to day in order to grow her business. At this time she is in need of a loan of $250 for acquiring merchandise to be used as ingredients in the preparation of the foods she sells. This is your chance to help someone who needs it. Don’t hesitate any longer, the decision is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mary es una mujer casada y madre de 4 hijos, ella vive con su familia en la localidad de Monterrey, Nuevo León. Su esposo es soldador, sin embargo su sueldo es muy bajo para poder cumplir con todos los gastos del hogar. Por esta situación ella decidió comenzar a vender semillas de calabaza a sus vecinos en su propio domicilio. Luego comenzó a vender y elaborar tamales, esta actividad le ha permitido a ella y su familia a lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida que antes y poder hacer frente a la mayoría de los gastos.

Es por ello que ella sigue luchando día a día para poder hacer crecer su negocio. En este momento ella requiere De un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 DLLS, misma que utilizará en la compra de mercancía que ella utiliza como insumos para poder preparar los alimentos que vende. Es tu oportunidad de ayudar a alguien que lo necesita, no lo dudes más, la decisión esta en tus manos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
Two years ago, María Guadalupe, a married mother of 4 children, all of them minors, began selling food at a prime location in her city. However, a friend of hers mentioned the opportunity of selling silver jewelry. As she needed to increase her income, she decided to try this new business idea. After seeing that the revenue was greater than what she made from making and selling food, she decided to dedicate herself completely to the sale of jewelry.

She now needs capital to invest and grow her project, as the family is going through tough times financially at home and she needs to help her husband. For this reason, she is need of a loan of $250. María Guadalupe and her family need you and sincerely appreciate any support you decide to offer.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace dos años, María Guadalupe, quien es casada y madre de 4 hijos, todos aun menores de edad, comenzó a vender comidas en un buen punto de la localidad, sin embargo una amiga le comentó acerca de la oportunidad de vender joyería de plata y dado que necesitaba aumentar sus ingresos decidió probar con esta nueva actividad. A ver que las ganancias eran mayores a las obtenidas con la venta y elaboración de comida decidió dedicarse por completo a la venta de joyería.

Ahora ella necesita capital para invertir y hacer crecer su proyecto, pues en su hogar atraviesan por dificultades económicas y ella necesita ayudar a su esposo. Es por esto que necesita un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 DLLS. María Guadalupe y su familia te necesitan y agradecen sinceramente el apoyo que decidas darles.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Paco was born in the state of Guerrero, where his children and the rest of his family reside. However, 8 years ago he decided to visit the capital of Querétaro in search of better employment opportunities, as he was facing many financial difficulties in his hometown. That is how he came to start his own toy-selling business in Querétaro, after a friend offered to rent him a space in a central location. Thanks to the business, he has been able to cover his costs and help his family. He therefore wants to continue to grow.

At this time he is in need of a loan of $200 to acquire a larger quantity of merchandise, thereby increasing his sales and, consequently, his income. You have the opportunity to support Paco. Become an important part of his achievements. He and his family sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Paco nació en el Estado de Guerrero, lugar en la que radican sus hijos y el resto de su familia, sin embargo el hace 8 años decidió visitar la capital queretana en busca de una mejor oportunidad de empleo, ya que estaba enfrentando muchas dificultades económicas en su lugar de origen. Es así como inicia en Querétaro su propio negocio, la venta de juguetes, pues una de sus amistades le ofreció la renta de un local en un lugar céntrico. Gracias a esta actividad el ha podido solventar sus gastos y ayudar a su familia, es por el quiere continuar creciendo.

En este momento el requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 DLLS para poder surtir una mayor cantidad de mercancía y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Tú tienes la posibilidad de apoyar a Don Paco, vuélvete parte importante de sus logros. El y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Dora María

texts.en:
Dora and her husband live alone in the city of Querétaro; they have no children and are an elderly couple. A few years ago, she began to sell second-hand clothing in local markets, as her husband lost his job and they had no income. The business has brought them the resources they need to survive, covering their most basic necessities.

The struggle has not been easy, and she now needs a loan of $750 to acquire more merchandise and increase her revenue. They need your support, so don't let them struggle alone. They sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Dora y su esposo viven solos en la localidad de Querétaro, pues no tiene hijos y ya son personas de edad avanza. Hace varios años ella comenzó a vender ropa usada en los mercados de la localidad, pues su esposo se quedó sin empleo y no tenían más ingresos. Es así como esta actividad le ha brindado los recursos necesarios para sobrevivir, cubriendo sus necesidades más elementales.

La lucha no ha sido fácil y ahora ella necesita de un crédito de $ 750 DLLS para poder comprar más mercancía e incrementar sus ingresos. Ellos necesitan de tu apoyo, no los dejes solos, ellos te agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bessy Rosana

texts.en:
My name is Bessy L. and I sell used clothing for men and women, as well as used footwear. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientel because I have good quality products at low prices. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase sales. With the additional earnings I will be able to remodel my home and to give a good education to my children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Bessy L. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada para dama y caballero y zapatos usados, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto es de buena calidad a un bajo precio, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y darles un buen estudio a mis hijos.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing and used shoes.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.en:
My name is Luis M. and I sell food such as burritos, breakfasts, baleadas(Honduran taco), and lunches. I have had my business for 5 years and I have my son's help attending to the store. I have an excellent clientel because we are located in a heavily traveled area, near to a bus station. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to increase sales. With the additional earnings I will be able to buy new seats and chairs to make my store bigger, as well as support my family and to give my son a private University education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Luis M. me dedico a la venta de comida tipo burritas, desasyunos, baleadas, almuerzos, tengo mi negocio hace 5 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la atencion de mi negocio, mis clientes son excelentes ya que estamos ubicados en una zona muy transitada ya que queda cerca una estacion de buses, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar sillas y mesas nuevas para hacer mas grande mi negocio, mantener mi familia y darle un estudio en universidad privada a mi hijo.

loans.use: To purchase oil, butter, salt, tortillas, chicken, pork, sausages,plates, cups, napkins, beans, onion, coal, tomatoes, chiles,drinks, juices, ice,water,spices.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Kelvin De Jesus

texts.en:
My name is Kelvin M. and I sell food like hotdogs and drinks. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientel as I am located near to various private and governmental offices. My business generates enough income to support my family. My goal is to increase sales and with the additional earnings I will be able to by another hotdog cart and to give my brother a job as well as feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Kelvin M. me dedico a la venta de comida hotdogs y refrescos tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicado cerca de varias oficinas privadas y gubernamentales, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que tenga poder comprar otro carrito de hotdogs y darle trabajo a mi hermano asi mismo alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase bread, hotdogs, onion, tomatoes, salsa, mayonaisse, mustard, drinks, and napkins.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
My name is Carmen D. and I sell french fries with sauce and grated cheese. I have had my business for 3 years and I have a good clientel as I sell my product inside a public institute. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to have better production. With the additional earnings I will be able to buy another frier for the potatoes as well as give a good education to my daughter, who is ready to enroll in school.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Carmen D. me dedico a la venta de papitas fritas con salsa y queso rayado, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que yo vendo mi producto dentro de una institucion publica, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprarme otro carrito de freir papas asi mismo darle un buen estudio a mi hija que esta por ingresar a la escuela.

loans.use: To purchase oil, butter, salt, potatoes, plates, napkins, grated cheese, tomatoe sauce, drinks and gas.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Noe Arturo

texts.en:
My name is Noe M. and I sell daily consumer products. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientel because I sell high quality goods at low prices. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to have higher sales. With the additional earnings I will be able to remodel my business(doubles as home) and to support my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Noe M. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que ofrezco buena calidad en mis productos y un muy buen precio, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con la ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio (casa de habitacion) y mantener a mi familia.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is divorced with three kids. Her husband was an alcoholic and left the family 7 years ago. As the one left with the responsibility of raising her children, Olga was forced to find ways to provide for her family. The owner of the grocery store where she worked was moving to a different city and decided to sell the store. Olga took a risk and used her savings to purchase the store which is located on one of the main highways in town. Lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped promote the growth of Olga’s business. She was able to remodel the interior of the store and hire three people to help her run it. Olga received her first loan in 2005 and since then has never had a single late payment – even when it’s been freezing cold and her sales were down. The loans have enabled Olga to increase her business income allowing her to buy a comfortable, private home for her family. Olga is requesting a loan of $1,200 to expand the selection of groceries in her store. She is planning to introduce new items and purchase assorted cereals, fruits, dairy products, bread and beverages that always sell well with travelers in Ukraine. As a very intelligent, hard-working entrepreneur, Olga is a woman people look up to in her community. Her good reputation and customer-friendly service have a very positive impact on her business. Increased funding will help ensure her ongoing success and continue to improve the quality of life for her family.

Ольга – розлучена, в неї троє дітей. Її чоловік алкоголік покинув родину ще 7 років тому. Ольга залишилася сам на сам з усіма проблемами, вона була відповідальна за виховання дітей, отже змушена була шукати шляхів для забезпечення родини. Власник крамниці, де працювала Ольга, переїжджав до іншого міста й вирішив продати крамницю. Вона вирішила ризикнути та, використавши власні заощадженні, викупила крамницю, яка знаходиться на одній з головних автострад міста. Кредитні послуги „Надії України” сприяли росту бізнесу Ольги. Вона змогла відремонтувати магазин та взяти на роботу трьох реалізаторів. Першу позику Ольга отримала в 2005 році. За весь час роботи з „Надією України” в неї не було жодного прострочення – навіть коли на дворі було дуже холодно та обсяги продажів впали. Позики надали Ользі можливість збільшити доходи та придбати зручний будинок, де зараз живе її родина. Ольга просить про позику в 1 200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити вибір продовольчих товарів в своїй крамниці. Вона планує поповнити асортимент новими продуктами та закупити різні крупи, фрукти, молочні вироби, хліб та напої, які завжди користуються попитом серед подорожуючих в Україні. Ольга – дуже розумний та працьовитий підприємець. Її шанують як покупці, так і колеги по роботі. Гарна репутація та ввічливе обслуговування позитивно вливають на її бізнес. Фінансова підтримка сприятиме подальшій успішній роботі та росту бізнесу, а також якісно покращить рівень життя її родини.

loans.use: To increase the variety of products in her store

My name is Ada V., and I sell new women's and men's clothing like shirts, blouses, shirts, pants, and jeans. My business is 3 years old. I sell my products in private and public businesses. My goal is to have more products in order to sell more. With the earnings I want to be able to provide food for my family and remodel my house.

Mi nombre es Maria O. me dedico a la venta de productos para la cocina como ser ollas de todo tamaño, freidoras, comales, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto lo vendo en empresas privadas y publicas, mi meta es poder tener mas producto para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y remodelar mi casa de habitacion.

Hello. My name is Arcenia, and I am a storekeeper. I do business from home selling clothes and shoes. I have been doing this for many years. My work as a traveling salesperson helps me earn money in order to fulfill my obligations and cover household expenses, considering I am a single mother with one son.
