Madame D. sollicite un apport financier de $750 qui lui permettra d’augmenter son stock afin de répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle. De ce commerce sortira un bénéfice qui améliorera les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Storage and sale of palm kernels

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.en:
Divorced from her husband two years ago, Mrs Thérèse M. is a dedicated and courageous woman. Her four (4) children are her responsibility. Each day, she fights to be able to provide for them. Her business is the preparation and sale of local meals. Having a sense for good work, she keeps her restaurant clean. That has made her worthy of a large and very faithful clientele. Because of this, the demand is very high and Mrs M. wants to use some financial aid to satisfy her clients more efficiently. The loan of $750 will allow her to stock supplies such as corn, oil and fish etc. These ingredients are indispensable in the preparation of her meals. The earnings from this activity will allow her to better care for her children.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Divorcée avec son mari il y a 2 ans, Madame M. Thérèse est une femme dévouée et courageuse. Ses quatre (4) enfants sont restés à sa charge. Chaque jour, elle ne cesse de se battre pour pouvoir subvenir à leurs besoins. Son activité est la préparation et la vente des repas locaux. Ayant le sens du travail bien fait, elle tient son restaurant toujours très propre. Ce qui lui vaut une clientèle importante et très fidèle. De ce fait, la demande est très élevée et Madame M. veut bénéficier d’un appui financier pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire efficacement ses clients. Le crédit de $750 qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre de stocker les denrées (maïs, huile, poissons etc.) indispensable à la préparation de ses mets. Les bénéfices de cette activité l’aideront à mieux prendre en charge ses enfants.

loans.use: to stock the supplies needed for the preparation of local meals

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is a very enterprising person, which is why she started her grocery business one year ago. She now wants to increase her product line in order to offer greater variety to her clients, and in that way add to her sales. She is requesting a loan of $1200, to be repaid in 12 months.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Socorro, es una persona muy emprendedora por lo cual ella inicio su negocio de abarrotes hace un año, pero quiere incrementar su línea de productos para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y con esto aumentar su venta por lo cual solicita un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dllrs Para pagar en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda has a grocery store. She wishes to add to her stock of merchandise in order to give better service and in that way increase her sales. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to carry out her plan. She will be able to repay this credit in 12 months.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Yolanda tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la cual quiere agregar mas mercancía para Poder dar un mejor servicio y de esta manera incrementar la venta en su tienda. A ella le gustaría solicitar un préstamo por $800.00dllrs para llevar a cabo su proyecto y Poder pagar este crédito en 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.en:
Maria Elba is a woman who always comes out ahead, thanks to her effort and the dedication she has demonstrated ever since she became a widow. She started a small grocery store, which has functioned very well, but she wants to offer more brands and more variety of products in order to expand her business even further. For this reason she requests a loan of $1200, which she plans to repay in 12 months.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Maria Elba es una mujer que siempre sale adelante, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación que ha demostrado desde que quedo viuda, ella instalo una pequeña tienda de abarrotes la cual a funcionado muy bien pero quiere ofrecer otras marcas y variedad de productos para poder crecer mas aun el negocio, por lo cual esta solicitando un crédito de $1200.00dllrs el cual piensa pagar en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HER CHICKEN FARMING BUSINESS

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita started her business selling seasonings, spices, and groceries one year ago, and the business has gone well. She needs a greater supply of products, for which she is requesting a loan of $800, which she will repay in 12 months.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Español Rita inicio su negocio de venta de sazonadores, especies para comida y abarrotes hace un año, el negocio a marchado bien, pero necesita mayor presencia de producto por lo cual solicita un préstamo de $800.00 el cual pagaría en 12 meses

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PURCHASE A DAIRY COW

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HER FARMING BUSINESS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO STOCK HER CLOTHING SHOP

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro has had a grocery store for 2 years. He is very happy with his business, and he works hard every day to give the best service to his customers, and to keep his store well-supplied so they will always find the product they want. In 2007, he is thinking of increasing the variety of products so that he can keep growing. For this reason he is requesting a loan of $1200.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Alejandro tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 2 años, el esta muy contento con su negocio y se esfuerza todos los días por dar el mejor servicio a sus clientes y por tener bien abastecida su tienda para que ellos siempre encuentren el producto que quieren, pero este 2007 tiene contemplado agregar mas variedad de productos y seguir creciendo, por lo cual solicita un crédito de $1200.00

loans.use: To buy products and merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PURCHASE MACHINES FOR HIS CYBERCAFE

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario has 20 years experience in business, which she started at the age of 23 when she traveled with her Mother to Peru to buy merchandise.  He Mother helped her with $100 of capital which she lent her to start her own business.  After that, she got married and left the business for a time, but then realized that she would need to have her own money and that is how she came to get a loan and reactivate her business 5 years later. At this time she decided to sell cosmetics due to a friend's suggestions.  She has maintained that work until the present time, working from 9am until 7pm.  Rosario wants the loan to invest in her business and get more income.  The company she is dealing with gives rewards to its consultants based on how much they sell each month. Rosario is 43 years of age, and has three children, the oldest works and pays for school, and the other two, by means of her business plan to finsh school and then work.  She is separated from her husband for the past 8 months, and her main desire now is to be able to buy a car to get around since her work requires her to walk promoting her products, and with a car she could do that and save time.

>p< >b< Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer.>/b<>p<

loans.use: Rosa will invest in cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella has 20 years of business experience. She started by selling roses on Mother's Day and thanks to that work she was able to buy herself a car, but she had to sell it because the child who was helping her became ill. With some of the money from the sale of the car she started a business of reparing automobile batteries which she had to close because the battery acid was harmful to her health. Since then she has been going to small towns to sell cheese. During these trips people have asked her for merchandise. These two enterprises have helped her maintain her home. She sells comsmetics each week day, and the cheese business she does on the week ends when there are fiestas in the small towns. Bella wants a loan to invest in her business for which she has orders, and also to grow her cheese operation so as to generate more income. Bella has been separated from her husband for 20 years, and has 8 children. Only one is at home because he had an accident which resulted in a head injury, which left him with diminished senses, and she took on his care, relying on the help of another son who helps her sell her merchandise. >p<>b< Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer.>/b<>p<

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell in rural towns and ingredients to make cheese

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miquel has 7 years experience in selling seafood, which he learned from his Father, who took him to work with him from the time he was quite little. That was when he began to like this trade. Later, with his Mother, he decided to work on his own account since he was now married and needed to be able to cover the costs of his home. He works from 4am to 11am every day, along with his wife and a relative who helps them remove the meat from crabs so that later it can be put into tubs and sold. Miguel wants a loan to be able to invest in the business and get more income. He wants to provide work for his brother so that, with capital from him they can, little by little have their own business, that is his present goal. Miguel is married, 23 years old, and has a daughter six months old. He hopes with his work to have his own home, since he now lives with his parents. >p< >b> Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Hire his brothers to help him in the seafood business.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.en:
Piedad has 10 years experience in selling seafood. Before she worked at home, and later she decided to have her own business since selling seafood took a lot of time and she needed to be closer to her children and have them grow up next to her. She works from 7am until 1pm when she returns home to work there. Piedad wants a loan to invest in her business and to be able to sell seafood from her home since at present she has to leave to deliver the products on foot since she has orders from people in the area where she lives. Piedad is married and has 4 children of which 3 are in school thanks to the fact that together with her husband they can afford to send them. Her husband works as a mason away from the city, and comes home on week ends when they reunite and look to the future of their children. What they want is to be able to fix up their house which is made of reeds, and they would like to make it of cement. With both of them working, they know they can achieve that.

Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Start selling seafood from her home

loans.name: Test

texts.en: test

loans.use: testing

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. Rashad is 24 years old. He is the only sole support for his family. Rashad understands how important customers are and prides himself in providing the best customer service possible. He decided to apply for a loan of $300 in order to increase his retail trade. 
He currently has applied for a loan of $800 to open his own perfumery and to increase his inventory of goods.

loans.use: To open his own perfumery and to increase his inventory of goods

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif has been engaged in the printing business for three years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, and relocated to Sumgait city. This 44-year-old gentleman is a hard worker. He is married with three children. At previously has borrowed a loan of $200 from Normicro in order to purchase grocery goods. 
Now Sharif wants a second loan of $400 to rent a shop and increase his inventory of goods.

loans.use: To rent a shop and increase his inventory of goods

loans.name: Khalig

texts.en:
Khalig is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He works as the machinist. He has been rented a small garage where he repairs cars. He is hard working person. He married and has 2 children. He began his business 9 years ago and it allows him to support to his family. He is 26. In 2004 he borrowed $300 from Normicro spent this loan amount to buy some spaddles, putties and dyes. 
For the second time he borrowed the loan of amount $500 and has bought the drying apparatus.
Khalig applies for a loan amount of $700 to buy finish-polishing bench and some dyes.

loans.use: To buy finish-polishing bench and some dyes

loans.name: Azizaga

texts.en:
He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. Azizaga, with his family, settled in Sumgait city. He is 45 years old and married with four children. He began his business by selling fruit and vegetables out of his own car. He borrowed a loan of $300 to repair his car and to buy fruits and vegetables. The second loan of $500 he spent to build a small shop and expanded his inventory of fruits. 
Now Azizaga needs a loan amount $1000 to expand his shop. He plans to expand his inventory to provide other foods for sale.

loans.use: To expand his business area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HIS SECOND HAND CLOTHING BUSINESS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: RELOCATE TO BIGGER PREMISES AND ADD STOCK

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: CONSTRUCT FAMILY HOUSE

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
DANIEL K. is a 34 yr old married truck driver with five children. His children are all in school in junior grades. They live in a small house in the suburbs of Nakuru city. Daniel is semi literate. He dropped out of school before going to high school due to lack of school fees. He was employed as a driver until two years ago when he bought a lorry with his own savings and started a transport services business. His wife does not work and he has to work hard to provide for his family maintenance and pay school fees. Daniel would like to a start a green grocer wholesale shop as a family business. His lorry will be transporting vegetables from the farms to his shop. This will help him maximize profit to increase his income. This is to pay for their children’s education especially when the two eldest join senior school next year.

Daniel requests for a US $ 1200 loan and plans to use it as follows:

US $ 1000 stocks the business

US $ 100 pay for a license

US $ 100 for decoration i.e. shelves etc

He is focused and will repay the loan.

loans.use: START A GREEN GROCERY SHOP

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HIS FARMING BUSINESS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: START TOMATO FARMING

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.en:
Mrs Ayélé F. is a young mother of three (3) children. She is married to a bicycle mechanic. Early on, Mrs F. understood that the revenue of her husband wouldn't cover the expenses of the household. In order to do this, she started a business and opened a small restaurant. The quality of her service and the cleanliness of her restaurant mean a parade of many clients throughout the day. Mrs F. has demonstrated honesty and has proven herself a trustworthy woman, paying back her first two loans without incident. Today, she is hoping to newly impress her clientele by introducing new meals into her menu. To do this, she needs more consistant financial support. The loan of $700 that she is asking for will be used to fix up her restaurant. It will also be used as permanent business capital to acquire the raw materials for the preparation of her meals. This will definitely increase the revenue of Mrs Ayélé F. to the benefit of her family.

Translated from Fench by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame F. Ayélé est une jeune femme mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a pour mari un mécanicien à 2 deux roues. Très tôt, Madame F. a compris que les revenus de son mari ne lui permettent pas de couvrir les charges du foyer. Pour cela, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce en ouvrant un petit restaurant. La qualité de son service et la propreté qui prévaut dans le restaurant font défiler à longueur de journée de nombreux clients. Madame F. a fait preuve d’honnêteté et de femme de confiance à travers les remboursements sans incidents de ses deux premiers crédits obtenus. Aujourd’hui, elle cherche à séduire davantage sa clientèle par l’introduction de nouveaux repas dans ses menus. A cet effet, elle a besoin d’un appui financier plus consistant. Le crédit de $700 qu’elle sollicite va servir à aménager son restaurant et à disposer d’un fonds de commerce permanent pour l’acquisition des matières premières nécessaires à la préparation des repas. Cela renforcera à coup sûr le revenu de Madame F. Ayélé pour le bonheur de sa famille.

loans.use: fix up a restaurant and acquire raw materials

loans.name: Ayifo

texts.en:
Mrs Ayifo A. is married and mother of four (4) children. Her husband, a driver of a motorcycle taxi, doesn't have a salary that insures the expenses of the family will be covered, despite their daily efforts. It is because of this that Mrs A. has invested in the sale of food as her primary activity. Very dynamic and daring, she began her business with her own finances and she dedicated herself to it completely. This activity has grown in scope, because of the quality of the dishes she offers to her clientele. Today, because of the importance her business, Mrs. A. needs a loan of $800 to enlarge her business and respond to the needs of clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ayifo est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son mari, conducteur de taxi moto, ne possède pas un revenu qui assure les dépenses familiales malgré tous ses efforts quotidiens. C’est pour cela que Madame A. s’est investie dans la vente des denrées alimentaires comme activité principale. Très dynamique et audacieuse, elle a commencé ses activités commerciales avec ses propres moyens financiers et s’est consacrée entièrement à son commerce. Cette activité a pris une ampleur importante compte tenu de la qualité des plats qu’elle offre à ses clients. Aujourd’hui, compte tenu de l’importance que prennent ses activités commerciales, Madame A. a besoin d’un appui financier d’un $800 pour agrandir son commerce et répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.

loans.use: sale of food supplies

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana started a small business out of sheer necessity – she had to have the means to live. She is divorced with three grown children and has only a high school education. Today she runs a little kiosk selling hair clips, brushes, plastic bags, toys and other small necessities. Svitlana is very sociable and lively. Her hard work, dedication, and experience working in the market trade have helped her maintain and expand her business. The ability to find a wide variety of practical items to sell has helped Svitlana fill a market niche and be successful. Svitlana is requesting a loan to invest in inventory. She wants to purchase a range of toys, plastic bags, and other practical small items that always sell so well. This loan together with constant hard work and a willingness to serve clients’ needs will promote the growth of Svitlana’s business and increase her income.

Світлана почала свій власний бізнес тому, що їй катастрофічно не вистачало грошей на життя. Вона розлучилася з чоловіком та мала виховувати трьох дітей. В Світлани середня освіта. Вона – власниця маленького кіоску, торгує шпильками, гребінцями, пакетами, іграшками та іншими необхідними дрібничками. Світлана – дуже комунікабельна та жвава. Її наполеглива праця, відданість власній справі, та багатий досвід торгівлі на ринку допомогли їй не тільки зберегти свій бізнес, але й забезпечити його стабільне зростання. Широкий вибір різноманітних практичних дрібничок допомогли Світлані знайти свою нішу на ринку та досягти успіху в торгівлі. Світлана просить про позику для того, щоб вкласти гроші в товар. Вона хоче придбати різноманітні іграшки, пакети та інші дрібнички, на які завжди є попит. Позика, у поєднанні з наполегливою працею та бажанням якомога краще обслуговувати клієнтів, сприятиме зростанню бізнесу Світлани та збільшить її прибутки.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: START DAIRY FARMING

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: IMPROVE HIS FARMING BUSINESS

loans.name: Sogbadji

texts.en:
Widowed for more than 5 years, Mrs Sogbadji A. is the mother of four (4) children who are completely her responsibility. She sells generic health products. Because of her courage and dedication, she is succeeding in improving the family's lot. Aware that exposure to sun constitutes a danger to the health of her clients, she is thinking of renting a location she could use as a shop. To do this Mrs A. needs capital of $700 that will allow her to rent a location for her shop and increase the size of her business. The success of this activity will allow her family to blossom.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Veuve depuis plus de 5 ans, Madame A. Sogbadji est mère de quatre (4) enfants qui sont entièrement à sa charge. Elle a comme activité, la vente des produits génériques dans sa localité. Grâce à son courage et son dévouement, elle arrive à s’en sortir. Consciente que les produits exposés au soleil constituent un danger pour la santé des clients, elle pense louer un local qui va lui servir de boutique. Pour ce faire, Madame A. a besoin d’un capital de $700 qui va servir à louer un local pour sa boutique et agrandir la taille de son activité. Le succès de cette activité permettra l’épanouissement de sa famille.

loans.use: Rent of location and sale of products

loans.name: Aholoussi

texts.en:
Mrs Aholoussi K. is currently responsible for eight (8) people. Married to a sculptor, she went into business early on in the sale of corn to help her husband meet the needs of the household. When corn is abundant, she stores it in order to resell it later on. Despite her low level of education, she manages her affairs well and managed to pay back her first loan without difficulty. This season, she hopes to increase her storage capacity and is looking for a loan of $800 in order to do this. She possesses a lot of experience in the field and could bring this project to fruition for the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Aholoussi a à sa charge aujourd’hui un total de huit (8) personnes. Mariée à un sculpteur, elle s’est lancée très tôt dans la vente du maïs pour accompagner son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins du ménage. En période d’abondance de maïs, elle fait le stockage pour le revendre en période de soudure. Malgré son niveau d’instruction très bas, elle a une bonne gestion de ses affaires et a su rembourser son premier crédit sans difficulté. A cette saison, elle a l’ambition d’augmenter sa capacité de stockage et sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $800. Elle dispose d’une grande expérience dans le domaine et pourra mener à bien cette activité pour le bien-être de sa famille

loans.use: Storage and sale of corn

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.en:
Mrs Ayélé L. is married and mother of four (4) children. Her husband is an artisanal blacksmith, but doesn't have enough clients and therefore doesn't have the means to support all the needs of the family. The quasi-totality of the responsibility for the family comes back onto Mrs L.. This is a source of great sadness. However, thanks to her corn business she manages to support the essential needs of the household. However, her capital is insufficient to expand her business and increase her revenues. Very serious about her business, she has a good character and merits a loan. She is asking for a loan of $800 so she can have a consistent supply of corn to resell when there is a shortage. The realisation of this project will increase her revenues and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from FRENCH by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame L. Ayélé est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son mari, fait la forge artisanale mais n’a pas assez de clients et donc ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. La quasi-totalité des charges de la famille reviennent à Madame L.. Ce qui lui donne beaucoup de peine. Mais, grâce à son commerce de maïs, elle se débrouille pour subvenir aux besoins essentiels de son foyer. Or, son capital est insuffisant pour accroître son commerce et augmenter ses revenus. Très sérieuse dans ses affaires, elle jouit d’une bonne moralité et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui servira à faire un stock consistant de maïs et de le revendre en temps de pénurie. La réalisation de ce projet augmentera ses revenus pour l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: storage and sale of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice would like to start a small fruit business.

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.en:
Married and mother to three (3) children, Mrs Joséphine E. works selling food stuff in her town. Her husband's main work is farming. With an average revenue Mrs Joséphine EDJEAME contributes enormously to her family. A courageous and determined woman she has managed two loans without difficulty despite her elementary level education. Her dynamism and her experience in the field are exemplary. She is asking for a new loan of $600 to enlarge her display and increase her revenue. This loan will be very beneficial because it will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family as well as increase her savings for future needs.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame E. Joséphine a pour activité principale la vente de denrées alimentaires dans sa localité. L’activité principale de son mari est l’agriculture. Avec un revenu moyen, Madame EDJEAME Joséphine contribue énormément aux charges de sa famille. Femme courageuse mais aussi déterminée, elle a eu à gérer deux crédits sans difficultés malgré son niveau d’instruction primaire. Son dynamisme et son expérience dans son activité sont exemplaires. Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit d’un montant de $600 afin d’agrandir son étalage et rehausser son revenu. Ce crédit lui sera très bénéfique car il permettra d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille ainsi que la fréquence dans ses épargnes pour ses besoins futurs.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients neccessary in the preparation of food.

loans.name: Aimée

texts.en:
Married and mother of three (3) children, Mrs Aimée AGOUSSOU has a business buying and selling "sodabi", a local drink made with palm oil. Her husband is a subsistance farmer because of his rudimentary tools. Mrs AGOUSSOU is a woman who fights for the well-being of her children. To have a large clientele she looks for quality in her products. In view of her experience and her dynamism, she has already benefited from two loans which she paid back with no difficulty. Wanting to reinforce her business, she is asking for a new loan of $700 that she will use as business capital for the purchase and sale of Sodabi. This loan will be benefical because it will increase her level of revenue and allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame A. Aimée a pour activité principale l’achat et la revente de « sodabi », boisson locale fabriquée à base du palmier à huile. Son mari est un cultivateur qui pratique une agriculture de subsistance à cause du caractère rudimentaire des outils. Madame A. Aimée est une femme qui se bât beaucoup pour la réussite de ses enfants. Pour avoir une clientèle importante, elle recherche la qualité de ses produits. Vu son expérience et son dynamisme, elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qu’elle a remboursé sans aucune difficulté. Voulant renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $700 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente de Sodabi. Ce crédit lui sera bénéfique puisqu’il a rehaussé son niveau de revenu et permettre ainsi d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: buy and sell sodabi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys would like to buy shares from the stock exchange market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to venture into the shares business.

loans.name: Koffi Sylvain

texts.en:
Married with four children, Mr. Koffi Sylvain A. is a gentle and honest man. His wife’s income from selling vegetables doesn't go very far towards the household expenses. For Mr. A., cultivating oil palm trees is a very profitable occupation. He sells the palm fruits to women who make the palm oil. He currently owns a small palm grove, and he is requesting a loan of $700 to extend the grove, thus turning it into a real plantation that would satisfy the demands of his clientele. Mr. A. received an initial loan, which he has already paid off, and he has high hopes for this new loan that will enable him to take care of his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants, Monsieur A. Koffi Sylvain est un homme doux et honnête. Les revenus de la vente des légumes de sa femme n’arrivent pas à contribuer efficacement aux charges du foyer. Pour Monsieur A., la culture du palmier à huile est une activité très rentable. Il vend les noix aux femmes qui font de l’huile de palme. Il possède aujourd’hui une petite palmeraie et sollicite ce crédit de $700 pour l’agrandir puis en faire une véritable plantation pour satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle. Il a bénéficié d’un premier crédit qu’il a d’ailleurs déjà soldé. Monsieur A. attend beaucoup de ce nouveau crédit qui lui permettra de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To extend his palm grove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah would like to buy a high breed dairy cow.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.en:
Mrs. Afiwa A. is a fifty year old widow. Her deceased husband’s inheritance is not sufficient to provide for the needs of her six children. In addition to her own children, she is also responsible for two young female apprentices. In order to take care of their needs, Mrs. A. has a pot manufacturing business that she inherited from her mother. Every Tuesday; market day in her village; she displays her products, which are held in high esteem.

Mrs. A. is currently requesting a loan of $800 to increase her production capacity. The loan will allow her to acquire the raw materials necessary to manufacture the pots. The income generated from her business will provide for the dietary, schooling and health needs of he children.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Afiwa est une veuve d’une cinquantaine d’année. L’héritage laissé par son mari défunt ne lui permet pas de subvenir aux besoins de ses six (06) enfants. En dehors de ses enfants, elle a à sa charge deux (02) jeunes filles en apprentissage. Pour arriver à s’occuper d’eux, Madame A. Afiwa exerce comme activité la fabrication des pots qu’elle a hérité de sa maman. Chaque mardi, jour du marché de sa localité, elle expose ses produits qui sont d’ailleurs très appréciés.

Elle sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $800 pour renforcer sa capacité de production. Le crédit servira à acquérir les matières premières nécessaires à la fabrication des pots. Les revenus qu’elle tirera de ce métier, serviront à subvenir aux besoins alimentaires, scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.

loans.use: To acquire the raw materials necessary to manufacture pots

loans.name: Délali

texts.en:
Mrs. Délali Y. is a gentle and friendly woman. Married to a carpenter, she is the mother of four children. The income from her husband’s job varies according to his clients’ demands, and it usually falls well short of the household needs. In order to contribute towards the family expenses, Mrs. Y. has ventured into making a baby’s porridge in her neighborhood, using her modest savings from selling iced water. She hopes to take advantage of financial support to stock up on more corn in order to safeguard against a shortage of raw materials. To do this, she needs a loan of $700, which will provide the funds for stocking up on corn and preparing the porridge. The sale of the porridge will allow her to meet her household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Y. Délali est une douce femme très accueillante. Mariée à un menuisier, elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Les revenus du travail de son mari varient en fonction de la demande de ses clients, et sont la plupart du temps largement en dessous des besoins du foyer. Pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, Madame Y. Délali s’est lancée dans la préparation de la bouillie dans son quartier à partir d’une petite économie tirée de la vente de l’eau glacée. Elle compte bénéficier d’un appui financier pour stocker plus de maïs afin d’être à l’abri de toute pénurie en matières premières. Pour ce faire, elle a besoin d’un crédit d’un montant de $700 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour le stockage du maïs et la préparation de bouillie. La vente de cette bouillie lui permettra de couvrir les charges du ménage.

loans.use: To stock up on corn in order to prepare and sell baby porridge

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is married with three children. She lives on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam in a place called Lumo. After finishing her primary education she was married to a commuter bus driver. Her parents could not afford to pay for further education. After being married Habiba could not stand being a housewife. She started a clothing shop with the aim of generating income for the family, as her husband’s income was not sufficient to cover all her family requirements. It is now the fifth year since she started this business. She has experienced minimal improvements during that period due to competition she faces from nearby shops also selling clothes. Habiba has discovered unique competencies, which can allow her to outperform her competitors. She wishes to have enough stock of frequently purchased clothes and be able to order new fashionable clothes which competitors can not order. These strategies need additional funding. Habiba is in need of USD 750 to implement her plans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elisabeth A. is a fifty year old widow. Left with five children by her deceased husband in 1984, she has once again taken up the business she inherited from her mother, preparing and selling ‘ablo’ corn bread. Despite her minimal education, she is gifted with an aptitude that has earned her a good reputation in her business. By selling ‘ablo’, a corn-based dish that’s very common in her village, Mrs. A. manages to provide for the needs of her fatherless children. She is now requesting a loan of $700, which will provide her with the funds needed to prepare and sell ‘ablo’. This will boost her resources and help her to cover her many family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Elisabeth est une veuve qui est âgée d’une cinquantaine d’années. Laissée par son mari défunt avec cinq (05) enfants en 1984, elle a retrouvé son activité de préparation et de vente du pain de maïs « ablo » héritée de sa mère. Malgré son niveau d’instruction très bas, elle est dotée d’une aptitude qui lui confère une bonne réputation dans son activité. A partir de la vente d’« ablo » un met fabriqué à base de maïs très consommé dans sa localité, Madame A. réussit à subvenir aux besoins de ses orphelins. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour la préparation et la vente de ablo. Ceci pourra la relancer dans son économie et l’aidera à couvrir les nombreuses charges de sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire the raw materials for the preparation and sale of 'ablo' corn bread.

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. She settled with her children in Sumgait city. Zamina has been working as a stylist for the past 20 years. She is a widow with three children. She used to work at a beauty salon, but decided she wanted to start her own business. The room she now works in is clean and professional, though bare. 
Zamina needs a loan of $600 to buy equipment, instruments, additional tables as well as lighting for her salon.

loans.use: To buy equipment and instruments, additional tables and lighting for her salon

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
Married with four children, Mrs. Kayi A. is also responsible for a sister and a bother who she has made apprentices. Educated to secondary level, she is very experienced in the stocking of corn. Mrs. A. started in the corn business at an early age in order to make an effective contribution to household expenses. She received an initial loan of $150 which she was soon able to pay off without any problem. Mrs. A. is requesting a second loan of $850 which will allow her to purchase a substantial stock of corn, which she will resell during a period of shortage. The income from these sales will be put towards family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère d’une famille de quatre (04) enfants, Madame A. Kayi a à sa charge une sœur et un frère qu’elle a mis en apprentissage. Instruite de niveau secondaire, elle possède une grande expérience en matière de stockage de maïs. Très tôt, Madame A. s’est lancée dans le commerce de maïs pour contribuer efficacement aux charges du ménage. Elle a reçu un premier crédit de $150 qu’elle a pu solder très tôt sans incident. Madame A. Kayi sollicite un second crédit de $850qui lui permettra de faire un stock consistant de maïs qu’elle revendra en période de pénurie. Les revenus de la vente seront destinés aux dépenses familiales.

loans.use: To buy, store and resell corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE MILK PROCESSING EQUIPMENT

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Mr. Komlan A. is a young man aged 35. He is married to a young saleswoman and they have two daughters. His wife’s income is insufficient to contribute towards the family expenses. This responsibility falls to Mr. A., who is very dedicated to his job as a carpenter, and struggles daily to find the means with which to fulfill his family duties. Mr. A. is requesting a loan of $800 to fit out his workshop, to stock up with different kinds of wood to sell to other carpenters in his village, and to make furniture which he exhibits to his clientele. The income from this venture will allow him to satisfy his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Komlan est un jeune homme de 35 ans. Il est marié à une jeune dame revendeuse avec qui il a deux (2) filles. Les revenus de sa femme ne lui permettent pas de contribuer aux charges familiales. Tout se repose sur Monsieur A. qui s’adonne très bien à son métier de menuiserie et se bat quotidiennement pour trouver de quoi assumer les charges de la famille. Monsieur A. demande un appui financier de $800 pour aménager son atelier, s’approvisionner en bois de toutes nature pour vendre à d’autres menuisiers dans sa localité et confectionner les meubles qu’il expose à sa clientèle. Les revenus lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins familiaux.

loans.use: To fit out a workshop and stock up on wood for carpentry

loans.name: Martine

texts.en:
Married to a farmer for ten years, Mrs. Martine T. does not have a very encouraging family life. At an early age she became involved in the business of selling doughnuts on the streets of her village. As a mother of three children, she receives practically no contribution from her husband towards the household expenses. Gifted and courageous, she holds out great hope of receiving a loan of $600, which will be used as business funds to stock up on wheat flour, oil and so on, for the preparation and sale of doughnuts. This will allow Mrs. T. to increase production, and have several sales outlets in the businesses and markets of her village so that she can increase her turnover and her income.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée depuis une dizaine d’années à un cultivateur, Madame T. Martine n’a pas une situation familiale favorable à un épanouissement. Très tôt, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de la vente des beignets à travers les artères de sa localité. Mère de trois (3) enfants, elle ne bénéficie pratiquement pas de contribution de son mari aux charges du ménage. Très douée et courageuse, elle espère vivement avoir un apport financier de $600 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour faire un stock de la farine de blé, d’huile, etc. en vue de la préparation et la vente des beignets. Ceci lui d’augmenter sa production et avoir plusieurs points de vente dans les établissements et marchés de sa localité afin d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu.

loans.use: To stock up with wheat flour for the preparation and sale of doughnuts

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Mr. Nestor E. is a young motorbike mechanic. Immediately after finishing his apprenticeship, he opened his workshop using an initial loan. Married to a saleswoman, he now has two children of his own, and is also responsible for his two young brothers who serve as his apprentices. Determined and self-confident, he has been able to attract a large clientele. His work tools are no longer adequate for his needs. He is therefore requesting a loan of $700 to fit out his workshop and buy modern tools, so that he can keep his clients satisfied. This will improve his turnover and allow him to meet his family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur E. Nestor est un jeune mécanicien à deux roues. A peine sortie d’apprentissage, il a ouvert son atelier avec un premier crédit qu’il avait obtenu. Marié à une revendeuse, il a aujourd’hui deux (2) enfants et a à sa charge ses deux (2) petits frères en apprentissage. Déterminé et très sur de lui-même, il a su attirer une importante clientèle. Aujourd’hui, ses outils de travail ne sont pas à la hauteur de ses besoins. C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite ce crédit de $700 pour l’aménagement de son atelier et à l’achat des outils modernes afin de satisfaire ses clients. Ceci pourra améliorer son chiffre d’affaire en vue de subvenir aux dépenses de sa famille.

loans.use: To fit out his workshop and buy modern tools

loans.name: Sowanou

texts.en:
Mr. Sowanou H. is a father of eight children. Widowed ten years ago, his main business is farming. Despite the rudimentary nature of his tools, Mr. H. never misses a growing season. The income from his business goes towards family needs. In 2004 he received an initial loan of $500 which he paid off with faultless regularity. He now wants to modernize his tools and buy fertilizer for his crops. The granting of this $750 loan will allow Mr. H. to improve his crops and increase his yield, so that he can improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Sowanou est un père de famille de huit (8) enfants. Veuf depuis 10 ans, son activité principale demeure l’agriculture. Malgré le caractère rudimentaire de ses outils, Monsieur H. ne manque aucune saison de culture. Les revenus issus de son activité sont destinés aux besoins de sa famille. Il fit en 2004 un premier prêt de $500 qu’il a soldé avec une régularité parfaite. Aujourd’hui, il souhaite moderniser ses outils et acheter de l’engrais pour ses cultures. L’octroi de ce crédit de $750 lui permettra d’améliorer ses cultures et augmenter son rendement afin d’offrir à sa famille une condition de vie meilleure.

loans.use: To buy tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en:
Mrs. Sylvie K. is a very devoted and determined woman. Married to a mechanic for ten years, she now has three children. Her husband’s income is insufficient to cover the family expenses. Early on, Mrs. K. started up a small business selling a variety of products (e.g. soap, canned food, candy) in front of her house, in order to provide for her children. A generous and honest woman, she has paid back her previous loans without difficulty. To liven up her shop window, Mrs. K. needs an $800 loan to open a store and enlarge her business to attract more clients. This loan will help her to feed her children well, and to pay their school fees and other expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Sylvie est une femme très dévouée et battante. Mariée à un mécanicien depuis une dizaine d’années, elle a aujourd’hui trois (3) enfants. L’économie de son mari ne lui permet pas de couvrir les dépenses de la famille. Très tôt, Madame K. a su orienter son économie vers le petit commerce de la vente des produits divers (savon, boîte de conserve, bonbon, etc.) devant sa maison afin de couvrir les dépenses de ses enfants. Femme honnête et généreuse, elle a su rembourser ses antécédents crédits sans difficulté. Pour donner plus de vie à son étalage, Madame K. a besoin d’un appui financier de $800 pour ouvrir une boutique et augmenter la taille de son commerce afin d’attirer plus de clientèle. Ce crédit pourra l’aider à bien nourrir ses enfants, a payer leur scolarité et autres.

loans.use: To open a store and enlarge her business

loans.name: Amélé

texts.en:
Ms. Amélé Z. is a young married woman in her thirties. She married and had two children but is now divorced from her husband, who left the children in her care. She also takes care of her elderly father and her two sisters. When she left school she learned to sew and opened a workshop, which she has been managing with energy and determination for five years. Thanks to her high school education and her experience, Ms. Amélé Z. has proven herself to be a good business manager by obtaining and repaying her first loan of $550 without incident. As she would like to equip her workshop with additional machines, she is requesting a loan of $850, which will allow her to buy an overcasting machine, an automatic sewing machine and an embroidery machine. These will help her increase her income in order to better meet her family's needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Z. Amélé est une jeune femme d’une trentaine d’années. Mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants, elle divorça de son mari qui lui laissa la charge des enfants. Outre ces deux derniers, elle s’occupe de son père, un vieillard et de ses deux sœurs. Abandonnant les études, elle apprit la couture et a ouvert son atelier qu’elle gère avec vigueur et détermination depuis 5 ans. Avec son niveau d’études secondaires et ses larges expériences, Madame Z. Amélé a fait preuve de bonne gestionnaire à travers son premier crédit de $550 obtenu et remboursé sans incident. Voulant doter son atelier d’autres machines, elle sollicite un apport financier de $850 qui va lui permettre d’acheter une machine à surfiler, une presse bouton, et une machine à broder. Ce qui augmentera son chiffre d’affaire en vue de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy an overcasting machine, an automatic sewing machine and an embroidery machine

loans.name: A. Mawuénavi Atsou

texts.en:
Mr. Amento Mawuénavi Atsou H. is a married father of four children. As he is very good at identifying and analyzing business opportunities, he has invested the savings earned from his job as a cobbler in buying a mill. This has allowed him to create a very prosperous business because he is the only person in his town who has a mill. Today he would like to enhance his ability to satisfy his customers by installing a second mill. Faced with insufficient financial means, Mr. Atsou HAMEDA is requesting a loan of $850, which will allow him to achieve this goal. This will increase his profits and his income and allow him to meet his children's material and educational needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Amento Mawuénavi Atsou est marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Très douée dans l’identification et dans l’analyse des opportunités d’affaires, il a investi son économie issue de son travail de cordonnier, dans l’achat d’un moulin. C’est une activité très florissante car il est le seul à avoir le moulin dans sa localité. Aujourd’hui, il espère renforcer sa capacité de satisfaire les clients en installant un second moulin. Devant ses moyens insuffisants, Monsieur H. Atsou sollicite ce crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre de réaliser ce projet. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et ses revenus afin de couvrir les besoins scolaires et sociaux de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy and install a second mill

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Ms. Pauline S. is a married mother of six children who also takes care of her mother, her younger brothers and two of her apprentices. She is a seamstress by trade. Her appreciation of a job well done has earned her the reputation of a respectable woman in her town. She has a lot of customers coming to her workshop, but the state of her machines does not allow her to fulfill all of their orders. Ms. Pauline S. is requesting a loan of $800 to buy new sewing machines and sell the cloth that her customers have requested. This will increase her income and help her to better take care of her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Pauline est une femme mariée et mère de six (6) enfants et a à sa charge sa mère, ses petits frères et deux de ses apprentis. Elle est couturière de profession. Son sens de travail bien fait et bien appliqué fait d’elle une femme respectable dans sa localité. Son atelier est très fréquenté par des clients. Avec l’état de ses machines, elle n’arrive pas à honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de cette clientèle exigeante. Madame S. Pauline sollicite un apport financier de $800 pour l’achat de nouvelles machines à coudre et sur la demande de sa clientèle vendre des tissus. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et l’aidera à mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and sell printed cloth

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
A married mother of six children, Ms. Akossiwa A. is an energetic and courageous woman. Her husband, a carpenter by trade, has difficulty contributing to the family's income. In addition to her children, Ms. A. also takes care of two girls who are her apprentices. She must divide her time between her family and her mini restaurant where she sells “foufou” (mashed yams) with various sauces, but her years of experience help her to manage the situation. Despite her limited education, she is able to manage her business well.

Her mini restaurant has become a very popular place for everyone in her town, but she is no longer able to meet such high demand. She is requesting a loan of $800 to remodel her restaurant and to buy a supply of yams and other items. This will allow her to become financially independent and to meet her family's basic needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de six (6) enfants, Madame A. Akossiwa est une femme dynamique et courageuse. Son mari, menuisier de profession contribue difficilement aux charges du ménage. En plus de ses enfants, Madame A. a en charge deux (2) filles en apprentissage. Partagée entre son mini restaurant où elle vend du foufou (ignames pilées) avec de diverses sauces et sa famille, elle possède une expérience qui lui permet de mieux contrôler la situation. Malgré son niveau d’études très bas, elle cerne correctement la gestion de ses activités.

Son mini restaurant est devenu un lieu très fréquenté par tous les habitants de sa localité, ce qui fait qu’elle n’arrive plus à être à la hauteur de la demande. Elle sollicite un soutien financier de $800 pour le réaménagement de son restaurant, s’approvisionner en ignames et autres. Ceci lui permettra d’acquérir une autonomie financière et subvenir aux besoins les plus élémentaires de la famille.

loans.use: To remodel her restaurant and buy a supply of yams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PURCHASE A DAIRY COW

loans.name: Afua Etonam

texts.en:
Ms. Afua Etonam T. is a married mother of four children. Her husband's business of raising chickens is not very profitable, so Ms. T. has begun selling smoked fish in order to meet her family's needs. She is a very devoted and energetic woman when it comes to her business. She is calm and always welcoming and has been able to earn the trust of everyone in her town. Ms. T.'s supply can no longer meet the demand of the market. In order to do so, she is requesting a loan of $700 to build a second oven, buy a larger supply of fish and increase her production of smoked fish. This will increase her income and also her family's well-being.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Afua Etonam est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. L’activité principale de son mari est l’élevage des poules ordinaires, ce qui n’est pas très rentable. Pour cela, Madame T. se lance dans la vente des poissons fumés pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. C’est une femme très dévouée et dynamique dans les activités commerciales. Calme et toujours accueillante, elle arrive à gagner la confiance de tous les habitants de sa localité. L’offre de Madame T. n’arrive plus à couvrir la demande du marché. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour la fabrication d’un second four, s’approvisionner plus en poisson et augmenter sa production en poisson fumé. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire en vue du bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: To build a second oven and to buy, smoke and sell fish

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Ms. Afi A. is a married mother of three children. Her business of selling onions is prosperous but requires substantial financial means. She is very courageous and ambitious and would like to become a wholesale seller and go to onion-producing villages herself to buy her supplies. This would require additional funds, but Ms. A. does not currently possess the capital needed. She is thus requesting a loan of $700 to build her supply in these times of high production in order to increase her profit during times of need. The loan requested will allow her to buy onions wholesale, stock them and sell them during periods of high demand. This will be very profitable both financially and morally but will most of all allow her to provide better living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Afi est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des oignons. C’est un commerce florissant et qui nécessite beaucoup de moyens financiers. Très courageuse et ambitieuse, elle veut devenir grossiste et aller elle-même dans les villages de production pour s’approvisionner. Ce qui demande plus de moyens alors que Madame A. n’a pas un capital consistant. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un appui financier de $700 pour rehausser son stock en ces temps d’abondance en vue d’augmenter son profit en temps de pénurie. Le crédit sollicité servira à acheter de l’oignon en gros, le stocker et le revendre en période de soudure. Ceci lui sera très bénéfique tant sur le plan financier, moral et surtout une hausse du niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy onions wholesale, stock them and sell them during periods of high demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PURCHASE TWO MOTOR WATER PUMPS

loans.name: Akouvi Amen

texts.en:
Ms. Amen Akouvi K. is a very devoted and intelligent woman and is married to a motorcycle taxi driver. Her husband's income is not enough to fulfill the family's needs. A mother of three children, Ms. K. also takes care of her mother, who is not fit to work. Her business is making statuettes that she sells in order to help pay the family's expenses. She learned this trade from her mother. She has proven many times her abilities as a good business manager and her dedication to hard work. In light of the success of her business and increasing demand, she needs additional financial means in order to meet the demand of the market. The granting of a loan of $850 will allow her to modernize fabrication techniques of her statuettes and to sell them at other markets in the country. This loan will allow her to increase her income and to better help her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée à un conducteur de taxi moto, Madame K. Akouvi Amen est une femme très dévouée et intelligente. Le revenu de l’activité de son mari ne permet pas l’épanouissement de la famille. Mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame K. compte aussi à sa charge sa mère devenue inapte. Comme activité, elle fabrique des statuettes qu’elle vend afin de contribuer aux dépenses familiales. C’est un métier qu’elle a hérité de sa mère. Elle a démontré à plusieurs reprises sa capacité de bonne gestionnaire et sa rigueur au travail. Vu le succès qu’elle réalise dans ses activités et les demandes de plus en plus importantes, elle a besoin de plus de moyens financiers afin de pouvoir répondre aux exigences du marché. L’octroi de ce crédit des $850 lui permettra de moderniser ses techniques de fabrication des statuettes et de les écouler sur les autres marchés du pays. Comme impact, ce crédit lui permettra de d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de mieux venir en aide à sa famille.

loans.use: To buy the raw materials to make statuettes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PURCHASE MILK COOLER

loans.name: Assou

texts.en:
Born to a family of producers of “sodabi” (a local drink made from the palm tree), Mr. Assou D. is a father of six children, all of whom are in school. He is in the family business of producing sodabi, a very popular drink in his town that is also highly sought after for holidays and celebrations. His wife does not work and does not contribute to the household income, which makes life difficult for Mr. D.. He has been noted for his ability to repay loans before the deadline and especially for his energy and over thirty years of experience in making sodabi. He is requesting a new loan of $800 to buy more production materials to increase his production yield, which will allow him to contribute more to the household income and to better meet his family's material and financial needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né d’une famille productrice de « sodabi » (boisson locale tirée du palmier), Monsieur D. Assou est père de famille de six (06) enfants, tous scolarisés. Comme héritage il produit du « sodabi » une boisson très appréciée dans la localité et surtout très recherchée en période de grandes cérémonies. Sa femme n’a aucune activité pour contribuer aux charges de ménage, ce qui pèse énormément sur Monsieur D.. Il s’est fait remarqué par sa capacité de remboursement avant échéance et surtout son dynamisme et son expérience depuis plus de 30 ans dans ce métier. Il sollicite de nouveau un crédit de$800 pour acheter plus de matériels en matières de production pour un meilleur rendement qui lui permettra ainsi de subvenir plus aux charges de la famille et pour un meilleur épanouissement social et financier.

loans.use: To buy African oil palms and other materials to produce “sodabi”

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PURCHASE DAIRY COWS

loans.name: Essenam

texts.en:
Ms. Essenam S. is a married mother of four children. She is very energetic and is experienced in selling secondhand clothing in her town. Her husband is a moped and motorcycle mechanic who is unable to pay the household expenses due to a lack of customers. Thanks to her rigorous business management, Ms. Essenam S. has been able to manage two consecutive loans that were both repaid in full. She is requesting a new loan of $800 to increase the size of her shop and display window. The amount requested will serve to buy and sell new lines of secondhand clothing. In light of the existing needs of her family, this loan will be very beneficial as it will allow her to increase her income, something that will have a large effect on her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Essenam est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle est très dynamique et expérimentée dans la vente de la friperie dans sa localité. Son mari est un mécanicien à 2 roues qui n’arrive pas à couvrir les charges du ménage faute de clientèle. Grâce à sa gestion rigoureuse, Madame S. Essenam a su gérer deux fois de suite ses crédits qui ont été bien soldés. Elle sollicite ce crédit de $800 pour agrandir sa boutique et son étalage. Le montant demandé servira à acheter et à vendre de nouvelles gammes de friperie. Vu aussi les besoins existants au sein de son foyer, ce prêt lui sera très bénéfique puisqu’elle va ainsi augmenter son revenu qui aura une très forte répercussion sur le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell new lines of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HIS FARMING BUSINESS

loans.name: Hoesseh

texts.en:
A married mother of three children, Ms. Hoesseh A. also takes care of her husband, left handicapped by an accident. She is a tireless and extremely devoted woman who works hard to bring up her children and who fights for their success. Her business is turning palm nuts into red palm oil, which is very popular and widely consumed in Togo. This seasonal activity is very prosperous because of all of the palm oil by-products that represent additional sources of income. Today Ms. Hoesseh A. needs a loan of $600 to buy palm nuts and to build a large stock of them to sell in periods of high demand. This opportunity will allow her to increase her production and her income so that she can meet the basic needs of her children, who are practically her responsibility alone.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame A. Hoesseh a à sa charge son mari devenu handicapé mental après un accident. Infatigable et très dévouée, elle a le sens d’une bonne éducatrice et se bat pour la réussite de ses enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la transformation de la noix de palme en huile rouge très appréciée et consommée au Togo. Cette activité saisonnière est très florissante à cause de tous les dérivés de la noix de palme qui constituent également d’autres sources de revenus. Madame A. Hoesseh nécessite aujourd’hui un financement de $600 pour l’achat des noix de palme et faire un stock important pour être revendu en période de soudure. Cette opportunité lui permettra d’accroître sa production et augmenter ses revenus pour assurer les besoins élémentaires de ses enfants qui sont presque tous abandonnés à elle seule.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts to make red palm oil

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Born September 2nd, 1975 in Afagnan village in Lacs Prefecture, Mrs. Marie A. is a single mother of three children. She trades basic grocery items and is one of the first women in her neighborhood to participate in microfinance. Although not highly educated, she quickly gained an understanding of price fluctuations in the different markets she goes to. This understanding allowed her to adjust her own prices according to local purchasing power. She has already successfully repaid her first two loans without difficulty. Today, Mrs. Marie A. seeks a $700 loan to stock groceries and build a real base of trade in the area, increasing her market share. This will allow her to meet her socio-economic needs and will contribute to the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 2 Septembre 1975 à Afagnan (Préfecture des Lacs), Madame A. Marie est célibataire et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce des denrées alimentaires. Et c’est l’une des premières femmes de son quartier à s’ouvrir au système de microfinance. Un peu instruite, elle arrive à saisir très rapidement les changements de prix des produits au niveau des différents marchés qu’elle fréquente. Ce qui lui a valu l’adaptation de prix à la bourse de la population locale .Elle a déjà réussit à rembourser ses deux premiers crédits sans problème. Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Marie sollicite un crédit de $700 pour s’approvisionner en denrées alimentaires et asseoir réellement ce commerce dans sa zone et ainsi détenir le monopole de vente. Ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire ses besoins socio-économiques et contribuer à l’épanouissement de toute la famille

loans.use: Acheter et revendre des denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HIS FARMING BUSINESS

loans.name: Akou Augustine

texts.en:
Born in Tsévié village of Zio Prefecture in 1965, Mrs. Akou Agustine K. grew up in Kloto Prececture. A courageous and diligent retailer of shoes and purses, she knew how to take on the competition to make a name for herself. A mother of five children, she is currently the head of her household because her husband has been unemployed for five years. Mrs. K. would like to renew her merchandise with the latest items. She is seeking a $750 loan to stock shoes and purses to meet market demand. This loan will help continue her children’s education and generally improve the family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1965 à Tsévié (Préfecture du Zio), Madame K. Akou Augustine est originaire de la préfecture de Kloto. Très courageuse et assidue dans son commerce de chaussures et sacs, elle a su braver la concurrence autour d’elle pour se faire une place au soleil. Mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle est actuellement la responsable de son foyer car son mari est sans emploi depuis cinq (05) ans. Madame K. veut renouveler sa marchandise en nouvel arrivage. Elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour s’approvisionner en chaussures et sacs afin de satisfaire la demande du marché. Ce crédit permettra une évolution normale dans l’éducation des enfants et l’amélioration générale de leur condition d’existence.

loans.use: stocking shoes and purses to meet customer demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE A DAIRY COW

loans.name: Adzoa

texts.en:
Born in 1970, Mrs. Adzoa A. is a married mother of four children. Early on, she began trading tapioca, beans, and cooking oil. She is responsible for her children’s education and also supports her young brothers with the small profit she earns from her business. She has already benefited from two loans which were successfully repaid owing to her dynamism and the way she applies herself to her work. She is currently seeking a $750 loan to increase her tapioca, bean, and cooking oil stocks. This loan will improve her household conditions and positively contribute to the educational development of her young brothers.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1970, Madame A. Adzoa est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Très tôt, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de tapioca, du haricot et d’huile. Elle s’occupe de l’éducation de ses enfants et soutient ses frères qui ne sont pas encore majeurs avec le peu de profit qu’elle tire de son activité. Elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien soldés à cause de son dynamisme et son application au travail. Actuellement, elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour augmenter son stock en tapioca, haricot, et huile. Ce prêt aura pour impact l’amélioration des conditions d’existence dans le foyer et la bonne évolution de ses jeunes frères.

loans.use: Stocking tapioca, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Angèle

texts.en:
Born May 20th, 1977 in Dapaong, Mrs. Angèle D. is a married mother of three children. She has been stocking and selling corn for seven years. She had to follow her husband, who is a teacher, when he was recently relocated to Attitogon. Fortunately, she is managing to re-establish her business, though she would like to strenghten it to assert herself in her new location. During her current phase of stocking, she is seeking a $750 loan to take advantage of opportunities for puchase and storage of grains. Her business success will allow her to help her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 20 Mai 1977 à Dapaong, Madame D. Angèle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité le stockage et la vente de maïs depuis 7 ans. Son mari enseignant affecté à Attitogon, elle se trouva dans l’obligation de le suivre. Heureusement elle arrive à se retrouver mais cherche à renforcer son activité afin de pouvoir s’imposer dans son nouvel environnement. A cette période de stockage de céréales, elle sollicite un apport financier de $750 pour saisir des opportunités d’achats et stockage de céréales .La réussite de ses activités lui permettra d’aider son mari à supporter les dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase and stocking of grains

loans.name: Essi

texts.en:
Born in 1979, Miss Essi K. transforms hairstyles with a golden touch. She lives with her parents, both non-working. Her father is currently paralyzed and she pays the medical costs, thanks to the income from her job. She is unmarried with two (02) children. Hairstyling is a job she has been conducting for 7 years with pride. She owns a hair salon with many apprentices and hopes to enlarge it and to equip it better to increase yield. These days, her work is highly sought after, and to satisfy this increasingly growing demand, she is asking for a loan of $800 to buy modern dryers and other accessories; this will allow her to continue providing quality training for her apprentices and to take good care of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1979, Mlle K. Essi a des mains d’or pour transformer les coupes de cheveux. Elle vit avec ses parents tous deux inactifs. Son père est actuellement paralysé et c’est elle qui supporte ses frais médicaux grâce aux revenus de son travail. Elle est célibataire avec deux (02) enfants. La coiffure est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 7 ans avec fierté. Elle possède un salon de coiffure avec de nombreux apprentis et souhaite l’agrandir et mieux l’équiper pour un meilleur rendement. Aujourd’hui, ses prestations sont très demandées et pour satisfaire cette demande toujours grandissante, elle sollicite un appui financier de $800 pour l’achat des séchoirs modernes et tous les autres accessoires ;ce qui lui permettra de toujours donner une formation de qualité à ses apprentis et bien prendre soin de sa famille .

loans.use: To buy modern dryers and other accessories

loans.name: Essi

texts.en: Née en 1979, Mlle K. Essi a des mains d’or pour transformer les coupes de cheveux. Elle vit avec ses parents tous deux inactifs. Son père est actuellement paralysé et c’est elle qui supporte ses frais médicaux grâce aux revenus de son travail. Elle est célibataire avec deux (02) enfants. La coiffure est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 7 ans avec fierté. Elle possède un salon de coiffure avec de nombreux apprentis et souhaite l’agrandir et mieux l’équiper pour un meilleur rendement. Aujourd’hui, ses prestations sont très demandées et pour satisfaire cette demande toujours grandissante, elle sollicite un appui financier de $800 pour l’achat des séchoirs modernes et tous les autres accessoires ;ce qui lui permettra de toujours donner une formation de qualité à ses apprentis et bien prendre soin de sa famille .

loans.use: Achat des séchoirs modernes et tous les autres accessoires

loans.name: Adakou

texts.en:
Born in 1962 in Lomé, Mrs. Adakou A. manages a small garden whose cultivation and products allow her to meet the needs of her five (05) children. For a number of years, Mrs. A. has not received any help from her husband, who is in a difficult financial situation. Based on her garden's products, she has formed a small business selling general foodstuffs, which does very well in her area.

Today, Mrs. Adakou A. is asking for a loan of $500 for a new enlargement to her business which would involve the stockpiling and sale of cassava flour, maize, and rice, which she can sell at a higher price in times of shortage and generate large profits for the survival of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1962 à Lomé, Madame A. Adakou dispose d’un petit maraîcher dont les cultures lui permettent, par leur vente de subvenir aux besoins de ses cinq (05) enfants. Il y a de cela des années que Madame A. ne reçoit plus d’aide de son époux en difficulté financière. Aux produits maraîchers, elle a associé un petit commerce d’alimentation générale qui marche très bien dans sa localité.

Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Adakou sollicite un crédit de $500 pour un nouvel agrandissement de son commerce en faisant le stock et la vente de farine de manioc, du maïs et du riz qu’elle pourra revendre plus cher en temps de pénuries et faire de gros bénéfices pour la survie de sa famille.

loans.use: To sell cassava flour, maize, and rice

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Kpémé, Mrs. Afi K. has one daughter who is currently in her second-to-last year in high school. Thanks to her first loan of $150, she was able to open her general food store 4 years ago. This store allows her to take care of her only child and her two nephews who live with her. Today, in her area, many people are opening mini restaurants. Unfortunately, there are not enough suppliers of frozen products to satisfy all of these restaurants. Mrs. K. therefore believes that the sale of frozen goods would be a lucrative business.

She would therefore like a loan of $850 to buy a freezer and to stock it with frozen goods. The success of this project will allow her to meet the daily needs of her daughter and her whole family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1965 à Kpémé, Madame K. Afi est mère d’une fille qui est actuellement en classe de première. Grâce à son premier crédit de $150 elle a ouvert sa boutique d’alimentation générale il y a de cela 4 ans. Ce qui lui permet de prendre soin de son unique enfant et de ses deux neveux qui vivent avec elle. Aujourd’hui, dans sa localité, beaucoup de personnes ouvrent de mini restaurants. Malheureusement, il existe trop peu de fournisseurs en produits congelés pour satisfaire tous ces restaurants. Madame K. a donc pensé que vendre des produits congelés serait aussi une activité rémunératrice.

Elle voudrait donc un appui financier de $850 pour s’acheter un congélateur et s’approvisionner en produits congelés. La réussite de ce projet lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de son enfant et de toute la famille.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and to obtain frozen products

loans.name: Hogbessi

texts.en:
Born in 1954 in Vogan, Mrs. Hogbessi S. is the mother of four (04) children and has three (03) grandsons. She still smartly manages her maize and rice business, something she has done for the past 20 years. Her husband, recently deceased, left in her charge their two youngest children, who are still in school; this makes life even more difficult fot this family already in disarray. To ease her troubles, Mrs. Hogbessi S. wants to enlarge her shop display, which comprises manufactured food products, liquor, and stocks of flour, beans, maize, and rice. Currently, the supply of maize and rice is abundant, which makes their price very low. Mrs. Hogbessi S. is asking for a loan of $600 to supply her store, to stockpile goods, and to re-sell them in times of scarcity, The success of such a business will allow Mrs. Hogbessi S. to resolve her family's many difficulties and to better ensure the education of her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1954 à Vogan (P/Vo), Madame S. Hogbessi est mère de quatre (4) enfants et grand-mère de trois (3) petits fils. Elle reste encore dégourdie pour le commerce de maïs et de riz, activité qu’elle exerce depuis 20 ans. Son mari, décédé depuis peu a laissé à sa charge leurs deux derniers enfants encore sur les bancs ;ce qui rend plus difficile la vie de cette famille déjà aux désarrois. Pour soulager ses peines, Madame S. Hogbessi veut augmenter son étalage qui comporte des produits d’alimentation manufacturée, des liqueurs et des stocks de farine, de haricot, de maïs et de riz. Actuellement, l’offre en maïs et en riz est très abondante, ce qui fait que le coût de leur bol est très bas. Madame S. Hogbessi sollicite un crédit de $600 pour s’approvisionner, faire des stocks et les revendre en temps de pénurie. Le succès d’une telle activité permettra à Madame S. Hogbessi de résoudre ses nombreux problèmes de famille et mieux assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.

loans.use: To stockpile maize and rice

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Née en 1984 à Aného, Mlle S. Jeanne a hérité le petit commerce de sa mère. Actuellement, elle est élève en classe de terminale et vit avec ses parents. Très douée et avec son savoir faire, elle exerce simultanément le commerce et continue les études . Pour les besoins de son activité, Mlle S. Jeanne se rend chaque fin de semaine à Lomé pour s’approvisionner. C’est un petit commerce qu’elle tient, car elle se permet de fournir ses produits à ses camarades de classe et autres élèves de son établissement.

Aujourd’hui, Mlle S. a trouvé une jeune demoiselle qui voudrait s’associer à elle pour ouvrir un kiosque pour la vente des fournitures. Elle sollicite un appui financier de $450  pour ouvrir un kiosque. Les bénéfices d’une telle activité permettra à Mlle S. Jeanne de se prendre en charge et d’effectuer convenablement ses études.

loans.use: Ouvrir un kiosque pour la vente des fournitures

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Born in 1984 in Aného, Miss Jeanne S. inherited her mother's small business. Currently, she is in her final year of high school and lives with her parents. Highly gifted and blessed with know-how, she runs her business and pursues her studies simultaneously. For the needs of her business, Miss Jeanne S. goes to Lomé every weekend to obtain supplies. She runs her small business by selling these supplies to her classmates and other students at her school.

Today, Miss Jeanne S. has found a young woman who would like to join her in opening a kiosk selling supplies. She is asking for $450 in financial support to open this kiosk. The benefits of such a business will allow Miss Jeanne S. to take charge of and suitably carry through her studies.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1984 à Aného, Mlle S. Jeanne a hérité le petit commerce de sa mère. Actuellement, elle est élève en classe de terminale et vit avec ses parents.
