Très douée et avec son savoir faire, elle exerce simultanément le commerce et continue les études . Pour les besoins de son activité, Mlle S. Jeanne se rend chaque fin de semaine à Lomé pour s’approvisionner. C’est un petit commerce qu’elle tient, car elle se permet de fournir ses produits à ses camarades de classe et autres élèves de son établissement.

Aujourd’hui, Mlle S. a trouvé une jeune demoiselle qui voudrait s’associer à elle pour ouvrir un kiosque pour la vente des fournitures. Elle sollicite un appui financier de $450 pour ouvrir un kiosque .Les bénéfices d’une telle activité permettra à Mlle S. Jeanne de se prendre en charge et d’effectuer convenablement ses études.

loans.use: To open a kiosk selling school supplies

loans.name: Amèvi

texts.en:
Mr. Amèvi T. was born on 19 February 1966 in Lomé. He is the father of five (05) children who are in his care, along with his wife and mother. In Kpémé, the demand for basic goods and general food products is very large. Mr. Amèvi T. is one of the merchants who provides basic need goods and general food products to the local population. Not having had the chance to go to school due to a lack of means, he quickly became interested in this business, which he manages very well. He has already obtained a loan of $100 which he repaid without incident.

Today, with the rapid development of his business, Mr. Amèvi T. is asking for a loan of $750 to create new sections for different products in his store. These include, among others, crockery, detergents, and children's toys, as demanded by his clientele. Financing such a business will allow Mr. Amèvi T. to contribute effectively to the development of all his family members.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur T. Amèvi est né le 19 février 1966 à Lomé. Il est père de cinq (05) enfants qui demeurent à sa charge ainsi que son épouse et sa mère. A Kpémé, la demande en produits de premières nécessités et d’alimentation générale est très importante. Monsieur T. Amèvi fait partie des commerçants qui fournissent des produits de première nécessité et d’alimentation générale à la population locale. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école par faute de moyens, il s’est vite intéressé à ce commerce qu’il gère très bien. Il a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de $100 qu’il a remboursé sans incident.

Aujourd’hui, avec l’essor que connaît son commerce, Monsieur T. Amèvi sollicite un crédit de $750 pour créer de nouveaux rayons de produits. Il s’agit entre autres de la vaisselle, des produits détergents, des jouets pour enfants sur la demande de sa clientèle. Financer une telle activité permettra à Monsieur T. Amèvi de contribuer efficacement à l’épanouissement de toute sa famille 

loans.use: To create new store sections for dishes, detergents, and children's toys

loans.name: Ténée

texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Sokodé, Mrs. Ténée D. is married and has three (03) children. She lives alone with her mother for almost 5 years now. She is in charge of her mother and of her three children, who are all in school. Her husband lives in Lomé and has no income. So, thanks to her general food business, Mrs. D. is able to meet the needs of her family. With the development of her work, she is asking for a loan of $650 to enlarge her business, increase her stock, and to safeguard her products by opening a store where she would arrange her products on shelves. The realizaton of this project wiill allow Mrs. Ténée D. to meet the needs of her family and to ensure the education of her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1971 à Sokodé, Madame D. Ténée est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle vit seule avec sa mère depuis bientôt 5 ans. C’est elle qui a la charge de cette dernière et de ses trois enfants tous scolarisés. Son mari vit à Lomé et ne possède aucun revenu. Aussi c’est grâce à son commerce d’alimentation générale que Madame D. arrive à subvenir aux charges de la famille. Avec l’évolution de son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour agrandir son activité, augmenter son stock et sécuriser ses produits en ouvrant une boutique où elle disposerait d’étagères pour ses produits. La réalisation de ce projet permettra à Madame D. Ténée de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d’assurer l’éducation de ces enfants.

loans.use: To open a general food store

loans.name: Aklobessi

texts.en:
Born in 1949 in Zwola (Prefecture of les Lacs), Mrs. Aklobessi K. is widowed and has five (05) children, all of adult age. She has in her care two of her grandchildren, who are in school. Thanks to the weaving and sale of mats, she is able to meet her needs and those of her grandchildren. Currently, her straw mats are of very good quality, but wear faster than plastic mats. Mrs. K. recently learned plastic mat-making techniques and would like to start making them. She is a very dynamic woman who has mastered her craft. She has already benefited from two loans, both repaid, and deserves to be suported. Currently, Mrs. K. is asking for a loan of $650 to buy in bulk the basic materials necessary for the fabrication of plastic mats.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1949 à Zowla (Préfecture des Lacs), Madame K. Aklobessi est veuve et mère de cinq (5) enfants tous à l’âge adulte. Elle a à charge deux de ses petits enfants qui sont scolarisés. C’est grâce au tressage et à la vente des nattes qu’elle subvient à ses besoins et celui de ses petits enfants. Actuellement, les nattes en pailles sont de très bonne qualité mais résistent moins que les nattes en plastique. Madame K. vient d’acquérir la technique de fabrication des nattes en plastique et voudrait en fabriquer. C’est une femme très dynamique qui maîtrise bien son métier. Elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits bien remboursés et mérite d’être soutenue. Aujourd’hui Madame K. Aklobessi sollicite un crédit de $650 pour acheter en gros les matières premières nécessaires à la fabrication des nattes en plastique.

loans.use: To buy in bulk the basic materials necessary to make plastic mats

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
In Zwola, one of the main businesses is the weaving of mats. Mrs. Kayi D. takes part in the creation of mats, a business she has engaged in since she was very young. Born in 1953, she is widowed and has six (06) children. In addition to weaving mats, she specializes in the sorting of straw which is used in the fabrication of mats. Others who make mats come to her to order straw. Recently, she visited a storehouse where the straw is of very good quality. The owner of the storehouse is getting ready to cut the straw and sell it. Mrs. D. is asking for a loan of $650 to buy straw, build up a stockpile, and to make and sell mats.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

A Zwola, l’une des activités principales est le tressage des nattes. Madame D. Kayi fait partie de ses tresseuses de nattes, activité qu’elle exerce depuis sa plus tendre jeunesse. Née en 1953, elle est veuve et mère de six (06) enfants. En plus du tressage des nattes, elle est une spécialiste en triage des pailles servant à la fabrication des nattes. Ce qui fait que souvent les tresseuses s’adressent à elle pour lui commander des pailles. Tout dernièrement, elle a visité une réserve dont les pailles sont de très bonne qualité. Le propriétaire de la réserve s’apprête à les couper et a les vendre. Madame D. sollicite un crédit de $650 pour acheter ses pailles, faire le stockage, la vente et la fabrication des nattes.

loans.use: To buy and stockpile straw in order to make mats

loans.name: Yawovi

texts.en:
The business of electronic equipment is something Mr. Yawovi A. has engaged in for 5 years. Born in 1965 in Aného, he is married and the father of three (03) children. Thanks to this business, he is able to meet the needs of his children. His work consists of going to the port and acquiring at very low prices irons, televisions, hi-fi systems, and other equipment to re-sell at Kpémé. Many people come to get their electronic equipment with him. With this growing business, Mr. A. is asking for a loan of $800 to increase his sales and enlarge his equipment stock. This will improve his living conditions and those of his entire family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Le commerce des appareils électroniques est une activité qu’exerce Monsieur A. Yawovi depuis 5 ans. Né en 1965 à Aného, il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. C’est grâce à ce commerce qu’il subvient aux besoins de ses enfants. Son commerce consiste à se rendre au port et à acquérir à vil prix des fers à repasser, des télévisions, des chaînes Hi Fi, et autres instruments pour les revendre à Kpémé. Beaucoup de personnes viennent acquérir leurs appareils électroniques auprès de lui. Avec cette activité grandissante, Monsieur A. sollicite un crédit de $800 pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaires en agrandissant son stock d’appareils. Cela améliorera ses conditions de vie et celle de toute sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell electronic equipment

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Mrs. Alice A., nicknamed Mrs. "Golden Juice," is a master of creating juice from a variety of fruits highly valued in her area. Born in 1970 in Lomé, she is married and has three (03) children. Her fruit juice business allows her to help her unemployed husband in meeting the needs of their large family. With the couple live their children, six (06) nephews and nieces, and cousins from both sides of the family. The fabrication of fruit juice is a very profitable business, but it necessitates lots of material and effort.

Currently, Mrs. Alice A. is asking for a loan of $700 to buy a new freezer and to increase the production of quality juice. The income from this business will allow her to take care of her family better and to attend to their socio-economic well-being.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Alice, surnommée Madame « Jus d’or » est une maîtresse dans la concoction de jus de fruits de tout genre très apprécié dans sa localité. Née en 1970 à Lomé, elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Son commerce de jus de fruits lui permet d’aider son époux désœuvré à subvenir aux besoins de leur grande famille. Avec le couple, vivent leurs enfants, six (06) neveux et nièces et des cousins des deux familles. La fabrication de jus de fruits est une activité très rentable mais qui nécessite beaucoup de moyens et d’efforts.

Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Alice sollicite un crédit de $700 pour acheter un nouveau congélateur et augmenter sa production en jus de qualité. Le revenu de ce commerce lui permettra de mieux s’occuper de sa famille et de veiller à son bien-être socio-économique

loans.use: To buy a new freezer and to increase the production of good quality juice

loans.name: Aklobessi

texts.en:
Mrs. Aklobessi G. is a 50-year old widow. She is the mother of seven (07) children and also takes care of three (03) additional children. She has a lot of experience in weaving mats and specializes in the dying of straw to decorate these mats. Thanks to her mat-braiding skills, she is able to support all her children. The quality of her work, well done and delivered on time, has made her very well-known and respected. Currently, she has gained the confidence of her clients, who regulary request her services. But she needs lots of material to satisfy all of these increasingly urgent demands. This is why she is asking for a loan of $650 to obtain raffia, straw, and dye to respond to the many requests of her clientele. The benefits drawn from this business will allow her to meet the needs of her children and her whole family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Aklobessi est une femme veuve âgée de 50 ans Elle est mère de sept (07) enfants et a à sa charge trois (03) autres enfants. Elle a beaucoup d’expériences dans le tressage des nattes et est spécialisée dans la teinture des pailles pour la décoration des nattes. C’est grâce au tressage de nattes qu’elle a supporté tous ses enfants. La qualité de son travail bien fait et rendu à temps ont fait d’elle une femme de très bonne renommée et très respectée. Actuellement, elle a gagné la confiance des clients qui sollicitent régulièrement ses services. Mais il lui faut beaucoup de moyens pour satisfaire à toutes ces demandes de plus en plus importantes. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour se procurer les raphias, les pailles et les teintures pour répondre aux nombreuses exigences de sa clientèle. Les bénéfices tirés de commerce permettront de subvenir convenablement aux besoins de ses enfants et de toute la famille.

loans.use: To procure raffia, straw, and dye for weaving mats

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo tiene una experiencia de 30 años en la venta de mariscos. Después de trabajar en albañilería, un familiar lo llevo a trabajar para el entregando mariscos en empacadoras, actividad que le gusto y decidió comenzar a vender el por su cuenta. Obtuvo el capital de sus ahorros de los trabajos anteriores. El negocio lo maneja todos los días de la semana en el horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. en un sector cerca de su domicilio. Pablo desea el crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que en periodo de aguaje la mercadería hay bastante y el no puede comprar por falta de capital y desea comprar otros mariscos los que no tiene a la venta y sabe que con ellos sus ingresos van a ser mejores. Pablo tiene 62 años. Actualmente vive con su madre ya que esta separado desde hace 4 años, tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son adultos y le ayudan en lo que necesita. Al momento el desea poder comenzar a arreglar su casita ya que una parte de la casa no tiene techo, y sabe que con el dinero bien invertido de su negocio lograra obtener ganancias las cuales le servirán para lo que necesita.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in seafood to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has 2 years of experience in her business of sales of home products. She started her business with money that her husband had saved; together they have succeeded in launching the business. They work every day from 8 am to 3 pm alongside their sons, who help them sell. Previously, Ana worked in an office as a secretary for a year. When she left that job, her husband brought up the idea of starting her own business.

Ana wants the loan so she can invest it in the business by buying products her clients order but that she doesn't currently stock, and by having more products in stock in general, in order to generate more income.

Ana is 38 years old with 8 children. Four of her children are currently in school; the other four help her in the business. Her husband has worked for almost 16 years as a cook preparing morocho, a dry cracked corn used in beverages and foods; he enjoys his work. With the loan and the income their business generates, they would like to begin to improve their home, which is currently made of reed. They want to begin to reinforce the house with cement. They also want their children to be able to live a better quality of life. The childen who work with Ana and her husband wish to begin to build their own businesses soon, to follow their mother, who has succeeded in setting an example for them with her hard work and effort.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ana tiene una experiencia de 2 años con su negocio de ventas de artículos de hogar, el cual lo inicio con dinero que tenia ahorrado su esposo y juntos han logrado sacarlo adelante. El negocio lo trabajan todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. con dos de sus hijos que son los que le ayudan a vender. Anterior ella trabajaba de secretaria en una oficina casi un año actividad que dejo por que su esposo le comento la idea de tener un negocio propio.

Ana desea el crédito para poder invertir en el negocio con productos que al momento no cuenta y tiene pedidos de ellos, y tener más productos para generar más ingresos.

Ana tiene 38 años, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian y los demás le ayudan en su negocio. Su esposo también trabaja de cocinero como elaborador de morochos por casi 16 años, actividad que le gusta realizar. Actualmente desean con el crédito y los ingresos que su negocio genere poder comenzar a arreglar su domicilio ya que actualmente su casita es de caña y quieren comenzar a hacerla de cemento. También quieren que sus hijos puedan vivir de una mejor manera. De los hijos que trabajan con ella ya desean en muy poco tiempo comenzar a tener su propio negocio ya que su madre ha sido la que con trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado dar el ejemplo para que ellos puedan seguirlo.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products for the home to sell

loans.name: Tamasha

texts.en:
This 39-year-old woman was born in Fizuli region Kurdmahmudlu village. She is married, has 4 children. 
Tamasha has a smal business where she sells agricultural produce: fruis, vegetables and etc. She started off working by selling as a street vendor.
Having borrowed a loan of $400 she bought agricultural produce.
Now she needs a loan of $700 to expand the area of her business.
Notwithstanding she lives on front line she works very hard to improve her business.
Tamasha has been engaged in this business for 6 years.

loans.use: To expand the area of her business

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en:
Khuraman is 39, single, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region Dilagar village, settled in  Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. She lives on the front line .
Khuraman has a small shop where she sells clothes for women, shoes and  shirts.  She has been engaged in this business since 2001. 
For the first time she borrowed a loan of $400 and bought clothes for women and shoes.
For the second time she borrowed a loan of $600 and bought shoes for men and shirts.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to expand the area of her shop .

loans.use: To expand the area of her shop

loans.name: Ulker

texts.en:
Ulkar rents a small shop where she sells foodstuffs, soaps, soap powders, shampoos. She is 47, married, has 2 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporary on front line in Fizuli region. 
Ulkar started off working by selling as a street vendor. She saved enough money to set up a business. 
Having borrowed a loan amount of $600 she bought industrial goods. Being busy with this business she supports her family.
Now she applies for a loan amount of $800 to expand the area of her shop and to buy foodstuffs.
Ulkar has been engaged in his business for 6 years.

loans.use: To expand the area of her shop and to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Zamila

texts.en:
This 54-year-old Zamila is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region Zargar village, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporary on front line in Fizuli region. She is married, has 3 children . 
Having borrowed a loan of $400 she started to be busy with sale of shoes for men and women, clothes for women: blouses, suits, dressing gowns and etc.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to expand the area of her shop.
She has been engaged in this business for 7 years.

loans.use: To expand the area of her shop

loans.name: Piedad

texts.en:
Piedad has 2 years of experiece with her business selling disenfectants for the home. She started the business thanks to the help of her son in law, who gave her the initial capital. She used to work doing housework but she fell ill, and was no longer able to continue with that job. Because she is a hardworking woman, she decided to look for a way to have her own business. People in the industry recommended that she sell disenfectants. This work has gone very well for her. She works every day of the week in her home and at her clients' homes (when asked) from 7 am till 10 pm.

Piedad would like the loan in order to invest the money in her business, since she doesn't have much capital and is thinking about promoting her products in new places.

Piedad is 58 years old. She is separated and lives with her son, who helps her with whatever she needs. She hopes to sell sweets out of her home in the future. She's had the sweets in mind and will being to offer them the moment she receives her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Piedad tiene una experiencia de 2 años con su negocio de vender desinfectantes para el hogar. Lo comenzó gracias ha la ayuda de un yerno que fue la persona que le dio el capital para comenzar. Anterior a este ella de dedicaba a trabajar en casa pero cayo enferma y no pudo seguir realizando esa labor. Pero como ella es una mujer de trabajo decide buscar la manera de cómo tener su propio negocio y por aliento de personas del sector le proponen que se dedique a la venta de desinfectantes. Esta actividad que le ha ido muy bien lo trabaja todos los días de la semana en su domicilio y también de manera ambulante cuando se lo piden en el horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m.

Piedad desea el crédito para poder invertir en su negocio ya que no cuenta con mucho capital y tiene demanda del producto y piensa a futuro poder ir a promocionar su producto en otro lugar.

Piedad tiene 58 años, está separada y vive con un hijo el que le ayuda en lo que ella necesita , a futuro espera poner en su domicilio también venta de golosinas, algo que tiene en mente y lo hará gracias a la ayuda que le brindaran al momento de otorgarle un crédito.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in the products for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has 10 years of experience in seafood sales, together with her husband, who taught her the business. He worked with his father from the age of 15. After he married Maria, they succeeded in founding their own business. They work every day from 7 am to 2 pm. They catch crabs, cook them, remove the meat and package it to be sold later.

Maria wants the loan so that she can invest it in her business, since she has demand she can't meet for lack of capital.

Maria is 28 years old. She has 4 children, all in school. Her children appreciate their parents for the effort they put into supporting them and giving them the opportunity to study. Maria and her husband wish to be able to buy a refrigerator with the earnings they are able to save. They now have a freezer where they store their seafood products but nothing of their own. They hope to buy their own house, as well, since they currently live with Maria's inlaws.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria tiene una experiencia de 10 años en el negocio de la venta de mariscos junto a su esposo que fue la persona que le enseño esta actividad. El desde la edad de 15 años comenzó a trabajar con su padre y una vez casado con Maria logran poner su propio negocio actividad que la realizan todos los días de la semana en el horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. En si el trabajo de ellos consiste en capturar el cangrejo, cocinarlos para después proceder a sacar su carne y ponerlo en tarrina para su posterior venta. Maria desea el crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que tiene bastante demanda y no logra cubrir por falta de capital. Maria tiene 28 años, 4 hijos los cuales estudian y están muy agradecidos de sus padres por el esfuerzo que ellos hacen en darle el estudio y mantenerlos. Ellos desean poder comprarse una nevera con las ganancias para poder guardar su mercadería. Actualmente tiene un congelador donde guardan el producto pero no es de ellos. Desean también tener su casita ya que actualmente viven donde los padres de su esposo.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in fresh seafood to sell

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca has a year's experience in clothing sales. Previously, because her husband died, she began to work doing domestic chores. Later she worked as a packer. When her sister saw her doing the packing work, she encouraged Blanca to start her own business selling clothes. She was able to finance her business with money loaned by her sister. She has succeeded in moving her business forward, selling to people she knows and to family members from Monday to Saturday, 9 am to 6 pm.

Blanca wants the loan in order to invest it in the business. She has lots of orders for beach clothing since it's that season, but because she lacks capital, she's unable to satisfy those client orders.

Blanca is 53 years old, with 6 children. Four of her children are now adults and help her with what she needs; the other two are still in school. In the future she wishes to fix up her house, and to give a better life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Blanca tiene una experiencia de 1 año en el negocio de venta de ropa, pero ella desde antes por motivos de que su esposo falleció comenzó a trabajar en quehaceres domésticos. Luego paso a trabajar a una empacadora y al ver esto, su hermana la motivo para que se inicie con su negocio propio y le propone vender ropa. Se logra financiar con dinero que le presto su hermana y hasta hoy a logrado sacar adelante el negocio vendiendo a personas conocidas del sector y familiares de lunes a sábado en horario de 9 a.m. hasta las 18 p.m.

Blanca desea el crédito para invertir en el negocio ya que tiene bastantes pedidos de ropa de playa por ser la temporada y ella por falta de capital no puede satisfacer a sus clientes.

Blanca tiene 53 años, 6 hijos de los cuales 4 ya son adultos y le ayudan en lo que necesita, los otros dos todavía estudian. Ella desea a futuro comenzar a arreglar su casa y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in beach and warm weather clothing

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca has 10 years of experience in jewelry and accessory sales. When her first committed relationship ended, she had to look for a way to give her children a good education and feed them well. She started in clothing sales when some people proposed the clothing business to her. Then one day she received a visit from a person selling jewelry, who was willing to give her the opportunity to leave part of her purchases on credit, so that she could begin to sell them on her own. With a loan of $75 she succeeded in starting her jewelry business. She works from Monday through Saturday, from 1 pm to 6 pm, which leaves her the morning to prepare her children's meals for the day.

Francisca wants the loan in order to invest it in her business. She wants to be able to buy wholesale, in cash, which would leave her much more profit than she realizes now.

Francisca is 41 years old with 6 children. Four of her children no longer live with her; the two who live with her are still in school. Her current husband works as a fisherman and helps her quite a bit around the house. She's thinking that with her business she'll be able to make repairs to her house, and improve the home environment.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Francisca tiene una experiencia de 10 años en el negocio de venta de joyas y bisutería. Ella tuvo una separación de su primer compromiso lo que hizo que ella busque la manera de poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación y alimentación. Por ende comienza con la venta de ropa ya que algunas personas le propusieron ese negocio. Luego de esto un día recibe la visita de una persona de venta de joyas las que le dan la oportunidad de dejarle fiado una parte de la mercadería para que ella comience a vender. Con un crédito de $ 75 dólares logra iniciar su negocio el cual lo trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 1 p.m. hasta las 6 p.m. ya que en la mañana deja todo cocinado para sus hijos. Francisca desea el crédito para invertir en su negocio y poder hacer compras mayores y al contado lo que le dejaría a ella una ganancia mejor de lo que percibe actualmente. Francisca tiene 41 años, y 6 hijos de los cuales 4 ya no viven con ella y solo dos están todavía estudiando, su actual esposo trabaja de pescador y le ayuda bastante en el hogar, piensa que con su negocio podrá comenzar a arreglar su casita y mejorar el ambiente de su hogar.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy jewelry and accessories in bulk

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro has 6 years of experience in the washing machine rental business. From the age of 12 he worked with his father as a fisherman; later he began to sell fish on his own. He decided to leave the seafood business and began to sell cell phone cards in the street, but the city wouldn't let him work. Finally one day his wife encouraged him to buy a few washing machines and to begin to rent them. He liked the idea and with the money they had saved they bought 4 washing machines in cash and started the business. Currently they have 6 washing machines and 2 tricycles with which they move them from house to house. They work from 7 am to 9 pm every day of the week.

Pedro wants the loan in order to buy himself 2 more washing machines. He has lots of demand that he is currently unable to meet.

Pedro is 32 years old. He is married with 3 children, 2 of whom are currently in school. His wife works selling shellfish in the morning and in the afternoon she helps with the washing machine business. About six months ago they bought a small house, since they were living with Pedro's mother. In the future they hope to begin to fix it up in order to give their family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcora, Kiva volunteer.

Pedro tiene una experiencia de 6 años en el negocio de alquiler de lavadoras. Antes se dedicaba desde la edad de 12 años a la pesca junto a su padre, luego ya mayor comienza por su cuenta a vender pescado. Decide dejar ese oficio y comienza a vender tarjetas de celulares en las calles pero el municipio de la ciudad no lo dejaba trabajar, hasta que un cierto día su esposa le anima para comprarse unas lavadoras y comenzar a alquilarlas. Le gusto la idea y con un dinero que tenían ahorrado compran al contado 4 lavadoras y comienzan el negocio. Actualmente cuentan con 6 lavadoras y 2 triciclos que son donde las movilizan de un domicilio a otro en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. todos los días de la semana.

Pedro desea el crédito para poder comprarse unas dos lavadoras mas ya que tiene una demanda muy buena y por el momento no se abastece con las que tiene.

Pedro tiene 32 años, es casado y 3 hijos dos de los cuales ya estudian. Su esposa también trabaja vendiendo mariscos en la mañana y en la tarde le ayuda a el en el negocio. Hace unos seis meses atrás el se compro una casita ya que vivía con su mama, y a futuro espera comenzar arreglarla para darle mejor vida a su familia.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy more washing machines for his business

loans.name: Nola

texts.en:
Nola has 2 years of experience in her own food sales business. She previously worked as head of personnel in a restaurant. One day her boss, who was a Chilean, proposed that he sell her the business and she accepted but had to close it when the landlord raised the rent. Later she went out to the country to rent a site where she could sell food. Sadly, her business burned to the ground. She then worked in people's homes doing domestic chores. Friends told her not to lose heart as a result of her failures, and suggested that she sell food out of her house, since she had experience. A neighbor lent her a table and she bought 4 chairs and started her business. Her son fixed up a place in the house and she started with 8 people. She works every day from 6 am to 3 pm; weekends she works until 10 at night. Her children help her serve the people who come to eat.

Nola wants the loan in order to buy herself an industrial kitchen and a cylinder of gas. She also wants to buy her food ingredients wholesale, which will increase her profit.

Nola is 67 years old. She has 5 children, all grown who help her in the business. With her earnings, she hopes to be able to buy herself a television for the pub and a freezer to better serve her guests.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Nola tiene una experiencia de 2 años en su negocio propio de venta de comidas. Anterior a este ella trabaja como jefa de personal en un restaurante y un día su jefe, que era un chileno, le propone venderle el negocio y ella acepta, pero tuvo que cerrarlo por que le subieron el arriendo. Luego de esto se va para el campo a alquilar un local y pone también venta de comida, lamentablemente se le quemo todo. Decide entonces irse a trabajar a casas realizando quehaceres domésticos. Amigas del sector le dicen que no se desanime por sus fracasos y que venda comida en su domicilio ya que tenía experiencia. Una vecina le presta una mesa y ella compra 4 sillas y comienza su negocio. Su hijo adecuo un lugar en la casa y con 8 personas inicio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en el horario de 6am hasta las 3 p.m. y los fines de semana hasta las 10 de la noche en donde recibe la ayuda de sus hijos para atender a las personas que llegan a comer.

Nola desea el crédito para poder comprarse una cocina industrial y un cilindro de gas y además víveres al por mayor lo que le dejaría mayor ganancia.

Nola tiene 67 años, tiene 5 hijos todos mayores los que le ayudan en su negocio. Con sus ganancias espera poder comprarse un televisor para el local y un congelador para mejorar la atención a sus comensales.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy an industrial kitchen

loans.name: Reimundo

texts.en:
Reimundo has 30 years experience in shellfish sales, a vocation he inherited from his father, who took him along fishing from the time he was 20 years old. He liked fishing very much and once he was married decided to start his own business with his savings and a loan. He bought himself a tricycle and began to ride through the streets of his neighborhood from 5 am till 11 at night in order to sell all of his product.

Reimundo wants the loan in order to invest it in additional seafood products since he currently only sells fish. He currently lacks the capital to invest in additional products.

Reimundo is 59 years old with 2 children, both in school. His wife also works; she's been working doing domestic chores for 7 years. With their earnings they hope to set up a domestic chores business in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Reimundo tiene una experiencia de 30 años en la venta de mariscos, actividad que la adquirió de su señor padre ya que desde la edad de 20 años lo llevaba a pescar. Le gusto mucho y decidió por sus propios medios una vez casado comenzar su negocio propio con el dinero que había ahorrado y una parte que le prestaron. Se compra un triciclo y comienza a recorrer las calles de su barrio en horario de 5 a.m. hasta las 11 de la mañana donde termina de vender todo el producto.

Reimundo desea el crédito para poder invertir en otros productos de mar ya que actualmente solo vende pescado y por falta de capital no invierte en lo otro.

Reimundo tiene 59 años, 2 hijos los cuales estudian, su esposa también trabaja en quehaceres domésticos desde hace 7 años, desea con sus ingresos poder poner un negocio de los mismos en su domicilio.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy various types of seafood to sell

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy has 6 years of experience crafting tables, chairs, and chests of drawers. He learned the craft working for his uncle, who had a workshop. His uncle fell ill and mentioned to Jimmy the possibility of his taking over the business. Little by little he paid for the machines, and with the business’s two employees he succeeded in moving the business ahead and paying for his own studies. The workshop, located in his uncle’s house, functions from 7 am til 6 pm, Monday through Saturday, and Sunday when there is sufficient demand.

Jimmy wants the loan in order to buy raw materials such as wood and to craft orders he currently has in hand.

Jimmy is single and 25 years old. He currently lives with his aunt and uncle. He succeeded in graduating as an Auditor de Central de Gestion (management) and hopes to practice this profession when his business is stable. He needs the loan so that he can invest in and begin to generate earnings. In the future he hopes to be able to become independent from his family and have his workshop in his own home. He believes with his work he will achieve those goals.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Jimmy tiene una experiencia de 6 años en la elaboración de mesas, sillas, anaqueles, actividad que la adquirió de su tío que tenia un taller y trabajaba para el. Su tío se enfermo y le comenta a el la posibilidad de asumir las riendas del negocio. Poco a poco le fue pagando las maquinas del negocio y el ya sabiendo la actividad contrata 2 personas y con ellas a logrado sacar adelante el taller y pagarse también sus estudios. El taller funciona de 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. en el domicilio de su tío de lunes a sábado y cuando tiene demanda hasta los domingos. Jimmy desea el crédito para poder comprar materia prima como es la madera y elaborar pedidos que tiene al momento. Jimmy es soltero tiene 26 años y actualmente vive con sus tíos, el también estudiaba y logro graduarse de Auditor de Central de Gestión, titulo que espera comenzar a practicarlo una vez que el negocio este ya estable por lo que necesita el crédito para poder invertir y comenzar a generar ganancias. A futuro espera poder ya separarse de su familia y poder tener su taller en su domicilio y piensa que con su trabajo lo va ha lograr.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in raw material such as wood

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has 4 years of experience in book sales. Previously she worked selling clothes and accessories. With that work she was able to support her children on her own: she separated from her husband 16 years ago. She began selling books on her own initiative and with the encouragement of her daughter. She works from Monday to Friday, 9 am to 1 pm and 3 pm to 5 pm en her home, where libraries and schools come to pick up the books they need.

Maria wants the loan in order to invest it in the business, since the school year starts in 2 months and she wants to have the products already bought, to ensure delivery and provide better service to her clients.

Maria is 55 years old. She has 3 children, 2 of whom live with her and help her in the business. She hopes to be able to expand her business with another line of books she is unable to buy at the moment, for lack of capital.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria tiene una experiencia de 4 años en la venta de libros. Anterior a esto ella se dedicaba a vender ropa y bisutería con el que logro mantener a sus hijos ella sola ya que es separada de su esposo hace 16 años. Comenzaron con la venta de libro por iniciativa propia y de una hija la que le motivo a vender dicho producto. Esta labor la viene realizando de lunes a viernes en horario de 9 a.m. a 1 p.m. y de 3 a 5 p.m. en su domicilio donde recogen los pedidos de los libros que necesitan las librerías o las escuelas. Maria desea el crédito para invertir en el negocio ya que de aquí a 2 meses comienza la temporada escolar y ella desea tener el producto ya comprado y no demorarse en las entregas y con ello darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Maria tiene 55 años, tiene tres hijas dos de las cuales viven con ella y son las que le ayudan en el negocio. Espera poder también surtir su negocio con otra clase de libros que al momento no cuenta para la venta por falta de capital.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in books in material to sell before the upcoming school year

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos has 5 years of experience in his store. Previously he worked selling vegetables at outdoor fairs but he had to stop because of problems with the city. Later he and his wife decided to start a food sales business. On his own initiative he decided to sell the chairs and tables that he had to raise financing, and began to buy stock for his food store. At the moment he rents space close to his home, He works every day of the week from 7 am to 10 pm.

Carlos wants the loan in order to be able to expand his business with products he doesn’t currently offer. He is confident that with this investment he will successfully increase his earnings.

Carlos is 63 years old. He is married and has an adult son who helps him with what he needs. His son lives with Carlos and his wife. In the future he hopes to improve his house and to be able to fix up a place in his home for his business, to save what his is spending on rent.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos tiene una experiencia de 5 años con el negocio de la tienda. Anterior a esta el se dedicaba a la venta de legumbres en las ferias libres pero por el municipio que los molestaba tuvo que dejar esa actividad. Luego de esto decide junto a su esposa poner un negocio de venta de comida. Por su iniciativa decide vender las sillas y mesas que tenia y logra financiarse para poder comenzar a comprar víveres para su tienda. Al momento arrienda el local cerca de su domicilio, la trabaja todos los días de la semana en el horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. Carlos desea el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con productos que no tiene y esta seguro que con dicha inversión lograra tener más ganancias. Carlos tiene 63 años, es casado y tiene un hijo el cual ya es adulto y le ayuda en lo que necesitan, su hijo ya tiene compromiso y vive con ellos. A futuro espera mejorar su domicilio y poder adecuar un lugar en el para poner su negocio y no estar pagando arriendo por el mismo.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices

loans.name: Deyse

texts.en:
Deyse has a small seamstress’s workshop in her home. She began the business because she learned this vocation when she left school to work for her parents in their workshop. In the beginning she only did sewing for family and friends. Now she continues to offer this service and makes shirts and uniforms to deliver to the shops and commercial centers of area where she lives.

She would invest the loan in an industrial sewing machine, as a way to improve the quality of her products. She has all the confidence that her business will grow and she will be able to continue reinvesting in it.

Deyse is the mother of 4 children. She is married and 40 years old. She depends on her business to support her family. She has hope that this loan will give her financial security and will allow her to save for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Deyse tiene en su vivienda su pequeño taller de costura. Deyse empezó el negocio porque ella aprendió este oficio cuando dejo de estudiar y sus padres la emplearon en un taller de costura. Al principio solo recibía costuras de sus amigos y familiares. Ahora ella continúa ofreciendo este servicio y confecciona camisas y uniformes para entregar en los almacenes y locales de la bahía. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en una maquina industrial y así poder perfeccionar mejor su mercadería. Ella tiene toda la seguridad que su negocio crecerá y podrá seguir haciendo inversiones. Deyse es Madre de cuatro hijos, casada tiene 40 años. Ella depende de su negocio para apoyar a su familia. Ella tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera y puede permitirle ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Lenny

texts.en:
Lenny sells sheets, comforters, curtains and plastic items. He started his business with the help of his sister who loaned him 100 dollars he initially invested. He began selling sheets door to door. Now he continues to offer sheets, along with towels and other items for the home.

Lenny would use the loan to invest in buying stock wholesale, which would yield better earnings. He has the aspiration to improve his business in order to save and enjoy a better quality of life. He has faith that with this new investment his business will move forward. Lenny is 32 years old and married, with 2 children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Lenny tiene venta de sabanas, edredones, toldos y articulos plásticos. Lenny empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su hermana quien le facilito la cantidad de 100 dólares para su inversión. Se inicio vendiendo solo sabanas puerta a puerta. Ahora el continua ofreciendo estos productos junto con toallas y demás articulos para el hogar. Lenny usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias. El tiene la aspiración de que su negocio mejorara para ahorrar y tener mejor calidad de vida. El tiene la fe que con estos nuevos ingresos su negocio saldrá adelante. Lenny es Padre de dos hijo, esta unido, tiene 32 años.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy products at wholesale quantities

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys has a small store where she sells convenience products. She started her business with her husband’s help; he gave her 200 dollars to set herself up in business with the store. In the beginning she only sold vegetables and staples; now she also sells sausages and canned goods.

Gladys would use the loan to buy rice and canned goods wholesale in order to earn more profit.

She has every confidence that with these new products her business will grow. Gladys is the mother of 2 children and married her husband 20 years ago. She is 47 years old. Gladys is convinced that with this loan she will improve her family’s economic situation.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Gladys tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Gladys empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien le dio 200 dólares para que emprendiera en la tienda. Al principio ella solo vendía víveres y legumbres, ahora vende embutidos y enlatados. Gladys usara el préstamo para comprar arroz al por mayor y enlatados para así obtener mejores ingresos. Ella tiene la plena seguridad que con estos nuevos productos su negocio va ha tener un crecimiento. Gladys es madre de dos hijos, unida con su esposo hace 20 años. Ella tiene 47 años. Gladys esta convencida que con este préstamo mejorara el nivel económico de su familia.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy rice and canned products

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor has a tailor shop in his home, where he makes suits and pants. He started out with the help of his father who taught him the business and later left him the business so that he would continue working. In the beginning he only did alterations. He continues to offer that service but now also offers women’s and men’s clothing and suit rental.

Victor aspires to sell all types of clothing. He would use the loan to buy cloth wholesale. He has confidence that with a wider selection of types of cloth his business will grow.

Victor is the father of a daughter. He is 52 years old and separated. His business is the only source of income in the household. Victor has hope that his loan will give him financial security.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran. Kiva volunteer.

Víctor tiene una sastrería en su casa dedicándose a la confección de ternos y pantalones. Víctor empezó con la ayuda de su padre quien le enseño y le dejo el negocio para que siguiera trabajando. Al principio el solo hacia arreglos y recibía costuras. Ahora el continúa ofreciendo este servicio junto con ropa de damas y caballeros y alquiler de ternos. Víctor aspira vender todo tipo de ropa. El usara el préstamo para invertir comprando telas al por mayor. El tiene la seguridad de que con estas nuevas variedades de telas su negocio crecerá. Víctor es padre de una hija. El tiene 52 años, separado, su negocio es la única fuente de ingreso en el hogar. Víctor tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy cloths and materials from wholesalers

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy works in the production and sale of fertilizers and insecticides. Jimmy started his business learning in a friend’s laboratory. In the beginning he only produced the product and sold it door to door. Now he offers his products to pharmacies and to pest control for businesses.

Jimmy aspires to have his own laboratory and give work to whoever may need it. He would use the loan to buy fertilizers at wholesale prices. He has faith that with these products his sales will increase.

Jimmy is married. He has 4 children, all of whom are currently in school. He is 39 years old. Through his business he supports himself and his family. His dream is to build his own house and improve his children’s quality of life and grow and thrive in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Jimmy se dedica a la elaboración y venta de fertilizantes e insecticidas. Jimmy empezó su negocio aprendiendo en un laboratorio de un amigo. Al principio el solo elaboraba el producto y lo vendía puerta a puerta. Ahora ofrece estos productos a farmacias, y a la fumigación de empresas. Jimmy aspira tener su propio laboratorio y dar trabajo a quienes lo necesiten. El usara el préstamo para invertir comprando fertilizantes a precios de mayorista. El tiene la fe que con estos productos su negocio se incrementara. Jimmy esta casado, tiene cuatro hijos todos estudian. El tiene 39 años. El por medio de su negocio apoya a su a su familia. Y su deseo es construir su vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y crecer y mantenerse en el negocio.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer from a wholesale distributor

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is involved in dry season agricultural production. He cultivates pineaples, pepper, garden eggs and onions. He serves a very big population of students and workers in his village. He has been trained by staff of Kraban in the TEACH lending model. He needs a loan of $1000 to purchace a water pump.

loans.use: Water Pumping Machine

loans.name: Vodu

texts.en: An ardent livestock keeper, Vodu K. raises ducks and chickens for sale. She sells them for a livelihood as well as using some for domestic consumption. This has improved the nutritional status of her family especially the granchildren who live with her. She has also been trained in the skills lending method called TEACH. The strategy being used by Kraban Support Foundation to reduce poverty in the communities we operate in Ghana.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes has been selling ceviches door to door for a year. She decided to found this small business because she could do it at home, with her children’s involvement. With 50 dollars she had saved from her previous job she bought the ingredients and some utensils. She works in the business Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 4 am to 9 am. Her children help her, one by cooking, the other by delivering and a third takes the orders. She works entirely in cash.

She needs this loan to buy pots and plastic containers in which to deliver the orders, and a pair of tables to place in her house.

Mercedes is 46 years old, a single mother with 3 sons. For 10 years she has been solely responsible for her children because her husband abandoned her. Since she was 10 years old she has worked as a nanny, a cook and a housecleaner. She currently works Monday through Friday mornings cooking in her home, which is her other source of income. Her aspiration is to improve her house, which is completely of cane, with a dirt floor. Her greatest satisfaction is seeing her children in school and knowing that they will soon finish their studies. She does not know how to read or write. She wishes to continue with her business because she sees that it has generated additional income and most importantly because her children help her.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes tiene 1 año vendiendo ceviches a domicilio. Ella decidió poner este pequeño negocio porque lo podía hace en casa y que sus hijos se involucren. Con un pequeño capital de $ 50 dólares que había ahorrado de su trabajo arranco para comprar los alimentos y ciertos utensilios. El negocio lo atiende los días viernes, sábado y domingo solo por la mañana de 4:00AM hasta 9:00AM. Sus hijos la ayudan uno cocina, otro entrega y otro va ha tomar los pedidos de los ceviches. Todo es al contado. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar: ollas y plásticos (tarrinas) para poder entregar los pedidos y comprar un par de mesas y ubicarlas en su casa. Mercedes tiene 46 años. Con 3 hijos. Es madre soltera. Desde hace 10 años ha estado a cargo de sus hijos porque su esposo la abandono. Desde los 10 años ella ha trabajado de: niñera, cocinando, limpiando casa, Actualmente trabaja de lunes a viernes por la mañana cocinando en casa estos son otros ingresos para ella. Su aspiración es mejorar su casa que es de caña totalmente que no tiene piso y vive sobre la tierra. Su satisfacción más grande es ver que sus hijos están en el colegio y que pronto van a terminar sus estudios. Ella no sabe leer ni escribir Ella desea seguir con su negocio porque ve que ha generado otros ingresos y lo más importante es que sus 3 hijos la ayuda.

loans.use: Buy pots, plastic containers and tables.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has 8 months of experience selling encebollado (a sauteed onion dish with spices) and snacks in the small shop that her husband fixed up in their house. She has always worked and has a lot of experience cooking and washing clothes, which she started doing from the age of 10. She started the business thanks to the encouragement of her husband, who lent her the money. She works from 6 am to 10 pm Her shop is located in a heavily trafficked area. Thanks to their efforts in the business, Maria and her husband were able to buy their home.

She needs the loan to buy her raw materials (rice, oil, vegetables) in bulk as well as 2 plastic tables with chairs.

Maria was born in the city of Esmerelda. She is 43 years old. Her husband works and always supports her. At the age of 5, Maria came to live in Quito and later in Guayaquil. From the time she was an infant her mother sent her to work in houses so that she would be working and earning income. When she married, she continued to work at home: mending, washing and caring for children. She has always been a pillar of strength in her home. They are a humble, hardworking, determined family and always are ready to support themselves for the well being of the family. They have their own cement home. Now the most important thing is that Maria keeps her own restaurant so she can generate her income. She stopped working doing domestic work 9 months ago when her father died.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria tiene una experiencia de 8 meses vendiendo encebollado y merienda en su pequeño local que su esposo le acondicionó en su casa. Ella siempre ha estado trabajando y tiene mucha experiencia en cocinar y lavar ropa desde los 10 años. El negocio lo puso gracias a la motivación de su esposo, él le presto el dinero. Ella atiende de 6:00AM hasta 10:PM. Su local esta ubicado en un lugar donde circula mucha gente. Gracias a los esfuerzos de ambos con sus ingresos han podido obtener su casa. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar en ciertas cantidades su materia prima: arroz, aceite, legumbres y adicional 2 mesas plásticas con sus sillas respectivas. María nació en la ciudad de Esmeralda. Tiene 43 años, Tiene su esposo que trabaja y la apoya siempre. A la edad de cinco años Maria se vino a vivir a Quito y luego a Guayaquil, desde su infancia su madre la empleaba en casas para que trabaje y genere ingresos. Cuando se caso siguió trabajando en casa: arreglando, lavando, cuidando niños. Ella siempre ha sido un pilar fuerte para su hogar. Ellos son una familia humilde muy trabajadora y luchadora siempre están dispuesto ha apoyarse para el bienestar de la familia. Ellos tienen su casa propia de cemento actualmente. Ahora lo más importante es que Maria se mantenga en su comedor propio para que pueda generar sus ingresos. Ella dejo de trabajar en las casas desde hace 9 meses a raíz que murió su padre.

loans.use: Buy raw materials: rice, sugar, beans and tables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy thread for weaving and accessories

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
Argentina has been selling clothes and shoes for a year and a half. She does it with her daughter, who helps her. She works Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. She lets her clients buy on credit and carries an account register. Each week she collects payments from her clients. The other days of the week she is a domestic assistant in 3 houses, which is her other source of income. She was able to save and buy the inventory for her small business. Her earnings allowed her to buy her house and add a foundation. Previously it was located over the water.

She needs the loan because she wants to buy inventory for the beach season. With her earnings she hopes to increase her capital and make some repairs to her home.

Argentina was born in Santa Lucia – Guayas. She is 49 years old. She has 3 children, one of whom is now independent. She does not have a husband because he abandoned her 15 years ago. Argentina has confronted the full responsibility for the household alone. She had to work with her mother from the time she was very young and now she must continue to work, for her children. Her aspiration is that her business grows and she is able to work full time in clothing sales, because the earnings are better.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Argentina lleva vendiendo ropa y zapatos desde hace 1 año y medio. Ella lo hace junto a su hija que la ayuda. Se dedica a trabajar los días viernes sábado y domingo. Ella deja a crédito la ropa y lleva un registro. Cada semana cobra a sus clientes. Además los otros días es asistente domestica en 3 casas donde percibe sus otros ingresos. Ella pudo ahorrar y comprar su mercadería para su pequeño negocio. Con sus ingresos generados le ha permitido tener su casa y hacerle el relleno porque antes estaba sobre el agua. Ella necesita el préstamo porque desea comprar mercadería de temporada playera. Con estos ingresos espera incrementar su capital y hacer unos arreglos para su casa. Argentina nació en Santa Lucia –Guayas. Tiene 49 años. Tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos es independiente ya. No tiene esposo porque la abandono hace 15 años. Argentina sola ha tenido que enfrentar todo la responsabilidad de su hogar. Desde pequeña tuvo que trabajar con su madre y ahora también debe hacerlo por sus 2 hijos. Su aspiración es que su negocio crezca y dedicarse todo el tiempo a la venta de ropa porque los ingresos son mejores.

loans.use: Buy beach clothing to sell

loans.name: Cratis

texts.en:
Cratis has been selling soft drinks in her neigborhood for 5 years. She recently began to sell beer, as well. With a small loan that she took out 5 years ago she was able to take out her refrigerator and sell her soft drinks. She also sell school supplies since there is a school closeby.

She tends to the business from 3 pm to 11 pm every day. She has additional income because she is raising 3 of her sister’s children; her sister has been in Spain for 5 years. Thanks to her earnings she has been able to make improvements to her house, which is made of cane.

She wants the loan to buy cases of cola and beer; she also wants to buy school supplies and continue selling those.

Cratis was born in Esmerelda. She is 43 years old with 4 sons, all of whom still depend on her. Her husband abandoned her 15 years ago. She is a woman who since she left her hometown at the age of 14 began to work in houses. To this day she has not stopped working; she has fought so that her children would eat every day. She is proud of having been able to buy her own house, which took an enormous effort. Her aspiration is that her business grows and her 15 year old niece joins her in the business, since she is a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Cratis lleva 5 años vendiendo colas en su sector. Últimamente comenzó a vender cervezas también. Con un pequeño crédito que saco hace 5 años pudo sacar su nevera y vender sus colas. Ella también vende útiles escolares ya que una escuela esta en la esquina de su casa. El negocio lo atiende a partir de las 3:00 PM hasta 11:00 PM todos los días. Ella tiene otros ingresos porque esta criando 3 sobrinos porque su hermana esta en España desde hace 5 años. Gracias a los ingresos generados ella ha podido hacer mejoras en la casa que es de caña. Ella desea el préstamo para comprar jabas de colas y cervezas, también desea comprar útiles escolares y seguir vendiendo. Cratis nació en Esmeralda. Tiene 43 años. Con 4 hijos, y todavía están a su cargo. Su esposo la abandono desde hace 15 años. Ella es una mujer que desde que salió de su tierra a la edad de 14 años comenzó a trabajar en casa. Hasta ahora no dejado de hacerlo, ha luchado para que sus hijos puedan tener el sustento diario. Se siente orgullosa de haber podido tener su casa que le ha costado con mucho esfuerzo. Su aspiración es que su negocio crezca y que su sobrina de 15 años se involucre en el negocio ya que es madre soltera.

loans.use: Buy cases of soft drinks and school supplies

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza has been selling lunches in an area called Bahía for 10 years. Every day she delivers between 80 and 100 lunches. In her house she prepares the meals together with oneif her daughters, and with her other daughter she delivers them to her clients. Thanks to her business she was able to save and buy her house.

She needs the loan to buy plastic utensils (containers, silverware and spoons) to deliver the lunches and some pots with which to prepare the food.

Esperanza was born in Guayaquil. She is 48 years old. Her children are grown now; one of them is independent. She is a single mother; she always had to assume responsibility for her household. From the time she was very young she has known what it is to work. She worked alongside her mother and continued to work after getting married. Her satisfaction is that thanks to her business she has her house of cement and cane. Her children continue to study and they help her with the business. Her dream is to continue with the business because it is her only source of income.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Esperanza lleva 10 años vendiendo almuerzos en un sector llamado Bahía, todos los días entrega entre 80 a 100 almuerzos. En su casa los prepara junto a su hija y su otro hijo junto a ella entregan los almuerzos en los locales. Esperanza gracias al negocio pudo ahorrar y tener su casa. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar los utensilios plásticos (tarrinas, cubiertos y cucharas) para entregar y ciertas ollas para la preparación. Esperanza nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 48 años. Con 3 hijos ya grandes, uno de ellos ya es independiente. Ella es madre soltera siempre tuvo que vérsela sola en su hogar. Desde muy pequeña conoció lo que es trabajar junto a su madre y cuando se caso igualmente. Su satisfacción es que gracias a su negocio ella tiene su casa mixta (caña y cemento). Sus hijos siguen estudiando y le ayudan en el negocio. Su deseo es seguir con el trabajo porque es su única fuente de ingreso.

loans.use: Buy pots and plastic utensils and containers to prepare and deliver food

loans.name: Puna

texts.en: Puna is a thirty two year old unemployed woman, married with five children. Her husband like her is also unemployed, but doing fishing apart from his wife’s business for extra earning for their extended family. With their five children that they’re raising, they are also providing support for Puna’s father, brothers and sisters that are staying together with them. All of her relatives are working in her taro plantation (starchy rootcrop which serves as staple food in Samoa, like rice in Asia or potatoes in other countries) and helping out Puna with her business so that it will become their family business in the future. They’ve planted more than seven thousand taros, and will be harvesting one thousand taros every end of the month.

loans.use: Buy planting materials, organic fertilizers and  organic pesticides.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Faasiu

texts.en: Faasiu F. grew up in a family of six, both her parents were unemployed but they worked hard in developing their taro plantation (starchy rootcrop which serves as staple food in Samoa,  like rice in the Asia or potatoes in other countries). Her parents couldn’t afford to send their kids to school and so Faasiu never had to chance to attend school. She’s now 54 years old, also married with 5 children. From the taro plantation they had, Faasiu always encourage her husband to start up a cattle farm, which now belongs to her and her children only. This business helped out Faasiu so much in financing her 5 children’s schooling needs. Her daughter in now working for a travel agent company, but with her two sons, they have decided to help out their parents with the business, because they believe with their business, they will have a successful future.

loans.use: To expand her cattle farm by buying four (4) additional cattle to be fattened.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Apaula

texts.en: Mrs Apaula K. is a 53 year old lady, currently running a pancake business from her house. She’s a widow with 5 children, all four employed locally, and one living in Australia. With Apaula’s business, she started off from selling it at the market, where as she’s now moved back to her house and selling it there, due to more demand from a primary school near by that at the market place. She is now also baking mini pies in assorted flavors as well as toasted breads with fried eggs. As from experience she believes that starting from frying pancakes only, one day she’ll develop into a bakery shop, and it’s her dream to be fulfilled.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her bakeries

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Leutu

texts.en:
Leutu tells that when she heard about the SPBD loans, she thought of starting a business so she can join the SPBD Centre at Vailoa Tai. Leutu’s family have a store and it was run by the auntie. Towards the end of the year, the auntie decided to move to New Zealand and therefore Leutu and the husband looked after the shop. When she got the shop, she joined the Vailoa Tai Centre.

Leutu’s first loan was 750 tala (US$ 300), and she used it to buy more stock for her small shop. The amount was not enough for any further improvements. On her 2nd loan of 1,250 tala (US$ 500), she thought of extending the building, and she did so with the help of her husband who is a good carpenter. The business went well. With the extra profit she had in her purse, she thought of saving it.

After the second loan, Leutu was entitled to a 2,250 tala (US$ 900) loan, and thought of another business. She tried the pancakes but it didn’t work, so she saved the rest of the loan. She said that one day while she was in the shop, a car stopped by her shop and asked if there’s any nearby Laundromat in the area. That is when she got the idea of extending the building for the Laundromat. So she hurriedly paid up her loan, and ready for the next loan.

On Leutu’s 3rd loan that she saved, plus this 4th loan, she was able to buy 2 washing machines. With the profit from the shop plus her savings, she was able to buy two Dryers. “Two washing machines and two dryers are good enough to start up with,”  she said.

loans.use: Purchase of washing machines and dryers for a laundromat business

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Fonima

texts.en:
Fonima is a very shy widow but is one of the more active savers in the SPBD programme. She joined the Centre at Tulaele in 2005. Since the husband died in 2003, she started thinking about ways of surviving with her two children and a grandmother. She got in, and her first Loan was 300 tala (US$ 120). This loan was used for purchase of  stocks for her small shop. With the second loan of  500 tala (US$ 200), she also spent it on more stocks.

Fonima paid off her loan promptly and was therefore entitled to get  1,250 tala (US$ 500)  on her next loan. Fonima already  spent the other two loans on the stock, and with this loan she thought of renovating her small shop, so she used it to double wall the inside of the store. Fonima is excited that these loans enable her family to go on and live since her husband died.

At the end of last year, Fonima paid off her loan and got another loan amounting to 1,750 tala (US$ 700). This loan also was used to further improve her store. As we have seen in the photo taken, the store looks new and it’s just after the work done last week.

Apart from the Loans, on the other side, Fonima is one of the ladies that have a vision. This vision enables her to save the extra money. So she is done with the store but now she is looking of starting up the Elei Printing – a traditional Samoan way of printing fabrics using handcrafted stencils.

loans.use: To purchase 50 yards of fabric, assorted ink, stencils, and printing block to start an elei printing business.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region. He has been busy with the production of natural sausage casings. Every morning he collects animal bowels from butcher shops, then he uses these to manufacture his sausage casings at his workshop. After borrowing his first loan of $400 from Normicro he was able to supply his workshop with a water supply and a sewage system. His second loan of $800 was spent to increase his business.
Sahib currently applied for the loan of $1000 to expand his business area.

loans.use: To expand his business area

loans.name: Nijat

texts.en:
Nijat is n Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. He is 32 years old and has one child. He is a driver on public transport. He began his business 19 years ago and it has allowed him to support his family. In 2004 he borrowed $800 from Normicro to repair the motor of his car. His minibus is old and he plans to sell it and to buy a new minibus.
Nijat has applied for a loan amount of $1000 to buy a new minibus.

loans.use: To buy a new minibus

loans.name: Gubad

texts.en:
Gubad is cobbler. He has been engaged in this business for 17 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, but has relocated to Sumgait city. This 50-year-old man is a hard worker. He is married and has three children. He borrowed his first loan of $500 from Normicro to buy shoemaking supplies and other items needed in the production of the shoe leathers.

Gubad currently needs a loan amount for $800 to build his own shoe store.

loans.use: He plans to build the own shoe store

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Akbar was born in Gubadli region of Azerbaijan. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). He settled with his family and three children in Sumgait city. Difficulties in life forced them to start a business in order to provide for his family. He started by selling vegetables. By borrowing a loan of $300 he was able to buy a refrigerator and expanded his inventory to include a wide range of fruits. 

Akbar has applied for a loan of $500 so to cintinue to expand his inventory to include other agricultural products.

loans.use: He plans to sell agricultural products

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is married with two children. He lives in the Mbagala area, Temeke District of Dar es Salaam. He owns four outlets where he sells different kinds of bags, but mostly travelling bags. He has located his outlets near railway stations and bus terminals - places where most of his customers are. The businesses have a high turnover which means he frequently runs out of stock. Arnold is planning to add a larger stock of bags to do away with stockouts.

Arnold also owns a wholesale shop in Mbagala, selling mainly sugar, maize flour, beans, rice and other cereals. He has developed a healthy relationship with his customers. Most of his customers are retailers. They depend on his shop because they would otherwise have to travel to town, about 25 miles away, to buy the items. Arnold is planning to add other non-food items like plastic home materials and clothes.

The two businesses need a capital boost of USD 1100.

loans.use: Opening another outlet

loans.name: Mercis

texts.en:
Mercis is applying for her second loan with Kiva and Mifex. She is a 42 year-old single mother with 4 children, one of whom still lives in the household. When she took out her first loan, Mercis had a stand a where she sold fish to the public during the morning and early afternoon. Thanks to the extra profits from her first loan, she now also sells food in a market starting around 8 pm. She buys extra fish every morning for her stand and she prepares the food with whatever is leftover. Now that her business is growing, Mercis hopes to be able to invest in the necessary utensils and tables for the business. She hopes that she will eventually be able to own a restaurant with her hard work. Most of all though, Mercis wants to finish raising her last child and live with peace of mind.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fish for her stand and restaurant, as well as tables and chairs

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Don Pedro is a second time lender in the Kiva and Mifex program. He is the owner of a small store in Guayaquil where he sells rice, sugar, oil and other basic groceries. With his last loan he invested in more products and he was able to make some minor improvements to his store. He made all of the payments from his last loan on time and is now hoping he can take out a second. He plans on using the loan money to buy a display refrigerator where he can keep products cool and market at them at the same time. Don Pedro is 56 years and has 6 children, 3 of which still depend on him. He is a Colombian who has lived in Ecuador since he was 18.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.en:
Yessenia is a 25 year old seafood saleswoman and a single mother of 2. This is her second loan with Mifex and Kiva. With the first, she invested in various seafood items to sell instead of offering just fish. The loan also gave her the ability to expand into a new business. She has partnered up with a friend to work at a small restaurant. She runs the business in the morning while she pays someone to man her stand. She is very happy about the results of the loan because it gave her the flexibility to explore new business opportunities with a friend. With the extra profits she fixed her roof in time for the rainy season in Ecuador. With her next loan she will continue to invest in seafood products, both for her stand and the restaurant.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Continue to invest in fish for her stand

loans.name: Deria Xochitl

texts.en:
Xochitl is married and is mother of two little ones. She works at her grocery store business with her mother, who was the founder of the business. At the time she realized that supporting her children was of primary importance, especially after her husband emigrated to the US in search for a job. She decided to join forces with her Mom with the money she receives from her husband. She waits for the waits for the day that her husband will be able to come back home so that they can all be together again, and this will only happen when she has managed to have an established and successful business. This is why she works so hard day after day.
