She requires a loan of $475 that she plans to invest in the purchase of greater quantities of merchandise to expand her business. You can help Xochitl realize her dream of bringing her husband home. Don't hesitate, she needs you and appreciates your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Xochitl es casada y madre de dos pequeños, ella comienza el negocio de venta de abarrotes con su madre, quien es la iniciadora del proyecto, pues en aquel momento la necesidad de mantener y sacar adelante a sus hijos era indispensable, pues su esposo emigro a USA ante la falta de empleo. Es por ello que con el dinero que el le manda desde allá decidió asociarse con su madre. Ella sólo espera el momento en que su esposo pueda egresar para estar todos juntos de nuevo y esto sólo sucederá cundo ella pueda tener un negocio bien establecido y remunerado. Es por ello que trabaja muy duro día a día.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS, mismo que planea invertir en la comprar de mayores volúmenes de mercancía y de esta manera lograr hacer crecer su negocio. Tú puedes ayudar a Xochitl a cumplir el sueño de volver a estar junto con su esposo, no lo dudes más, ella te necesita y agradece tu generosidad.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Nafas Gul

texts.en:
Nafas Gul is 50 years old and lives with her 6 children in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Nafas Gul shares a business with her son, Fawad, who has a shop near the market selling fish.

Nafas Gul prepares sweet material and cleans the fish and then her son cooks them and sells them at the bazaar. Through this, the income of her family is growing.

They believe that through taking more another  loan through AFSG they can increase their business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Mobil

texts.en:
Mobil is 32, married, has a child, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in  Finnish houses, which are built temporary on front line in Fizuli region. 
This kind men has been breeding pedigreed sheep for over 8 years now. 
Having borrowed a loan of $600 he bought 4 pedigreed sheeps.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy sheeps  for expanding his  business.

loans.use: To buy sheeps to expand his business

loans.name: Ayshan

texts.en:
Ayshan is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village, settled in the Fizuli region.
Ayshan is 31, single, lives on front line . She has her own drugstore. 
She has been engaged in this business for 5 years.
This young girl believes that this business helps to provide a better living for her. 
Having borrowed a loan of $400 she bought vitamins, antibiotics, medicinal preparations.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to expand the area of her drugstore and to buy medicinal agents: creams, shampoos, soaps, cuds, tooth-pastes, tooth-brushes.

loans.use: To expand the area of her drugstore and to buy medicines

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en:
Allahverdi has been engaged in this business for 5 years. He has his own machine-shop.
He works with his brother. This young man is Allahverdi apprentice. 
He is single, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region Behmenli village, settled  on front line in Fizuli region Boyuk Behmenli village. 
Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought welding apparatus.
Now they needs a loan of $800 to buy equipmens for repairing cars.

loans.use: To buy equipmens

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar was born in 1956 in Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. She is married , has a child.
Gulzar supports her family by working as a cook. She likes international cousine but National dishes such as dolma, plov, khingal are her favourite ones.
You can see in the picture woman, who prepares our National dish khingal.
The first loan amount of $600 she spent to buy kitchen appliances 
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to  increase her incomes via diversifying the menu.

loans.use: To increase her incomes via diversifying the menu

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en: Joining the program in 2004 helped Elenoa contribute to the family earnings where as before being a part of the program her husband was the sole breadwinner who earned less than 100 tala (US$40) a week. A mother of five with four attending school in the village Elenoa’s first loan was $750 tala. This funding was used to purchase a fishing boat/alia including fishing equipment to start off the business. Soon after the business started her husband left his job to operate the fishing boat and now the business earns the family $360 (US$144) from selling an average of three strings per day for four days. Elenoa recently reapplied for her next loan which will help her purchase a new fishing net and partially renovate the family's house.

loans.use: To purchase a new fishing net for the family's fishing boat and to partially improve their house.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en: Fenumiai is one of many mothers who have improved her standard of living since joining SPBD. She joined in 2002 and started her business with a loan of  750 tala ($300US) and before joining the husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. Today Fenumiai has also cause to be a part of putting food on the table for her family. Through her grocery store she has been able to contribute widely to the development of the family. When Fenumiai first started her business she operated from in her home and after applying for a second loan she was able to move her business to the road front catering to more people. Her next loan will be used to buy timber and cement to improve the state of her store and house.

loans.use: Purchase of timber and cement to improve both the store and house.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Nafesa

texts.en:
Nafesa is 35 years old and lives with her 5 children in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Nafesa has a shared business with her son Aziz. It is an ice cream and burger shop located near the market.

Nafesa took a 2nd cycle loan for her son to increase his business. She cleans and peels the potatoes , onions , tomatoes, etc, and then her her son sells them in the bazaar.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, onions, burger meat and ghee

loans.name: Ezathullah

texts.en:
Ezatullah was born in 1981 and lives in a household of 4 in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Ezatullah, who has a 4 years' experience in this business, has a shop near his house selling ice creams and soft drinks. He took a 2nd cycle loan through AFSG to buy more materials for his shop. His family also helps him with his business by cleaning apples and bananas and picking up soft drink bottles. Then he sells them in the bazaar and with the process he makes more money.

loans.use: To buy apples, bananas and soft drinks

loans.name: Pashton

texts.en:
Pashton is 59 years old  and lives with her 7 children in district 1 of Kabul Afghanistan.

Pashton lost her husband in the war about 6 years ago. Now she is living with her oldest son who has a bicycle repair shop near the market.

Pashton is not an educated women; she faced lots of difficulties with getting a monthly income. Then she decided to take a loan through AFSG that her son can work with. Through this process they can find a good monthly income. Right now she is able to pay her children’s fee and her family is very happy.

loans.use: To buy bicycle parts

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: At any given time, most any Moldovan farmer knows the local market price for different types of livestock. A chicken is usually sold for about 35lei ($3), a piglet for 300lei ($20-25) a rabbit for 130lei ($10), etc. Farmers talk to each other and buyers often to stay informed about prices and base their business decisions on expected profitability. Similar to any market for goods around the world, Moldova’s animal and produce market sees price fluctuations at different times of the year. Eugenia C. is from the village of Pruteni and always knows the best time to sell her livestock at the market. At 37 years old, she has three main occupations. The first is taking care of the family farm, the second is managing the village’s salon (and also working as a hair stylist) and the third is directing the village’s local animal, fruit and vegetable market. She is able to have both jobs outside her house because the local market and the salon are next to one another and the market is only open for 2-4 days out of the week depending on the weather. Eugenia always notices the current prices of animals and knows the best time to sell her own. She would like a loan to purchase a couple piglets, and a calf to begin raising now and to sell when prices are good.

loans.use: Livestock Purchase

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa Dobinada is 35 years old and spends much of her time taking care of her children (three boys and one girl) and all the animals which make up her family farm. Her husband works long days at the village Mayor’s Office and has no time to take care of the animals. Larisa lives on the edge of town and the closest well is downhill from her property, which makes it extremely difficult to bring water for her family and her livestock. Behind her house are her animals and their pens - pigs and piglets, 2 cows for milk production, countless chickens and 2 sheep. All these animals require a tremendous amount of water per day and bringing that water up the hill occupies a good portion of Larisa’s day. In order to be better able to sustain her livestock and possibly increase the number of animals she keeps, Larisa would like a loan to obtain the materials necessary for construction of a well on her property. She knows it will help her animals to have a steadier supply of fresh water and she would also like to purchase some animal feed. Her goal is to have a more manageable homestead with healthy and happy animals!

loans.use: Construction of a well and purchase of animal feed

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif has been working as a druggist for 10 years. He has his own drugstore. He sees this business as his future. He has many customers who come to buy medicines at his drugstore.
He was born in 1961 in Fizuli region Garakhanbeyli village.
Arif is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region Garakhanbeyli village, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporary  on front line in Fizuli region. Being busy with this business he supports his family. 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan amount of $400 and extensive repaired his drugstore.
For he second time he borrowed a loan amount of $600 and bought medicinal preparations.
Now he needs a loan amount of $1200 to expand the area of his drugstore and to buy the medicinal preparations

loans.use: To expand the area of his drugstore and to buy medicines

loans.name: Najiba

texts.en:
Najiba has been engaged in food distribution for the past six years. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region, relocated to Sumgait city. She is 53 years old and has three children. She currently has her own mini store. Najiba is the only sole breadwinner for her family. She borrowed a loan for $200 from Normicro so she could rent a small grocery store. The second loan she borrowed of $500 was spent to purchase foodstuffs like sugar, tea, rice, etc. 
Now Najiba wants a loan for $600 to increase her inventory of goods and to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods and to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
This 35-year-old woman has looked after the cattles for 6 years.  She is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporary  on front line in Fizuli region, married, has 3 children. 
One day she decided to borrow a loan amount of $600 to buy fodder. 
Now she applies for a loan of $1200 to buy 3 calves.

loans.use: To buy 3 calves

loans.name: Sadig

texts.en:
Sadig was born in 1979 in the Lachin region of Azerbaijan. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). After completing his military service, he he was unable to continue with his education and instead began to support his family who had recently experienced some hard times. Three years ago, Sadig rented a very small shop where he adjusts automobile signal systems and sells automobile accessories. He unfortanately does not have enough funds to develop his business. In 2005 he borrowed $500 from Normicro to buy automatic control equipment, electric drills and other misc equipment. 
He currently has applied for a loan $800 to buy  car radio cassette players and inductive-code signaling devices for cars.

loans.use: To buy nine auto radio cassette players and six inductive-code signaling devices for cars

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir is a hard-working person. He has been running as a hairdresser for 15 years. He made all efforts to improve his business. His hairdressing saloon attracts a lot of cliens.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought a clipper, perfume, soaps.
Now he requests a loan of $800 to do capital repaires in his own hairdressing saloon.
Mahir is 43, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region Yaglikend village, settled on front line in Fizuli region, married, has 2 children.

loans.use: To do capital repaires in his own Barber shop

loans.name: Afruz

texts.en:
Afruz was born in 1968. She is single, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled  on front line in Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. 
She has sold  clothes for 7 years.
Having borrowed a loan of $400 she bought clothes for children.
The second loan  of $600 she spent to buy clothes for children and women.
Now she applies for a loan of $1000 to repair her shop.

loans.use: To repair her shop

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario has 8 years of experience in cosmetic sales. On her own iniciative she decided to work so she would be able to help her household while her husband was out of work. She works every day from 2 pm to 5:30 pm; in the morning she does her chores around the house.

Rosario wants the loan so that she can invest part of it in her business. She also wants to give some capital to her husband so that he returns to his work crafting suitcases. He has the machines he needs for his work but had to leave it because he lacked capital.

Rosario is 29 years old. She is married with 2 sons, one of whom is in school. Her husband is currently working for a longshoreman business and hopes with the loan to be able to manage his own business. They have been renting their home for 9 years and hope to be able to save so they can buy themselves a plot of land and build their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Rosario tiene una experiencia de 8 años en el comercio y la venta de cosmeticos. Por iniciativa propia decidió ponerse a trabajar para poder ayudar al hogar ya que su esposo se quedo sin trabajo. Su negocio lo hace todos los días de la semana en horario de la tarde de 2 p.m. hasta las 5:30 ya que por la mañana deja hecho los quehaceres del hogar.

Rosario desea el crédito para una parte poder invertir en el negocio. También quiere darle un capital a su esposo para que vuelva a trabajar en la elaboración de maletas que es su profesión. Inclusive el ya tienen las maquinarias pero tuvo que dejar de elaborar por falta de capital.

Rosario tiene 29 años, es casada con 2 hijos uno de los cuales ya estudia. Actualmente su esposo esta trabajando en una empresa de estibador y espera con el crédito poder ya manejar su negocio propio. Ellos viven alquilando por 9 años y esperan poder ahorrar para comprarse un solar y comenzar a construir su casita.

loans.use: Invest in her own business and help her husband restart his

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila has temporarily settled with her family in a hostel in Sumgait city. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Agdam. She is 47 years olad and has three children. She borrowed a loan of $500 from Normicro to purchase a sewing-machine. She has been working as a seamstress out of her own home for the past 12 years. After buying the sewing machine she thought it was the time to start her own business, but she lacked the start-up capital. Her second loan of $800 was spent on the purchase of another machine for the production of genuine leather jackets and genuine leather clothes for women. She has a lot of clients and has found that working at home is no longer suitable. 
Nazila needs a loan of $1500 to open her own tailor shop.

loans.use: To open her own tailor shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HIS FARMING

loans.name: Veselin

texts.en: Veselin V. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Loznitza, near Razgrad. He is married and has a kid. Veselin has his business for more than 10 years. He keeps a small shop for building materials. His shop is one of the oldest and most popular in the town and Veselin has a reputation of a correct trader. Veseiln V. needs this $ 1200 loan for working capital - to enlarge the range of building materials that he is offering.

loans.use: For building materials

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed M. is 36 years old, single and lives in Razgrad. He works as an official in the local municipality in Razgrad. His field is social work wit ethnic minority groups. But four years ago with the support of his family Ahmed starts his parallel agricultural business. He grows 100 decares with tobacco. His family has own farm buildings and storehouses for keeping production. Ahmed M. needs this $ 1200 loan to supply some fuel.

loans.use: To supply some fuel

loans.name: Sevdalin

texts.en: Sevdalin S. is 35 years old. He is single. For 3 years Sevdalin breeds 9 cows in a cowshed that is situated in his house yard. Each day he gets 90 liters milk of them. Milk is being sold to a milk company in the town. And now Sevdalin S. needs some financial help. The loan amount is $ 1200 and the purpose is to supply fodder for his cows.

loans.use: To supply fodder for his cows

loans.name: Esin

texts.en: Esin J. is 56 years old and together with her daughter keep an industrial goods store which is right to the cooperative market of the town. They both keep this store since 1996 and are well famous in their business.  They started their business because both were unemployed but the business had its development and now this store is the only source of income for both women and their families. Now Esin J. and her daughter need $ 1200 for working capital.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan N. runs hid business since 1998. Then he rents a hall in the village of Gabrovitza buys some machines and founds a carpentry business. He produces parquet floor and wooden fatnesses for internal and external paneling. His main markets are in the towns of Karlovo, Dulovo and Ihtiman. In 2004 he rents another hall in the town of Kostenetz and enlarges his business. Now his business is going very well and Ivan has contracts with some of the best developed companies in the region. Ivan N. needs $ 1 200 to supply extra wooden material for his business.

loans.use: To supply extra wooden material

loans.name: Ivanka

texts.en: Ivanka T. is 36 years old. She is married with two children. Ivanka has own retail business since 1999. She keeps three shops in the town of Ihtiman and sells fruits and vegetables, foodstuffs, sportswear and industrial goods. Ihtiman is a small town and there are no many shops in it so these three shops are so popular in the town and have lots of customers. Ivanka T. needs a $ 1200 loan which she will use for working capital.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Zoia

texts.en: Zoia G. is 46 years old. She is a lonely mother of two sons and she is taking care of her family and her business alone. Zoia has her business since 2003. Then she rents a hall in the city center and makes it a tailoring workshop. At the beginning she works only for private customers but later she accepts offers by some new built hotels in Sofia and the region. She mainly produces curtains, slip covers, household linen. In March 2006 Zoia has a critic moment in her business. She starts business cooperation with a man who finally cheats her and steels most of her machines but she manages to go through it and now works alone again. Now Zoia has two workshops and has three employees. She needs this $ 1200 loan to buy two more sewing machines to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy two more sewing machines

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is divorced with a teenage son. After her husband left the family, Ludmila was forced to find ways to provide for her family. She did some market research and decided to take a risk and borrow some money to start a business selling warm clothing. She rented a large shipping container at the local city market and purchased coats, jackets and other winter clothing to offer for sale. Ludmila has now been in business for 8 years, working hard to meet the needs of her customers. At her kiosk patrons always feel welcome as she gives each one her full attention and serves them politely and with respect. Her reasonable pricing and variety of inventory appeal to many modest clients. Ludmila has promptly repaid all 8 loans she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”. She understands the value of lending services that have helped her business grow and become self-sustainable. Ludmila is requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase her retail inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of weatherproof, insulated jackets, parkas, and vests as well as jean outfits that will be both durable and practical for a variety of customers. Having an assortment of inventory at exceptional prices will meet customer demand and draw many potential new clients to her business. In the future Ludmila would like to purchase another container and hire a person to help her with sales allowing her to generate additional profits to help finance her son’s education.

Людмила – одружена, в неї є син-підліток. Після того, як чоловік покинув родину, Людмила була змушена сама шукати можливостей забезпечити родину. Вона дослідила ринок, вирішила ризикнути та позичила грошей для того, щоб почати власний бізнес з продажу теплого одягу. Людмила орендувала велику крамницю-контейнер на міському ринку, купила пальта, куртки та інший теплий зимовий одяг для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Людмила займається цим бізнесом вже 8 років. Вона наполегливо працює для того, щоб задовольнити потреби її покупців. В її кіоску кожен клієнт завжди почувається комфортно, тому що Людмила вміє ввічливо та привітно обслужити кожного покупця. Помірні ціни та розмаїття товару приваблюють багатьох клієнтів. Людмила своєчасно сплатила 8 позик від „Надії України”. Вона розуміє цінність кредитних послуг, які сприяли зростанню та процвітанню її бізнесу. Людмила просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб збільшити обсяги товару для роздрібної торгівлі. Вона планує купити різноманітні теплі куртки, плащі, пальта, а також якісний та практичний джинсовий одяг, який сподобається багатьом покупцям. Широкий асортимент товарів за помірними цінами задовольнить попит покупців, а також привабить багатьох нових клієнтів. В майбутньому Людмила планує придбати ще одну крамницю-контейнер, а також взяти на роботу ще одну людину для торгівлі на ринку. Це допоможе Людмилі отримати додатковий прибуток, а також сплатити за навчання її сина.

loans.use: To increase clothing inventory

loans.name: Klavdiya

texts.en:
Klavdiya L. runs a small market business selling cosmetics and household chemical products. She is married with two children. After attending college she worked as a design engineer, but was unable to earn a stable salary. Seeking another source of income, Klavdiya decided to start her own small business. When Klavdiya first rented a kiosk at the central city market there were very few other entrepreneurs selling these types of products. She recognized an opportunity and decided to fill the market niche. Klavdiya is very client-friendly and sociable. She’s been in this business for 12 years and can easily guess the preferences of her customers which helps build customer loyalty. Many times Klavdiya has been able to fill special orders for her customers. Her business has done well through the years. Presently, Klavdiya has around $1,500 of working capital. Her integrity and responsibility have helped her keep her business stable allowing her pay back all of the loans she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Klavdiya is requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase her inventory and purchase modern brands of cosmetics. She is planning to purchase moisturizers, hair sprays, toners, body lotions, shower gels and a variety of other premium cosmetics to appeal to the tastes of new clients. A good array of beauty-oriented products will help Klavdiya better serve the needs of her clients, making their body and hair care experience more enjoyable and pleasant. Expanding her selection of beauty products will promote further growth in Klavdiya’s business and will help her support her children and family which she believes is her first priority as a mother.

Клавдія власниця бізнесу з продажу косметики та побутової хімії. Вона одружена, в неї двоє дітей. Після університету вона працювала за професією інженера-проектувальника, але зарплатню отримувала нестабільно. Отже, в пошуках іншого джерела прибутку, Клавдія вирішила відкрити власну справу. Коли вона орендувала свій перший кіоск на центральному міському ринку, в неї було небагато конкурентів. Клавдія вирішила скористатися цим та обрала цю нішу на ринку. Клавдія – дуже привітна з клієнтами та дуже комунікабельна. Вона вже 12 років займається цим бізнесом. За цей час Клавдія навчилася передбачати смаки покупців, що, в свою чергу допомогло їй зберегти своїх відданих клієнтів. Часто Клавдія отримує особливі замовлення від покупців. На протязі багатьох років її бізнес залишається дуже успішним. Зараз її робочий капітал складає приблизно 1500 доларів. Чесність та порядність допомогли Клавдії забезпечити стабільне зростання бізнесу, а також своєчасно сплатити усі позики, які вона отримала в „Надії України”. Клавдія просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент товарів та закупити косметику модних фірм-виробників. Вона планує купити зволожувальні та тонізуючі засоби, лак для волосся, лосьйони для тіла, гелі для душу та інші види високоякісної косметики, яка користуватиметься попитом серед покупців. Широкий асортимент косметичних засобів допоможе Клавдії задовольнити потреби її клієнтів, зробивши процес догляду за шкірою та волоссям набагато приємнішим. Збільшення асортименту сприятиме подальшому зростанню бізнесу Клавдії, а це, в свою чергу, допоможе їй й надалі підтримувати свою родину, яку вона, як мати, цінує перш за все.

loans.use: To increase cosmetics inventory

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Recently married without children Christina’s husband doesn’t work. They live with her husband’s extended family, a normal practice in Samoa. Christina believes in independence and wanted to set up a business to provide a good future for her husband and her self. With no children she wanted to start saving and building a good stable home before children arrive into the picture. So she joined the programme in 2003. Her first loan was used to start a small grocery store, which was operated from at home. The only grocery shop in her neighborhood Christina was able to use the following loans to build a permanent place for the shop in front of their home. Being the sole breadwinner of the family, she carefully budgets her earnings to sustain her family needs and set aside some cash for savings and loan payment. It is quite difficult for her to support an extended family but expanding her grocery will help ease her burden. Christina hopes to use her loan to improve her small grocery store and purchase more stocks.

loans.use: To improve existing grocery store and purchase additional stocks

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Isa

texts.en: A mother of five she joined SPBD in 2004 to get financial support to help her husband earn enough to improve their standard of living. Isa’s particular reason for joining was to get funding to help put her skills to good use earning money that could pay for her children’s school fees. Isa is a talented mother who loves gardening and produces Samoan oil made by Mosooi blossoms and coconut. Although Isa’s education is limited to basic studies in the secondary level she believes that education for her children is the one greatest opportunity that will broaden their horizons and also open doors that she never has. Her first loan funded for a vegetable garden. Her other loans helped her pay for her children’s school fees. She intends to expand the production of her Samoan oil so that her additional earnings can be used later on to fund a water system for her house. There is no existing water supply for her house.

loans.use: Purchase additional ingredients for Samoan oil (mossoi blossoms and coconut oil), bottles, labelling.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Malelega

texts.en: 24-year-old sole financial provider for her family Malelega is the only girl in a family of 6 six brothers. Since been a member of the South Pacific Business Development Program Malelega has helped fund for the development and running of the family plantation, which is the sole provider for the family’s livelihood. Malelega is at the market three times a week selling taro to earn money to pay back her loan with SPBD and also provide food and supplies to harvest the plantation. What she earns from selling the produce from their plantation is also enough to put aside for a rainy day. She earns 300 tala (US120) a week. Her loans have helped her improve the state of her family. She lives with her parents, brothers and their wives. She has applied for the next loan to purchase addtional planting materials for her taro plantation.

loans.use: To purchase addtional planting materials and organic fertilizers and pesticides

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: A mother of six Nancy lives in a house close to what many would call a shack. Four of her six children are in school. Because of her family’s poor standard of living Nancy wanted more four her children, family and herself but with a limited education background she didn’t know how to put her skills into good use. Nancy never made it to secondary level education. She first heard of SPBD in 2000 but thought it was not for her until she heard about the number of families whose lives have developed since being a part of the programme in 2003. In 2004 she joined using her baking and cooking skills to start a cake business with her sister Toeaso helping in the sales at one of the two local markets. With a new loan she hopes to purchase a new oven and additional ingredients for her cake business.

loans.use: To purchase a new oven and additional ingredients (flour, sugar, eggs, milk, yeast) for her cake business

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Astolfo

texts.en:
Astolfo has 18 years of experience in this business. He makes roofs for houses, sliding doors, folding screen room partitions, and windows. He learned this business when he worked in a factory. When the factory was liquidated, he bought some of the machinery and started his own workshop. For the past five years he has been running his own business, which is open from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM, depending on the urgency of the orders he is working on. He has two employees who help him. The business has been growing bit by bit and he has invested all of his earnings in heavy machinery.

He needs the loan to buy raw materials, such as iron. He would especially like to produce windows that he could showcase at his shop.

Astolfo was born in Simón Bolívar-Juian. He is 49 years old and is married. His wife works in the home. Astolfo is a hard-working and responsible person. Thanks to his hard work, he has his own house that is built of cement and he also is the owner of his place of business. He has been able to manage his finances very well. His hope is to maintain his business and that it will prosper so that he will be able to provide jobs to other people.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Astolfo tiene 18 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Él elabora: techos para casas, puertas corredizas, acordeones para casas, ventanas. Él aprendió esta actividad cuando trabaja en una fábrica. Cuando lo liquidaron compro unas máquinas y monto su propio taller. Desde hace 5 años esta con su propio negocio que lo atiende de 6:00 AM a 6:00PM todo depende de la urgencia de entrega. Tiene 2 empleados que le apoyan. Su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco, toda su ganancia las ha invertido en el negocio comprando sus maquinarias pesadas.

Él necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima que es el hierro y desea producir especialmente ventanas y exhibirlas en su local.

Astolfo nació en Simón Bolívar-Jujan. Tiene 49 años. Esta casado. Su esposa no trabaja pero le apoya en el hogar. Astolfo es una persona trabajadora, responsable en sus actividades. Gracias a su esfuerzo él tiene casa propia y actualmente es de cemento y además el local del negocio es propio. Él ha podido manejar muy bien sus finanzas. Su deseo es seguir con su negocio que siga prosperando y poder dar trabajo a otros.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, such as iron and solder.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny makes cleaning products such as chlorine, water softener, and disinfectants. She has been working for five years in this business. Fanny learned how to make these products from a friend. With her savings she began produce the products and her first client was the high school where she worked. Her clients are primary schools, high schools, and her neighbors. She makes her sales during the afternoon, with the help of her daughter. She also has other sources of income because she is an inspector at a high school. She also tutors children with learning difficulties at her home.

She needs the loan to buy the raw materials to produce her products in larger volumes: clorine, creosote, water softener, disinfectants, and acid.

Fanny was born in Manabí. She is 41 years old. She has two children. The older one is already working and her daughter helps her with the business. Her husband works as a driver for a business and on his days off he helps his wife deliver her products. They are a couple that is very willing to work hard to get ahead, and they are always learning something new. Thanks to their incomes, they have been able to improve their house and increase their business. Their aspiration is to grow their client base.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Fanny elabora productos de limpieza como: cloro, suavizante, desinfectante. Ella lleva 5 años en esta actividad. Fanny aprendió a través de una amiga que producía estos productos, ella trabajaba en un colegio. Con unos ahorros comenzó a elaborar los productos y su primer cliente fue el colegio donde ella trabajaba. Sus clientes son las escuelas, colegios y sus vecinos. Sus ventas las realiza en las tardes con su hija que la ayuda. Ella a su vez tiene otros ingresos porque es inspectora en un colegio. También en su casa nivela a los niños con problemas de aprendizaje en la escuela. Gracias a los ingresos ella ha podido incrementar el negocio y hacer mejoras en su casa.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar la materia prima y producir en mayor volumen los productos: cloro, creolina, suavizante, desinfectante, ácido.

Fanny nació en Manabí. Tiene 41 años. Tiene 2 hijos, el mayor ya trabaja y su hija le ayuda en el negocio. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa como chofer y en sus días de descanso le ayuda a su esposa a entregar el producto. Ellos son una pareja muy dispuesta a seguir adelante, siempre están a aprendiendo algo nuevo. Gracias a sus ingresos han podido mejorar su casa e incrementar su negocio. Su aspiración es incrementar sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and produce: chlorine, creosote, water softener, disinfectant, and acid.

loans.name: Inés

texts.en:
Inés sells kebabs of sausage and plantain, roasted beef, rice with vegetable soup, roasted chicken, buns, torillas, and sodas on the street corner next to her house. She has had this business for one year. Her husband gave her $100.00 capital to get started. Everyday she sets out her stove, some tables, and what she has prepared to sell. She sells from 4:00PM to 9:00PM. Her 15 year-old son helps her. She worked from the time she was young cleaning houses. She quit doing this because her children had to stay at home alone, and she was worried about the gangs in the area. Thanks to her work, and that of her husband, they have been able to own their house and the business.

She needs the loan to make a wooden kiosk that she can locate outside of the house, and for tables and plastic chairs.

Inés was born in Esmeralda. She is 42 years old and has four children. Her husband works as a security guard. Inés is a very hardworking and persevering person who has always worked for her family and has always been an important source of support in their home. Inés and her husband hope to get ahead with their jobs and continue prospering, especially in the business and in the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Inés vende: chuzos. Carne azada, arroz con menestra, pollo asado, bollos, tortillas y gaseosas en la esquina de su casa. Tiene 1 año de experiencia en esta actividad. Su esposo le dio el capital para arrancar $ 100. Todos los días saca su fogón, mesas y lo que ha preparado para vender. Ella vende de 4:00PM a 9:00PM. Su hijo de 15 años le ayuda. Ella trabajo desde pequeña arreglando casas. Ella dejo de hacerlo porque sus hijos quedaban solos en casa, y por los grupos de pandilla que existían. Gracias a su trabajo y el de su esposo han podido tener su casa y el negocio.

Ella necesita el préstamo para hacer un kiosco de madera y ubicarlo a fuera de su casa y mesas y sillas plásticas.

Inés nació en Esmeralda, tiene 42 años. Con 4 hijos. Su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad. Siendo un soporte importante en su hogar. Inés es una persona muy trabajadora, perseverante que siempre ha trabajado por su familia. Ellos desean seguir adelante con sus trabajos y seguir prosperando especialmente en el negocio y en la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: To make a wooden kiosk and buy tables and plastic chairs.

loans.name: Nury

texts.en:
Nury has been working for two years selling a natural product line called Herbalife. She used to be overweight and came into contact with this company as a consumer. She saw results and began selling the products. She was given the start-up capital by her daughter, who works. Nury prepares foods with these products and promotes them to her friends. She works in her business from 6:00AM to 1:00PM.

She needs the loan to increase her inventory of natural products so that she can increase her number of clients.

Nury was born in Cañar. She is 39 years old. She has 3 children, one of whom works and helps with household expenses. Her husband left her 5 years ago, but he provides her with a small amount of money every month. Thanks to the efforts of Nury and her daughters, the family is trying to get ahead. With Nury’s profits, they have an income that allows them to cover certain expenses. Nury is an enterprising person who is always looking for something to do. Her aspiration is to strengthen the business and to continue supporting her children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Nury lleva 2 años vendiendo productos naturales Herbalife. Ella sufría de sobre peso e ingreso a esta empresa como consumidora. Ella vio los resultados en ella y se dedico a venderlos. El capital para iniciar se lo dio su hija que trabaja. Nury prepara los alimentos con estos productos y los promociona a sus amigos que ya la conocen. Su negocio se mueve a partir de las 6:00AM hasta las 1:00PM.

Ella necesita el préstamo para incrementar los productos naturales y poder captar más clientes.

Nury nació en Cañar. Tiene 39 años. Con 3 hijos, uno de ellos ya trabaja y apoya en el hogar. Su esposo la dejó desde hace 5 años pero si le pasa una mensualidad pequeña. Gracias al esfuerzo de Nury y sus hijas luchan por salir adelante. Con el ingreso de Nury tienen una entrada que les permite cubrir ciertos gastos. Nury es una persona emprendedora que esta buscando siempre hacer algo, su aspiración es fortalecer bien el negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: To increase inventory of Natural Herbalife products.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena has been working for 15 years in this business. She sells all types of groceries. She began her business at the time she came to live in on Trinitaria Island. She had to close that store for health reasons. Two years ago, she opened it again with the help of her husband, who gave her $200.00 to start over. Her store is in her house. She is open for business from 6:00AM to 10:00PM and her husband helps her when she has to leave.

She needs the loan to incorporate dairy products and meats into her inventory. She would also like to make improvements to the interior of her store.

Filomena was born in Daule – Guayas. She is 55 years old. She has two grown daughters. She is married and her husband works in his own mechanic shop. They are a very close couple who have worked hard ever since they married. With their incomes they have been able to own their house and make improvements to it. It was originally constructed of cane, but now it is of cement. As they are able, they invest in their businesses. They hope to get ahead with their businesses and to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Filomena tiene 15 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Ella vende todo tipo de víveres para la comida. Ella comenzó con su negocio desde que se vino ha vivir en la Isla Trinitaria. Por situaciones de salud tuvo que cerrar la tienda. Hace 2 años la abrió nuevamente con el apoyo de su esposo quién le dio $ 200 para nuevamente iniciar. Su tienda esta en su casa. Ella atiende su negocio de 6:00AM a 10:00PM, su esposo le ayuda cuando ella tiene que salir.

Ella necesita el préstamo para incorporar los productos lácteos y carnes. Y desea acondicionar bien el espacio de su tienda.

Filomena nació en Daule - Guayas. Tiene 55 años. Tiene 2 hijas ya independientes. Esta casada y su esposo trabaja en su propio taller mecánico. Ellos son una pareja muy unida que han luchado desde que se casaron. Con sus ingresos han podido tener su casa y hacerle mejoras ya que al inicio fue de caña y ahora es de cemento, a su vez se ve mejoras en sus negocios. Ellos esperan que sus negocios sigan adelante y seguir trabajando.

loans.use: To incorporate dairy products and meats into her inventory.

loans.name: Narla

texts.en:
Narla has one year of experience in this business. She sells all types of groceries. Before she had her business she worked cleaning houses and cooking. Her husband encouraged her to start a business in their home. He lent her the capital of $300.00, which she repaid from the earnings from her business. Since then, she has managed her store very well. She is open for business from 6:00AM to 11:00PM. The store is located on a main street.

She needs the loan to expand her inventory to include rice, cooking oil, and sugar, as well as dairy products. She hopes to make physical improvements to the store with the income she will generate.

Narla was born in Machala. She is 38 years old. Her husband works as a security guard. Together they have been able to combine their efforts and maintain a household. Narla began working at the age of 12 and continues to work today, especially in her business. They are a very persistent couple and when they set a goal, they achieve it. They aspire to have their business become well established. With the income they generate from it, they hope to improve their home, which is currently constructed of cane.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Narla tiene 1 año de experiencia. Ella vende toda clase de víveres en su negocio. Ella antes de su negocio se dedica a arreglar casa y a cocinar. Su esposo la motivo para que se dedique a un negocio en su casa. El capital su esposo le facilito con un préstamo de $ 300 que hizo en la empresa. Desde allí Inés maneja su tienda muy bien todos los días de 6:00 AM hasta 11:00PM. Esta ubicada en la calle principal.

Ella necesita el préstamo porque desea incrementar sus productos: arroz, aceite, azúcar y también lácteos, con los ingresos generados espera mejorar la parte física de su tienda.

Narla nació en Machala. Tiene 38 años. Su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad. Juntos han podido unir los esfuerzos y poder sostener el hogar. Narla a partir de los 12 años comenzó a trabajar y lo hace hasta ahora especialmente en su negocio. Son una pareja muy empeñosa y cuando se proponen algo lo logran. Su aspiración es estabilizar bien el negocio. Con los ingresos generados esperan más adelante hacer cambios en su casa que actualmente es de caña.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, sugar, and dairy products.

loans.name: Bibi Jan

texts.en:
Bibi Jan 42 years old with her 5 children's living in district 7 Kabul Afghanistan.

Bibi Jan is uneducated women by the helps of there neighborhood she took 1st then 2nd cycle loan through AFSG,She believes that taking more loan they can able to grow up there business and find's a good income for her home.


Bibi Jan is buying string, cotton and fabric ..etc

loans.use: To buy fabric, Cotton, string

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary who born in 1979 with household of 2 living in district 7 Kabul Afghanistan.

Mary who is a educated women but due to family problem she cant able to work outside then she decide to take loan from AFSG and continue the tailoring business in her home.

She hopes to receive more loans through AFSG, who can continue with her business and find more income that she can able to pay her children's fee and house payment.

loans.use: To buy fabric, new muchine

loans.name: Kreema

texts.en:
Kreema is 63 years old with her 8 children's living in district 7 Kabul Afghanistan.

Kreema who has share business with her daughter jamela at home, they are sewing the neighborhoods clothes.

She already finished the 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th loan cycle with positive result now she is continuing with 5th loan cycle through AFSG.

She too loan to buy cotton, new machine, fabric, Generator to increase there business and she can find a income that she can pay the house rent and buy foods for her house.

loans.use: To buy Cotton, Fabric, New muchine

loans.name: Fazila

texts.en:
Fazila is 43 years old with her 6 children's living in district 7 Kabul Afghanistan.

Fazila who has a share business with her son javed in bakery shop near her house.

She past the 1st and 2nd cycle loan with a positive result right now she is continuing with her 3rd loan cycle ,she helps her son to grow up his business and buy lots of materials for his bakery shop like flour, wood and yeast.

She believes that helping her son true his business she can find a good monthly income with this process right now she can able to continue her life without any tension.

loans.use: To buy wood, Flour,

loans.name: Khadeja

texts.en:
Khadeja who born in 1984 with household of 4 living in district 7 Kabul Afghanistan.

Khadeja who has a share business with her husband Ghulam Nabi who has a butcher shop near the market.

Khadeja due to family problem she cant work outside then she decide to take loan from AFSG that her husband can buy sheep's and cow's right now she past the 1st and 2nd cycle loan Continuing with 3rd cycle loan by the helps of her husband that he sale the sheep's and cow's meat to the bazaar now they can able to pay the house rent and fee of there children's.

loans.use: To buy sheep's and cow's

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman was born in 1967 in Fizuli region. He is married, has 4 children. He has rented this shop for 7 years. 
He borrowed a loan of $400 and bought toys and shampoos.
The second loan of $800 he spent to start perfumery business.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to expand the area of his shop.

loans.use: To expand the area of  his shop

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi runs his agricultural business for 10 years. He is  one of the most popular butchers in his region and has lots of customers because his meat is always fresh and delicious. Soon he starts to make delieveries to the most clients.
Having borrowed a loan  of $400 he bought  small cattles. 
The second loan of $800 he spent to buy small cattles in order to chop off and to sell.
Now he requests a loan of $1200 to open a shop for selling meat and meat products. 
He was born in 1958 in Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village, married, has 2 children.

loans.use: To open a shop for selling meat and meat  products

loans.name: Khurshud

texts.en:
Khurshud is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. She runs this business for 7 years and it allows her to support  her family.
She is 42, married, has 3 children, lives in Fizuli region. She wants to offer all to her children an education that allows them to continue their own life and to be an honest and hard-working people.
At the beginning of her business she started retail trade with juices, mineral waters 
Having borrowed a loan of $600 she started to sell agricultural produce: apples, pears, tomatos, cucumbers.
Now she applies for a loan of $800 to open a shop

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir has  his own shop where he sellsphones. He has been in this business for over 8 years.
He is 29, married,has 2 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region Yukhari Dilagar village, settled  on front line in Fizuli region Dilagar village.
He applies for a loan of $1200 to buy: telephones, equipments to repair the telephones.

loans.use: To buy equipments to repair  phones

loans.name: Israfil

texts.en:
Israfil runs this business for 10 years. He is 40, married, has a child, lives in Fizuli region Mahmudlu village.
He needs a loan of $1200 to buy milch cow, fodder and medicinal preparations.

loans.use: To buy a milch cow

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
This 51-year-old man is a very hard-working person, married, has 4 children, lives in Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village.
In the beginning  of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought armature and iron sheets.
The second  loan of $800 he spent to buy iron materials to start manufacturing iron gratings, iron doors.
He manufactures and repaires the iron constructions: iron doors, windows, tanks, gratings.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy welding apparatus. He plans to buy the apparatus for cutting and hewing irons.

loans.use: To buy equipments

loans.name: Johra

texts.en:
Johra runs a small business selling blouses, skirts. Scarfs, slippers. She is married, has 4 children, lives in Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village.
She has been in the clothing business for over 10 years. Her diligent, hard work has helped her succeedin business and maintain clientele.
Johra needs a loan of $1000 to open her own shop.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Ab.qayom

texts.en:
Ab.Qayom who born in kabul with the age of 53 living in district 7 Kabul Afghanistan.

Ab.Qayom who has bakery shop near the market, he past the groups loan and now he took individual loan through AFSG to buy more materials for his bakery shop.
Ab.Qayom living with his 7 children's in a rental house he get loan to increase his business and can able to pay the payment of his house and family expenses.

loans.use: To buy wood, flour, yeast

loans.name: Nafesa

texts.en:
Nafesa is 34 years old and lives with her 5 children in district 8 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

Nafesa has a tailoring and embroidery business in her home, sewing clothes for her neighbours. Because of family problems she can't open a shop in the bazaar.

She took a loan from AFSG to buy a new sowing machine and fabric and other materials. She hopes to continue with her tailoring business so that she can pay the family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy fabric, a new sewing machine and string

loans.name: Siamoi

texts.en:
Siamoi was born in 1982 and lives in a household of 5 in district of 8 Kabul, Afghanistan.

Siamoi does not have an education. She took a loan from AFSG so that she can improve her tailoring and embroidery business.

To begin with she had lots of difficulties coping with the family expenses and the fees for her children's schooling. Then she took a 2nd cycle loan and bought lots of materials like fabric, a machine, etc. Now her business is going well.

loans.use: To buy fabric, a sewing machine and cotton

loans.name: Wajeha

texts.en:
Wajeha was born in 1986 and lives in a household of 10 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

Wajeha shares a business with her father K. L.. They have a TV and video shop in the market. She took a loan so that her father can increase his business and buy CDs, DVDs and videos for his shop.

She also has a tailoring business at home, sewing for the family and the neighborhood. Through this she and her father can make a good income and cover their family expenses.

loans.use: To buy videos, CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Zuhal

texts.en:
Zuhal is 24 years old, a mother of 1, and lives in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Zuhal has a tailoring business, sewing for clients in the neighbourhood. She took a loan to buy a new machine and fabric to make clothes which her husband then sells in the market. She is continuing with a 2nd cycle loan and believes that with the help of AFSG she can grow her business more in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric, new machine

loans.name: Badam Gul

texts.en:
Badam Gul is 40 years old, a mother of 6 children, and lives in district 8 in Kabul, Afghanistan

Badam Gul took a loan for her husband who has a fresh fruits and vegetable shop in the market.

Badam Gul cleans and categorizes the fruits and then her husband sells them in the bazaar. She hopes to receive another loan from AFSG so that she can buy more vegetables and fruits for her husband's shop.

loans.use: To buy fresh apples, bananas and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase a small refrigerator or freezer for making ice and storing yoghurt.

payments.comment: Ruth has began to make ice and freeze it in her new refridgerator, and is also making yorghurt. She had tears in her eyes as she made the first repayment and said she is so greatful to her lenders for the support. She wishes that they can extend such help to others also, so that they can benefit as she has. She says that with time, she will be able to make a higher income to support her family.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra was born in 1980 and is a mother of 5 children. She lives in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Zahra shares a business with her husband M. Afzal and she a took 2nd cycle loan so her husband can buy new tires for his taxi car. By him working in the local area as a taxi driver they can fulfill the financial requirements of their life.

loans.use: To buy new tires

loans.name: Nobert

texts.en:
Nobert is 37 years old. He is married, and has four children. He also takes care of two of his brother’s children after their parents died of HIV.

He does carpentry work, making all kinds of furniture. Nobert has been doing carpentry work since he was 13 years old. He lost his father when he was only two years old, and his mother is blind, so it was very difficult for her to educate him and his siblings. He therefore only attended primary school up to grade 3.

At 13, while living with his brother in Nakuru, he identified a workshop dealing with furniture, and decided wanted to go in and help out, instead of idling around in the village. This is where he learnt his skills in carpentry work.

Norbert started a small carpentry business in Kibera, and since 1993, he has been receiving small contracts from the police in Lang’ata. Since he proved to be faithful, they have continued to give him contracts to either repair or make furniture – especially beds.

Since 2005, Nobert has been receiving support and training in small business management, and through facilitation by ANK, has received loans of $57 and $85 from his group, which he has successfully repaid.

Nobert has recently been awarded a contract to make 50 beds for new police recruits. However, because the contract is of such a big magnitude, he doesn’t have all the funds required to buy all the materials he needs.

Given a loan of $150, he will be in a position to make the first batch of beds, and after the delivery those, he will be able to repay the loan and proceed to make the next batch for delivery. The loan repayment period will be between 4 – 8 months.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make beds for new police recuruits

payments.comment: Nobert is so excited about the loan he received and the difference it has brought, that he decided not to wait till the date agreed upon for the first instalment.

loans.name: Shaharani

texts.en:
Shaharani is married with one child. He lives in Kongowe in the Temeke District of Dar es Salaam. Shaharani owns a shop selling different food items like maize flour, rice, beans, cassava flour, groundnuts and the like. He buys these food items in large quantities from nearby regions, stores them and then resells them for  retail. 

Shaharani is planning to improve his business by having enough stock, especially as the rainy season is starting. Because roads to the up- country are not easily passable during rainy seasons, it is better to have enough stock now.

Extra stock demands some more packaging materials, carriage costs and storage costs.
To make his plan work, Shaharani is in need of $550.

loans.use: To add stocks of food items

loans.name: Awetu

texts.en:
Awetu is married with five children. She lives in an area called Mbagala in Dar es Salaam. Awetu sells 'khanga', a type of cloth worn by women, which is fitted around the waist. The cloth is very famous to the Indigenous residents of Dar es Salaam, the Wazaramo.

This type of cloth is mainly used during the traditional festivals of the Wazaramo people, but it is also used as a casual wear by most women in Tanzania. Awetu is wearing a khanga in her photograph.

Awetu sells these khanga to her customers on credit. Then she collects the debt on a monthly basis. This situation means she needs enough working capital to keep her business going.  She hopes to be able to add to her stock on time, without waiting for the debtors to pay their debts. Awetu is in need of $400 to help her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 30-year old mother of 4 who lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Maryam has a tailoring business in her home. She decided to take a loan from AFSG to buy a new sewing machine, fabric, string, a chair, and other materials to improve her family's income.

Maryam is not only a good mother for her children but also helps her husband.

loans.use: To buy fabric, a new sewing machine, a chair

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en: Hidaya is married with four children. She lives in the Mbagala area in Dar es Salaam. She sells  vegetables and fruits near her residence. She buys fresh produce of fruits and vegetables from nearby villages for resale at a small profit. The business has been her main source of livelihood for the past four years. The business has not grown because she has to make a balance between business and family needs. Her husband is a commuter bus driver. His income does not suffice for the family's numerous needs. The proposed loan will help Hidaya expand her business through the addition of new products. The amount needed to expand her business is USD 550. If her business is expanded, she will be able to meet the challenge of paying school fees for her child who is expected to start secondary education.

loans.use: Adding stock

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya lives in the Mbagala area on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. He is married with two children. He owns a vegetable and fruits stall where he sells different fruits and vegetables. He fetches some of the fresh produce like tomatoes, spinach, oranges, bananas and pineapples from nearby villages. His stall is located near his residence. This location helps him attract many customers because the items must otherwise be obtained in the market which is located a bit far away. Yahaya needs to expand his business to meet a rising demand from his clients. He is planning to have cages for hygiene products and attractive displays. He is also planning to have a bicycle to help him fetch some local produce from nearby areas. To fulfill these requirements he is in need of USD 550 to subsidize his capital.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Najeba

texts.en:
Najeba is a 27-year old mother of 2 children. She lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Najeba married at the age of 22. Because of the bad situation in the country her husband faced some difficulties finding work. With the help of neighbours she took a loan and started a tailoring business at home. She had tailoring experience, but due to financial problem she couldn’t continue her business. Now she has bought a machine and fabric to improve her family income.

loans.use: To buy a new machine, fabric

loans.name: Habibullah

texts.en: Habibullah Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. This 30-year-old single man began his business since she was 16 years old. Because the family condition was very heavy. In the beginning of his business he sold bags. Having borrowed the loan $300 he has bought the 30 couple of shoes. Now he has rented the shoe shop and he needs a loan of $500 to expand the area of a shop and to increase range of shoes.

loans.use: To expand the area of a shop and to increase range of shoes

loans.name: Nagi

texts.en: Nagi was born in 1949 in Yardimli region of Azerbaijan. He has been working in the joiner's shop since 1982. This old man is a well known joiner in Sumgait city. He has 3 children. He is hard worker. Now he wants to buy the lathe, boring mill and additional materials: mahogany and etc. He applies for the loan $600 from KIVA.

loans.use: To buy the lathe, boring mill and additional materials: mahogany and etc.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. She settled with his family in Sumgait city. Nargiz is 37 years old. She vidow and has 2 children. Hers husband was lost on war and she is the only breadwinner in family. In the beginning hers business she rented a small tea-house. Than she has bought chairs, tables and electric stove. Now she has rented cafe. On a dinner break workers have dinner here and clients are very happy with the servant.
She applies for the loan $400 to expand the area and to repair hers cafe.

loans.use: To expand the area and to repair hers cafe

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: 47-year-old Sahib with his 6 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Gubadli region. Since 2001 he has been engaged in meat sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Sahib needs the loan of $3500. He plans to expand his business and to buy a new ax and scales.

loans.use: He plans to expand his business and to buy a new ax and scales.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the goods assortments

loans.name: Abdullaev

texts.en:
A. runs a small business importing clothing from Istanbul and selling it from a little building in the center of his town. He is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Gubadli. He takes care to arrange everything into attractive displays.

The business is going well. He is the only breadwinner in the family. Having borrowed the loan amount of $500 from Normicro he began his business. The second time he borrowed $800 and expanded the range of goods. He needs the loan of $1000 to make the move and re-stock his inventory. He hopes to also offer a greater variety of items, but first he says he will see how things go with what he sells now.

loans.use: To make a move and re-stock his inventory

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en: Yagub sells Shoes. He was born in 1977 in Sumgait. This 30-year-old single man began his business 15 years as borrow-boy. Because the family condition was very heavy. In the beginning of his business he sold clothes. Now he has rented the shop and he needs a loan of $500 to expand the area of a shop and to increase range of shoes.

loans.use: To expand the area of a shop and to increase range of shoes.

loans.name: Samuel & Dorcas

texts.en: Samuel N. is married and a father of 3 daughters in primary school. He runs a clothing shop with his wife Dorcas, and they have been good supporters of PEMCI right from inception. This is his fourth loan with PEMCI. His first two loans of US$715 and the third of US$1450 were paid in a timely manner. He has moved from vending clothes to being a wholesaler. This fourth loan of US$1450 will be used to grow his business further. His wife would also like to sell ladies’ shoes in line with the clothing business. We are proud of what this couple has achieved in a very short time with us, and we have no doubt that they will go a long way with PEMCI. Their ambition is to establish a good foundation for the education of their 3 daughters.

loans.use: Stock the shop

loans.name: Janerose

texts.en: Janerose is an active member of the PEMCI family. She is married with 9 children, all attending school. Her business involves supplying milk in the village and nearby markets. With this business, she helps her husband meet the demands of the family. She has been in the business for four years. She has dairy cows, though they are local breeds. She also buys milk from other farmers and sells it at the nearby markets. With a loan from PEMCI, she plans to increase her production by opening a dairy product shop. Through her business she has gained a great deal of knowledge and skill to the benefit of her fellow women.

loans.use: Purchase additional dairy animals

location.town: Jairos Amagoro Div, Teso District - Keny

loans.name: Lyubov

texts.en:
Lyubov is married with two grown daughters. Her husband had problems with alcohol abuse. This motivated Lyubov to find other ways to support her family so she decided to start her own business selling household items and souvenirs. Lyubov has been in business now for 14 years and has a couple container-stores located at the central city market. Lyubov is very sociable and cheerful. Her positive attitude and smiling face attract many customers. Quick responses to any change in customer demand have helped her be successful in business. Lyubov has demonstrated responsibility and integrity in her relations with her suppliers and customers as well as when she has used lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Prompt loan repayments and stability in her business have demonstrated her trustworthiness and capability of further loan repayment. Lyubov is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase inventory wholesale. She is planning to buy dishware, towels, vases and a variety of souvenirs in bulk which will sell really well. Eventually Lyubov would like to expand her business and start selling at other locations. Increased inventory turnover will generate the necessary funds to sustain her business as well as meet her family’s needs.

Любов – одружена, в неї дві дорослі дочки. В її чоловіка були проблеми з алкоголем. Отже, Любов була змушена шукати можливостей забезпечити свою родину. Вона вирішила почати власну справу з продажу побутових товарів та сувенірів. Любов – власниця двох крамниць-контейнерів на центральному ринку міста, займається цим бізнесом вже 14 років. Любов – дуже комунікабельна та жвава. Її ввічливе ставлення до оточуючих та привітна посмішка завжди приваблюють багато покупців. Любов вміє швидко реагувати на будь-які зміни попиту клієнтів, а це допомагає їй досягати успіху в бізнесі. Любов – дуже відповідальна та порядна у відносинах з постачальниками, покупцями та співробітниками „Надії України”. Вона вже давно користується кредитними послугами цієї організації. Вчасна сплата позик та стабільність її бізнесу підтверджують, що Любов спроможна сплатити чергову позику. Любов просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб закупити товар оптом. Вона планує придбати посуд, рушники, різноманітні сувеніри, які завжди користуються попитом серед покупців. Врешті-решт Любов хотіла б розширити свій бізнес, відкрити крамничку десь в центрі міста. Більший асортимент товарів допоможе їй зібрати необхідні для цього кошти, а також забезпечити усі потреби її родини.

loans.use: To purchase inventory wholesale

loans.name: Jose Salim

texts.en:
Jose Salim M. is a farmer from a rural town named Salitre. He is part of the first Communal Bank in the new Mifex Rural Finance Program. All the members of the Resistencia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named Resistencia. They will use the microloans to prepare the land and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Resistencia Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but it is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Salim, as he is most commonly known, owns a ranch named Hacienda Voluntad de Dios. He has more than 20 years of experience in agriculture and ranching. His staple crop is rice, but he also has several cows and bulls. He and his wife have 3 kids who all help their father with the duties on the ranch. Salim hopes to provide them with an education so that they may expand their horizons.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural area in the Province of Guayas which is known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture, which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to rice farming and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year during the rainy season on the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There is not a single financial institution that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The only access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous area despite its rural location. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in the fact that many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention force.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding during the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worst when El Niño occurs, rice farmers lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: He is a farmer who will use the loan to cultivate rice

payments.comment: 2do pago de asociacion resistencia de salitre

Wilman S. is a rice farmer from a rural town named Salitre. He and his wife Blanca have 4 children together, all of which are grown up and contribute to their farm. They own a small number of cows and bulls, as well as chickens and other livestock. Like most people in the area, they depend on rice farming for their income.

He complements his rice production with cattle ranching. Javier has four children ages 14, 13, 10 and 2. He hopes he can use the loan to increase his productivity. He hopes to be able to provide his children with an education better than the one he received.

loans.name: Karla Yvonne

texts.en:
Karla S. is young widow in the town of Salitre. After losing her husband, her parents gave her a small plot of land for her to start working on. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to adequately prepare her small farm for production. Her parents also helped her attain special agricultural training. She hopes this loan will allow her to apply her skills and be a successful independent woman.

Angel C. owns a rice farm in Salitre, Ecuador. He has been a farmer his whole life in this area, where rice is the primary crop. Angel has livestock on his farm as a secondary source of income. He raises chicken and grows many different fruits for personal consumption and small sales. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to more efficiently plant rice and involve his 3 children in the activities. They are all almost done with school and are interested in taking part in the family business.
